  8585 00000352 A820                    		test	al, 20h		; test data set	ready
  8586 00000354 74F6                    		jz	short auxbus	; then device is busy (not ready)
  8587 00000356 F6C420                  		test	ah, 20h		; flag_tranhol_emp - test transmit hold	reg empty
  8588 00000359 74F1                    		jz	short auxbus	; then device is busy (not ready)
  8589                                  		; 12/12/2022
  8590                                  		; cf=0	; (test instruction resets cf)
  8591                                  		;clc
  8592 0000035B C3                      		retn
  8593                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  8594                                  
  8595                                  ;************************************************************************
  8596                                  ;*									*
  8597                                  ;*	auxstat - call rom bios to determine aux port status		*
  8598                                  ;*									*
  8599                                  ;*	exit:	ax = status						*
  8600                                  ;*		dx = [auxnum]						*
  8601                                  ;*									*
  8602                                  ;************************************************************************
  8603                                  
  8604                                  auxstat:				
  8605 0000035C B403                    		mov	ah, 3		; auxfunc_status
  8606                                  
  8607                                  		; fall into auxop
  8608                                  
  8609                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
  8610                                  
  8611                                  ;************************************************************************
  8612                                  ;*									*
  8613                                  ;*	auxop - perform rom-biox aux port interrupt			*
  8614                                  ;*									*
  8615                                  ;*	entry:	ah = int 14h function number				*
  8616                                  ;*	exit:	ax = results						*
  8617                                  ;*		dx = [auxnum]						*
  8618                                  ;*									*
  8619                                  ;************************************************************************
  8620                                  
  8621                                  auxop:		; proc near		
  8622 0000035E 8B16[2100]              		mov	dx, [auxnum]	; ah=function code
  8623                                  					; 0=init, 1=send, 2=receive, 3=status
  8624                                  					; get port number
  8625 00000362 CD14                    		int	14h		; SERIAL I/O - GET USART STATUS
  8626                                  					; DX = port number (0-3)
  8627                                  					; Return: AX = port status code
  8628 00000364 C3                      		retn
  8629                                  
  8630                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  8631                                  
  8632                                  ;************************************************************************
  8633                                  ;*									*
  8634                                  ;*	aux_flsh - flush aux input buffer - set contents of		*
  8635                                  ;*		   auxbuf [auxnum] to zero				*
  8636                                  ;*									*
  8637                                  ;*	cas - shouldn't this code call the rom bios input function	*
  8638                                  ;*	      repeatedly until it isn't ready?  to flush out any	*
  8639                                  ;*	      pending serial input queue if there's a tsr like MODE	*
  8640                                  ;*	      which is providing interrupt-buffering of aux port?	*
  8641                                  ;*									*
  8642                                  ;************************************************************************
  8643                                  
  8644                                  aux_flsh:				; 2C7h:36Ch = 70h:28DCh
  8645 00000365 E81C00                  		call	getbx		; flush	aux input buffer
  8646 00000368 C60700                  		mov	byte [bx], 0	; get bx to point to auxbuf
  8647                                  					; zero out buffer
  8648                                  		;clc			; all done, successful return
  8649                                  		; 12/12/2022
  8650                                  		; cf=0 ('add' instruction in 'getbx')
  8651 0000036B C3                      		retn
  8652                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  8653                                  
  8654                                  ;************************************************************************
  8655                                  ;*									*
  8656                                  ;*	aux_writ - write to aux device					*
  8657                                  ;*									*
  8658                                  ;************************************************************************
  8659                                  
  8660                                  aux_writ:				; 2C7h:374h = 70h:28E4h
  8661                                  		;jcxz	short exvec2	; write	to aux device (if cx > 0)
  8662 0000036C E3AF                    		jcxz	exvec2		; 19/10/2022
  8663                                  aux_loop:				
  8664 0000036E 268A05                  		mov	al, [es:di]	; get character	to be written
  8665                                  					; move di pointer to next character
  8666 00000371 47                      		inc	di
  8667 00000372 B401                    		mov	ah, 1		; auxfunc_send - indicates a write
  8668 00000374 E8E7FF                  		call	auxop		; send character over aux port
  8669 00000377 F6C480                  		test	ah, 80h		; check	for error
  8670 0000037A 7405                    		jz	short awok	; then no error
  8671 0000037C B00A                    		mov	al, 10		; else indicate	write fault
  8672 0000037E E95AFD                  		jmp	bc_err_cnt	; call error routines
  8673                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  8674                                  
  8675                                  awok:					
  8676 00000381 E2EB                    		loop	aux_loop	; if cx	is non-zero,
  8677                                  					; still	more character to print
  8678                                  		;clc			; all done, successful return
  8679                                  		; 12/12/2022
  8680                                  		; cf=0 (test instruction above)	
  8681 00000383 C3                      		retn
  8682                                  
  8683                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
  8684                                  
  8685                                  ;************************************************************************
  8686                                  ;*									*
  8687                                  ;*	getbx - return bx -> single byte input buffer for		*
  8688                                  ;*		selected aux port ([auxnum])				*
  8689                                  ;*									*
  8690                                  ;************************************************************************
  8691                                  
  8692                                  getbx:	
  8693 00000384 8B1E[2100]              		mov	bx, [auxnum]	; return bx -> single byte input buffer
  8694                                  					; for selected aux port	([auxnum])
  8695                                  		;add	bx, offset auxbuf
  8696 00000388 81C3[1600]              		add	bx, auxbuf	; 19/10/2022
  8697                                  		; 12/12/2022
  8698                                  		; cf=0 (if [uaxnum] is valid number) 
  8699 0000038C C3                      		retn
  8700                                  
  8701                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  8702                                  
  8703                                  ; 15/10/2022
  8704                                  
  8705                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------
  8706                                  ;								:
  8707                                  ;		    clock device driver 			:
  8708                                  ;								:
  8709                                  ;								:
  8710                                  ;   this file contains the clock device driver. 		:
  8711                                  ;								:
  8712                                  ;   the routines in this files are:				:
  8713                                  ;								:
  8714                                  ;	routine 		function			:
  8715                                  ;	------- 		--------			:
  8716                                  ;	tim_writ		set the current time		:
  8717                                  ;	tim_read		read the current time		:
  8718                                  ;	time_to_ticks		convert time to corresponding	:
  8719                                  ;				  number of clock ticks 	:
  8720                                  ;								:
  8721                                  ; the clock ticks at the rate of:				:
  8722                                  ;								:
  8723                                  ;	1193180/65536 ticks/second (about 18.2 ticks per second):
  8724                                  ; see each routine for information on the use.			:
  8725                                  ;								:
  8726                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------
  8727                                  
  8728                                  ; convert time to ticks
  8729                                  ; input : time in cx and dx
  8730                                  ; ticks returned in cx:dx
  8731                                  
  8732                                  ;19/07/2019
  8733                                  ;09/03/2019
  8734                                  
  8735                                  time_to_ticks:				; 0070h:2906h =	02C7h:0396h
  8736                                  
  8737                                  ; first convert from hour,min,sec,hund. to
  8738                                  ; total number of 100th of seconds
  8739                                  
  8740 0000038D B03C                    		mov	al, 60
  8741 0000038F F6E5                    		mul	ch		; hours	to minutes
  8742 00000391 B500                    		mov	ch, 0
  8743 00000393 01C8                    		add	ax, cx		; total	minutes
  8744 00000395 B97017                  		mov	cx, 6000	; 60*100
  8745 00000398 89D3                    		mov	bx, dx		; get out of the way of	the multiply
  8746 0000039A F7E1                    		mul	cx		; convert to 1/100 sec
  8747 0000039C 89C1                    		mov	cx, ax
  8748 0000039E B064                    		mov	al, 100
  8749 000003A0 F6E7                    		mul	bh		; convert seconds to 1/100 sec
  8750 000003A2 01C1                    		add	cx, ax		; combine seconds with hours and min
  8751 000003A4 83D200                  		adc	dx, 0		; ripple carry
  8752 000003A7 B700                    		mov	bh, 0
  8753 000003A9 01D9                    		add	cx, bx		; combine 1/100	sec
  8754 000003AB 83D200                  		adc	dx, 0
  8755                                  
  8756                                  	; dx:cx is time in 1/100 sec
  8757                                  
  8758 000003AE 92                      		xchg	ax, dx
  8759 000003AF 91                      		xchg	ax, cx		; now time is in cx:ax
  8760 000003B0 BB0BE9                  		mov	bx, 59659
  8761 000003B3 F7E3                    		mul	bx		; multiply low half
  8762 000003B5 87D1                    		xchg	dx, cx
  8763 000003B7 92                      		xchg	ax, dx		; cx->ax, ax->dx, dx->cx
  8764 000003B8 F7E3                    		mul	bx		; multiply high	half
  8765 000003BA 01C8                    		add	ax, cx		; combine overlapping products
  8766 000003BC 83D200                  		adc	dx, 0
  8767 000003BF 92                      		xchg	ax, dx		; ax:dx=time*59659
  8768 000003C0 BB0500                  		mov	bx, 5
  8769 000003C3 F6F3                    		div	bl		; divide high half by 5
  8770 000003C5 88C1                    		mov	cl, al
  8771 000003C7 B500                    		mov	ch, 0
  8772 000003C9 88E0                    		mov	al, ah		; remainder of divide-by-5
  8773 000003CB 98                      		cbw
  8774 000003CC 92                      		xchg	ax, dx		; use it to extend low half
  8775 000003CD F7F3                    		div	bx		; divide low half by 5
  8776 000003CF 89C2                    		mov	dx, ax		; cx:dx	is now number of ticks in time
  8777 000003D1 CB                      		retf			; far return
  8778                                  
  8779                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  8780                                  
  8781                                  ; 17/10/2022
  8782                                  ; 15/10/2022
  8783                                  
  8784                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------
  8785                                  ;
  8786                                  ; tim_writ sets the current time
  8787                                  ;
  8788                                  ; on entry es:[di] has the current time:
  8789                                  ;
  8790                                  ;	number of days since 1-1-80	(word)
  8791                                  ;	minutes (0-59)			(byte)
  8792                                  ;	hours (0-23)			(byte)
  8793                                  ;	hundredths of seconds (0-99)	(byte)
  8794                                  ;	seconds (0-59)			(byte)
  8795                                  ;
  8796                                  ; each number has been checked for the correct range.
  8797                                  ;
  8798                                  ;	NOTE: Any changes in this routine probably require corresponding
  8799                                  ;	changes in the version that is built with the power manager driver.
  8800                                  ;	See ptime.asm.
  8801                                  ;
  8802                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------
  8803                                  
  8804                                  	; 08/08/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 IO.SYS (optimization)
  8805                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMBIO.COM - BIOSCODE:03EAh
  8806                                  tim_writ:				; 2C7h:3DBh = 70h:294Bh
  8807 000003D2 268B05                  		mov	ax, [es:di]
  8808 000003D5 50                      		push	ax		; daycnt. we need to set this at the very
  8809                                  					; end to avoid tick windows.
  8810 000003D6 803E[F304]00            		cmp	byte [havecmosclock], 0
  8811                                  		;cmp	ds:havecmosclock, 0
  8812 000003DB 7423                    		jz	short no_cmos_1
  8813 000003DD 268A4503                		mov	al, [es:di+3]	; near indirect	calls
  8814                                  					; get binary hours
  8815                                  					; convert to bcd
  8816                                  		;call	far [bintobcd]
  8817                                  		;;call	ds:bintobcd	; call far [bintobcd]
  8818                                  		; 08/08/2023
  8819 000003E1 E8E800                  		call	bintobcd
  8820 000003E4 88C5                    		mov	ch, al		; ch = bcd hours
  8821 000003E6 268A4502                		mov	al, [es:di+2]	; get binary minutes
  8822                                  		;call	far [bintobcd]
  8823                                  		;;call	ds:bintobcd	; convert to bcd
  8824 000003EA E8DF00                  		call	bintobcd
  8825 000003ED 88C1                    		mov	cl, al		; cl = bcd minutes
  8826 000003EF 268A4505                		mov	al, [es:di+5]	; get binary seconds
  8827                                  		;call	far [bintobcd]
  8828                                  		;;call	ds:bintobcd
  8829 000003F3 E8D600                  		call	bintobcd
  8830                                  
  8831 000003F6 88C6                    		mov	dh, al		; dh = bcd seconds
  8832 000003F8 B200                    		mov	dl, 0		; dl = 0 (st) or 1 (dst)
  8833 000003FA FA                      		cli
  8834 000003FB B403                    		mov	ah, 3
  8835 000003FD CD1A                    		int	1Ah		; CLOCK	- SET REAL TIME	CLOCK (AT,XT286,CONV,PS)
  8836                                  					; CH = hours in	BCD, CL	= minutes in BCD
  8837                                  					;  DH =	seconds	in BCD,DL = 01h	if daylight savings, 00h if standard time
  8838                                  					; Return: CMOS clock set
  8839 000003FF FB                      		sti
  8840                                  no_cmos_1:				
  8841 00000400 268B4D02                		mov	cx, [es:di+2]
  8842 00000404 268B5504                		mov	dx, [es:di+4]
  8843                                  		; 17/10/2022
  8844 00000408 FF1E[C106]              		call	far [ttticks]
  8845                                  		;call	dword ptr ds:ttticks ; call far	[ttticks]
  8846                                  					; convert time to ticks
  8847                                  					; cx:dx	now has	time in	ticks
  8848 0000040C FA                      		cli			; turn off timer
  8849 0000040D B401                    		mov	ah, 1
  8850 0000040F CD1A                    		int	1Ah		; CLOCK	- SET TIME OF DAY
  8851                                  					; CX:DX	= clock	count
  8852                                  					; Return: time of day set
  8853                                  		;pop	ds:daycnt
  8854 00000411 8F06[F004]              		pop	word [daycnt]
  8855 00000415 FB                      		sti
  8856                                  		;cmp	ds:havecmosclock, 0
  8857 00000416 803E[F304]00            		cmp	byte [havecmosclock], 0
  8858 0000041B 7409                    		jz	short no_cmos_2
  8859                                  
  8860                                  		; 08/08/2023
  8861                                  		;call	far [daycnttoday]
  8862                                  		;;call	ds:daycnttoday	; call far [daycnttoday]
  8863                                  					; convert to bcd format
  8864 0000041D E80700                  		call	daycnttoday
  8865                                  
  8866 00000420 FA                      		cli
  8867 00000421 B405                    		mov	ah, 5
  8868 00000423 CD1A                    		int	1Ah		; CLOCK	- SET DATE IN REAL TIME	CLOCK (AT,XT286,CONV,PS)
  8869                                  					; DL = day in BCD, DH =	month in BCD, CL = year	in BCD
  8870                                  					; CH = century (19h or 20h)
  8871                                  					; Return: CMOS clock set
  8872 00000425 FB                      		sti
  8873                                  no_cmos_2:
  8874                                  		; 12/12/2022
  8875                                  		; cf=0
  8876                                  		;clc
  8877 00000426 C3                      		retn
  8878                                  
  8879                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  8880                                  
  8881                                  ; 08/08/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 IO.SYS (optimization)
  8882                                  ; PCDOS 7.1 IBMBIO.COM - BIOSCODE:0440h
  8883                                  %if 1 
  8884                                  
  8885                                  ; CMOS Clock setting support routines used by MSCLOCK.
  8886                                  ; Warning!!! This code will be dynamically relocated by MSINIT.
  8887                                  
  8888                                  daycnttoday:	; proc near
  8889                                  
  8890                                  ; entry: [daycnt] = number of days since 1-1-80
  8891                                  ;
  8892                                  ; return: ch - century in bcd
  8893                                  ;	  cl - year in bcd
  8894                                  ;	  dh - month in bcd
  8895                                  ;	  dl - day in bcd
  8896                                  
  8897                                  		; 08/08/2023 (ds:) (near proc)
  8898                                  		; 16/10/2022 (cs:) (far proc)		
  8899 00000427 FF36[F004]              		push	word [daycnt] ; save daycnt
  8900 0000042B 813E[F004]891C          		cmp	word [daycnt], 7305 ; (365*20+(20/4))
  8901                                  					; # days from 1-1-1980 to 1-1-2000
  8902 00000431 7308                    		jnb	short century20
  8903                                  		;mov	byte [base_century], 19
  8904                                  		;mov	byte [base_year], 80
  8905                                  		; 08/08/2023
  8906 00000433 C706[F404]1350          		mov	word [base_century], 5013h
  8907 00000439 EB0C                    		jmp	short years
  8908                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  8909                                  		
  8910                                  century20:				
  8911                                  		;mov	byte [base_century], 20
  8912                                  		;mov	byte [base_year], 0
  8913                                  		; 08/08/2023
  8914 0000043B C706[F404]1400          		mov	word [base_century], 20
  8915 00000441 812E[F004]891C          		sub	word [daycnt], 7305 ; (365*20+(20/4))
  8916                                  					; adjust daycnt
  8917                                  years:					
  8918 00000447 31D2                    		xor	dx, dx
  8919 00000449 A1[F004]                		mov	ax, [daycnt]
  8920 0000044C BBB505                  		mov	bx, 1461	; (366+365*3)
  8921                                  					; # of days in a Leap year block
  8922 0000044F F7F3                    		div	bx		; AX = # of leap block,	DX = daycnt
  8923 00000451 8916[F004]              		mov	[daycnt], dx	; save daycnt left
  8924 00000455 B304                    		mov	bl, 4
  8925 00000457 F6E3                    		mul	bl		; AX = # of years. Less	than 100
  8926 00000459 0006[F504]              		add	[base_year], al ; So, ah = 0. Adjust year
  8927 0000045D FF06[F004]              		inc	word [daycnt]	; set daycnt to	1 base
  8928                                  		; 08/08/2023
  8929 00000461 BB6E01                  		mov	bx, 366
  8930 00000464 B90300                  		mov	cx, 3
  8931                                  		;cmp	word [daycnt], 366 ; daycnt=remainder of leap year
  8932 00000467 391E[F004]              		cmp	[daycnt], bx ; 366
  8933 0000046B 7619                    		jbe	short leapyear	; within 366+355+355+355 days.
  8934 0000046D FE06[F504]              		inc	byte [base_year] ; if daycnt <= 366, then leap year
  8935                                  		;sub	word [daycnt], 366 ; else daycnt--, base_year++ ;
  8936 00000471 291E[F004]              		sub	[daycnt], bx ; 366 ; 08/08/2023
  8937                                  		;mov	cx, 3		; And next three years are normal
  8938                                  regularyear:	
  8939                                  		; 08/08/2023
  8940 00000475 4B                      		dec	bx ; 365			
  8941                                  		;cmp	word [daycnt], 365 ; for(i=1; i>3 or daycnt <=365; i++)
  8942 00000476 391E[F004]              		cmp	[daycnt], bx ; 365 ; 08/08/2023
  8943 0000047A 760F                    		jbe	short yeardone	; {if (daycnt >	365)
  8944 0000047C FE06[F504]              		inc	byte [base_year] ; { daycnt -=	365
  8945                                  		;sub	word [daycnt], 365 ; }
  8946 00000480 291E[F004]              		sub	[daycnt], bx ; 365 ; 08/08/2023 
  8947 00000484 E2EF                    		loop	regularyear	; }
  8948                                  					;
  8949                                  					; should never fall through loop
  8950                                  leapyear:	
  8951 00000486 C606[F704]1D            		mov	byte [february], 29 ; 08/08/2023			
  8952                                  		;mov	byte [month_tab+1], 29 ; leap year.
  8953                                  					; change month table.
  8954                                  yeardone:				
  8955 0000048B 31DB                    		xor	bx, bx
  8956 0000048D 31D2                    		xor	dx, dx
  8957 0000048F A1[F004]                		mov	ax, [daycnt]
  8958                                  		;mov	si, offset month_tab
  8959 00000492 BE[F604]                		mov	si, month_tab	; 19/10/2022
  8960                                  		;mov	cx, 12
  8961                                  		; 08/08/2023
  8962 00000495 B10C                    		mov	cl, 12
  8963                                  months:					
  8964 00000497 FEC3                    		inc	bl
  8965                                  		; 08/08/2023
  8966 00000499 8A14                    		mov	dl, [si]	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMBIO.COM - BIOSCODE:04B7h
  8967 0000049B 39D0                    		cmp	ax, dx		; cmp daycnt for each month till fit
  8968                                  					; dh=0
  8969 0000049D 7605                    		jbe	short month_done
  8970 0000049F 46                      		inc	si		; next month
  8971 000004A0 29D0                    		sub	ax, dx		; adjust daycnt
  8972 000004A2 E2F3                    		loop	months		;
  8973                                  					; should never fall through loop
  8974                                  month_done:	
  8975 000004A4 C606[F704]1C            		mov	byte [february], 28 ; 08/08/2023
  8976                                  		;mov	byte [month_tab+1], 28
  8977                                  					; restore month table value
  8978 000004A9 88DA                    		mov	dl, bl
  8979 000004AB 8A36[F504]              		mov	dh, [base_year]
  8980 000004AF 8A0E[F404]              		mov	cl, [base_century] ; al=day,dl=month,dh=year,cl=cntry
  8981 000004B3 E81600                  		call	bintobcd	; convert "day"	to bcd
  8982                                  					; dl = bcd day,	al = month
  8983 000004B6 86D0                    		xchg	dl, al
  8984 000004B8 E81100                  		call	bintobcd	; dh = bcd month, al = year
  8985 000004BB 86F0                    		xchg	dh, al
  8986 000004BD E80C00                  		call	bintobcd	; cl = bcd year, al = century
  8987 000004C0 86C8                    		xchg	cl, al
  8988 000004C2 E80700                  		call	bintobcd	; ch = bcd century
  8989 000004C5 88C5                    		mov	ch, al
  8990 000004C7 8F06[F004]              		pop	word [daycnt] ; restore original value
  8991 000004CB C3                      		retn
  8992                                  
  8993                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  8994                                  
  8995                                  bintobcd:	; proc near		; real time clock support
  8996                                  
  8997                                  ;convert a binary input in al (less than 63h or 99 decimal)
  8998                                  ;into a bcd value in al. ah destroyed.	
  8999                                  		
  9000 000004CC D40A                    		aam			; AH = AL/10, AL = AL MOD 10
  9001 000004CE D510                    		aad     10h             ; db 0D5h,10h
  9002                                  					; AL = (AH*10H)+AL, AH = 0
  9003 000004D0 C3                      		retn
  9004                                  %endif
  9005                                  
  9006                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9007                                  
  9008                                  ; 15/10/2022
  9009                                  
  9010                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9011                                  ; gettime reads date and time
  9012                                  ; and returns the following information:
  9013                                  ;
  9014                                  ;	es:[di]  =count of days since 1-1-80
  9015                                  ;	es:[di+2]=hours
  9016                                  ;	es:[di+3]=minutes
  9017                                  ;	es:[di+4]=seconds
  9018                                  ;	es:[di+5]=hundredths of seconds
  9019                                  ;
  9020                                  ;	NOTE:  Any changes in this routine probably require corresponding
  9021                                  ;	changes in the version that is built with the power manager driver.
  9022                                  ;	See ptime.asm.
  9023                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9024                                  
  9025                                  tim_read:				; 2C7h:435h = 70h:29A5h
  9026 000004D1 E84B00                  		call	GetTickCnt
  9027 000004D4 8B36[F004]              		mov	si, [daycnt]
  9028                                  
  9029                                  ; we now need to convert the time in tick to the time in 100th of
  9030                                  ; seconds. the relation between tick and seconds is:
  9031                                  ;
  9032                                  ;		 65,536 seconds
  9033                                  ;	       ----------------
  9034                                  ;		1,193,180 tick
  9035                                  ;
  9036                                  ; to get to 100th of second we need to multiply by 100. the equation is:
  9037                                  ;
  9038                                  ;	ticks from clock  * 65,536 * 100
  9039                                  ;      --------------------------------- = time in 100th of seconds
  9040                                  ;		1,193,180
  9041                                  ;
  9042                                  ; fortunately this formula simplifies to:
  9043                                  ;
  9044                                  ;	ticks from clock * 5 * 65,536
  9045                                  ;      --------------------------------- = time in 100th of seconds
  9046                                  ;		59,659
  9047                                  ;
  9048                                  ; the calculation is done by first multipling tick by 5. next we divide by
  9049                                  ; 59,659. in this division we multiply by 65,536 by shifting the dividend
  9050                                  ; my 16 bits to the left.
  9051                                  ;
  9052                                  ; start with ticks in cx:dx
  9053                                  ; multiply by 5
  9054                                  
  9055 000004D8 89C8                    		mov	ax, cx
  9056 000004DA 89D3                    		mov	bx, dx		; start	with ticks in cx:dx
  9057                                  					; multiply by 5
  9058 000004DC D1E2                    		shl	dx, 1
  9059 000004DE D1D1                    		rcl	cx, 1		; times	2
  9060 000004E0 D1E2                    		shl	dx, 1
  9061 000004E2 D1D1                    		rcl	cx, 1		; times	4
  9062 000004E4 01DA                    		add	dx, bx
  9063 000004E6 11C8                    		adc	ax, cx		; times	5
  9064 000004E8 92                      		xchg	ax, dx
  9065                                  
  9066                                  ; now have ticks * 5 in	dx:ax
  9067                                  ; we now need to multiply by 65536 and divide by 59659 d.
  9068                                  
  9069 000004E9 B90BE9                  		mov	cx, 59659	; get divisor
  9070 000004EC F7F1                    		div	cx		; dx now has remainder
  9071                                  					; ax has high word of final quotient
  9072                                  
  9073                                  		; 08/08/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 IO.SYS (optimization)
  9074                                  		;mov	bx, ax		; put high word	in safe	place
  9075 000004EE 93                      		xchg	bx, ax
  9076 000004EF 31C0                    		xor	ax, ax		; this is the multiply by 65536
  9077 000004F1 F7F1                    		div	cx		; bx:ax	now has	time in	100th of seconds
  9078                                  
  9079                                  ; rounding based on the	remainder may be added here
  9080                                  ; the result in	bx:ax is time in 1/100 second.
  9081                                  
  9082 000004F3 89DA                    		mov	dx, bx		
  9083 000004F5 B9C800                  		mov	cx, 200		; extract 1/100's
  9084                                  
  9085                                  ; division by 200 is necessary to ensure no overflow--max result
  9086                                  ; is number of seconds in a day/2 = 43200.
  9087                                  
  9088 000004F8 F7F1                    		div	cx
  9089 000004FA 80FA64                  		cmp	dl, 100		; remainder over 100?
  9090 000004FD 7203                    		jb	short noadj
  9091 000004FF 80EA64                  		sub	dl, 100		; keep 1/100's less than 100
  9092                                  noadj:					
  9093 00000502 F5                      		cmc			; if we	subtracted 100,	carry is now set
  9094 00000503 88D3                    		mov	bl, dl		; save 1/100's
  9095                                  
  9096                                  ; to compensate	for dividing by	200 instead of 100, we now multiply
  9097                                  ; by two, shifting a one in if the remainder had exceeded 100.
  9098                                  
  9099 00000505 D1D0                    		rcl	ax, 1		
  9100 00000507 B200                    		mov	dl, 0
  9101 00000509 D1D2                    		rcl	dx, 1
  9102 0000050B B93C00                  		mov	cx, 60		; divide out seconds
  9103 0000050E F7F1                    		div	cx
  9104 00000510 88D7                    		mov	bh, dl		; save the seconds
  9105 00000512 F6F1                    		div	cl		; break	into hours and minutes
  9106 00000514 86C4                    		xchg	al, ah
  9107                                  
  9108                                  ; time is now in ax:bx (hours, minutes, seconds, 1/100 sec)
  9109                                  
  9110                                  		; 08/08/2023
  9111                                  		;push	ax
  9112                                  		;mov	ax, si		; daycnt
  9113 00000516 96                      		xchg	ax, si
  9114 00000517 AB                      		stosw
  9115                                  		;pop	ax
  9116 00000518 96                      		xchg	ax, si		; al = hours, ah = minutes
  9117 00000519 AB                      		stosw
  9118 0000051A 89D8                    		mov	ax, bx
  9119 0000051C AB                      		stosw
  9120 0000051D F8                      		clc			; [es:di] = count of days since 1-1-80
  9121                                  					;   [es:di+2] = hours
  9122                                  					;   [es:di+3] = minutes
  9123                                  					;   [es:di+4] = seconds
  9124                                  					;   [es:di+5] = hundredths of seconds
  9125 0000051E C3                      		retn
  9126                                  
  9127                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
  9128                                  
  9129                                  ; 15/10/2022
  9130                                  
  9131                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9132                                  ;
  9133                                  ; procedure : GetTickCnt
  9134                                  ;
  9135                                  ;		Returns the tick count in CX:DX. Takes care of DayCnt in case
  9136                                  ;		of rollover [except when power management driver is in use]. 
  9137                                  ;		Uses the following logic for updating Daycnt
  9138                                  ;
  9139                                  ;		if ( rollover ) {
  9140                                  ;			if ( t_switch )
  9141                                  ;				daycnt++ ;
  9142                                  ;			else
  9143                                  ;				daycnt += rollover ;
  9144                                  ;		}
  9145                                  ;
  9146                                  ; USES : AX
  9147                                  ;
  9148                                  ; RETURNS : CX:DX - tick count
  9149                                  ; MODIFIES : daycnt
  9150                                  ;
  9151                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9152                                  
  9153                                  		; 17/10/2022
  9154                                  GetTickCnt:	
  9155 0000051F 30E4                    		xor	ah, ah
  9156 00000521 CD1A                    		int	1Ah		; CLOCK	- GET TIME OF DAY
  9157                                  					; Return: CX:DX	= clock	count
  9158                                  					; AL = 00h if clock was	read or	written	(via AH=0,1) since the previous
  9159                                  					; midnight
  9160                                  					; Otherwise, AL	> 0
  9161 00000523 803E[F204]00            		cmp	byte [t_switch], 0 ; use old method ? (>0 is yes)
  9162 00000528 7507                    		jnz	short inc_case	; old method assumes  that Int 1Ah returns rollover flag
  9163 0000052A 30E4                    		xor	ah, ah		; new method assumes that Int 1Ah returns roll over count
  9164                                  					; and not flag
  9165 0000052C 0106[F004]              		add	[daycnt], ax
  9166 00000530 C3                      		retn
  9167                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9168                                  
  9169                                  inc_case:				
  9170 00000531 08C0                    		or	al, al
  9171 00000533 7404                    		jz	short no_rollover
  9172 00000535 FF06[F004]              		inc	word [daycnt]
  9173                                  no_rollover:				
  9174 00000539 C3                      		retn
  9175

  9181

  9183                                  ; 26/05/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
  9184                                  ; 23/03/2018 - Retro DOS v2.0
  9185

  9203                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------
  9204                                  ;	disk interface routines
  9205                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------
  9206                                  
  9207                                  ; device attribute bits:
  9208                                  ;	bit 6 - get/set map for logical drives and generic ioctl.
  9209                                  
  9210                                  ;MAXERR		equ	5
  9211                                  ;MAX_HD_FMT_ERR	equ	2
  9212                                  
  9213                                  ;LSTDRV	equ 504h
  9214                                  
  9215                                  ; some floppies do not have changeline. as a result, media-check would
  9216                                  ; normally return i-don't-know, the dos would continually reread the fat and
  9217                                  ; discard cached data. we optimize this by implementing a logical door-latch:
  9218                                  ; it is physically impossible to change a disk in under 2 seconds. we retain
  9219                                  ; the time of the last successful disk operation and compare it with the current
  9220                                  ; time during media-check. if < 2 seconds and at least 1 timer tick has passed,
  9221                                  ; the we say no change. if > 2 seconds then we say i-don't-know. finally, 
  9222                                  ; since we cannot trust the timer to be always available, we record the number 
  9223                                  ; of media checks that have occurred when no apparent time has elapsed. while
  9224                                  ; this number is < a given threshold, we say no change. when it exceeds that
  9225                                  ; threshold, we say i-don't-know and reset the counter to 0. when we store 
  9226                                  ; the time of last successful access, if we see that time has passed too,
  9227                                  ; we reset the counter.
  9228                                  
  9229                                  accessmax	equ	5
  9230                                  
  9231                                  ; due to various bogosities, we need to continually adjust what the head
  9232                                  ; settle time is.  the following algorithm is used:
  9233                                  ;
  9234                                  ;   get the current head settle value.
  9235                                  ;   if it is 0, then
  9236                                  ;	set slow = 15
  9237                                  ;   else
  9238                                  ;	set slow = value
  9239                                  ;   ...
  9240                                  ;*********************************************
  9241                                  ;************ old algorithm ******************
  9242                                  ;*   if we are seeking and writing then
  9243                                  ;*	 use slow
  9244                                  ;*   else
  9245                                  ;*	 use fast
  9246                                  ;*********************************************
  9247                                  ;*********** ibm's requested logic ***********
  9248                                  ;   if we are seeking and writing and not on an at then
  9249                                  ;	use slow
  9250                                  ;   else
  9251                                  ;	use fast
  9252                                  ;   ...
  9253                                  ;   restore current head settle value
  9254                                  ;
  9255                                  ;
  9256                                  ;---------------------------------------
  9257                                  multrk_on	equ	10000000b	;user spcified mutitrack=on, or system turns
  9258                                  					; it on after handling config.sys file as a
  9259                                  					; default value, if multrk_flag = multrk_off1.
  9260                                  multrk_off1	equ	00000000b	;initial value. no "multitrack=" command entered.
  9261                                  multrk_off2	equ	00000001b	;user specified multitrack=off.
  9262                                  
  9263                                  ; close data segment, open Bios_Code segment
  9264                                  
  9265                                  ; 15/10/2022
  9266                                  
  9267                                  ; BIOSCODE:04A2h (MSDOS 6.21, IO.SYS)
  9268                                  
  9269                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------
  9270                                  ;	command jump table
  9271                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------
  9272                                  
  9273 0000053A 00                      		db 0
  9274                                  ; 11/12/2022
  9275                                  %if 0
  9276                                  
  9277                                  dsktbl:		db 26			; 2C7h:4A2h = 70h:2A12h
  9278                                  					; ((dtbl_siz-1)/2) ; this is the size of the table ; 26

  9280                                  		dw 4EBh			; media_chk

  9286                                  		dw 558h			; ret_carry_clear

  9290                                  		dw 558h			; ret_carry_clear

  9293                                  		dw 81Ah			; dsk_close

  9299                                  		dw 558h			; ret_carry_clear

  9311 0000053C [6117]                  		dw dsk_init

  9314 00000542 [D900]                  		dw bc_cmderr

  9340                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
  9341                                  
  9342                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9343                                  ; setdrive scans through the data structure of bdss, and returns a pointer to
  9344                                  ; the one that belongs to the drive specified. carry is set if none exists
  9345                                  ; for the drive. Pointer is returned in es:[di]
  9346                                  ;
  9347                                  ;  AL contains the logical drive number.
  9348                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9349                                  
  9350                                  SetDrive:	
  9351                                  		;les	di, ds:start_bds ; Point es:di to first bds	
  9352 00000570 C43E[1901]              		les	di, [start_bds] ; 19/10/2022
  9353                                  X_Scan_Loop:				
  9354 00000574 26384505                		cmp	[es:di+5], al	
  9355 00000578 7409                    		jz	short X_SetDrv
  9356 0000057A 26C43D                  		les	di, [es:di]	; [es:di+BDS.link] ; Go	to next	bds
  9357 0000057D 83FFFF                  		cmp	di, 0FFFFh
  9358 00000580 75F2                    		jnz	short X_Scan_Loop
  9359 00000582 F9                      		stc
  9360                                  X_SetDrv:				
  9361 00000583 C3                      		retn
  9362                                  
  9363                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9364                                  
  9365                                  ; 15/10/2022
  9366                                  
  9367                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------
  9368                                  ; if id is f9, have a 96tpi disk else
  9369                                  ; if bit 2 is 0 then media is not removable and could not have changed
  9370                                  ;  otherwise if within 2 secs of last disk operation media could not
  9371                                  ;    have changed, otherwise dont know if media has changed
  9372                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------
  9373                                  
  9374                                  media_chk:				; 2C7h:4EBh = 70h:2A5Bh

  9376 00000587 BE0100                  		mov	si, 1
  9377 0000058A 26F6452401              		test	byte [es:di+24h], 1 ; [es:di+BDS.flags+1]
  9378                                  					; fchanged_by_format
  9379 0000058F 7415                    		jz	short WeAreNotFakingIt
  9380                                  		; 12/12/2022
  9381 00000591 26806524FE              		and	byte [es:di+24h], 0FEh ; ~fchanged_by_format
  9382                                  		;and	word [es:di+23h], 0FEFFh ; [es:di+BDS.flags]
  9383                                  					; ~fchanged_by_format ;	reset flag
  9384 00000596 C606[1E01]FF            		mov	byte [tim_drv], 0FFh ; -1
  9385                                  					; Ensure that we ask the rom if media has changed
  9386 0000059B 26F6452301              		test	byte [es:di+23h], 1 ; [es:di+BDS.flags]
  9387                                  					; fnon_removable

  9389                                  		;mov	si, 0FFFFh	; Indicate media changed
  9390                                  		; 11/08/2023
  9391 000005A2 F7DE                    		neg	si		; PCDOS 7.1 IBMBIO.COM - BIOSCODE:05E0h
  9392 000005A4 EB2B                    		jmp	short Media_Done ; Media_Done
  9393                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9394                                  
  9395                                  WeAreNotFakingIt:
  9396                                  		;test	byte [es:di+BDS.flags], fnon_removable			
  9397 000005A6 26F6452301              		test	byte [es:di+23h], 1
  9398 000005AB 7524                    		jnz	short Media_Done
  9399                                  wehaveafloppy:				
  9400                                  		;xor	si, si ; 0	; Presume "I don't know"
  9401                                  		; 11/08/2023
  9402 000005AD 4E                      		dec	si ; 0 		; PCDOS 7.1 IBMBIO.COM - BIOSCODE:05EBh
  9403                                  
  9404                                  		; If we have a floppy with changeline support, we ask the ROM
  9405                                  		; to determine if media has changed. We do not perform the
  9406                                  		; 2 second check for these drives.
  9407                                  
  9408 000005AE 803E[7700]00            		cmp	byte [fhave96], 0	; Do we	have changeline	support?
  9409 000005B3 740A                    		jz	short mChk_NoChangeLine	; Brif not
  9410 000005B5 E88112                  		call	mediacheck	;  Call	into removable routine
  9411 000005B8 7236                    		jb	short err_exitj
  9412 000005BA E8D113                  		call	haschange
  9413 000005BD 7512                    		jnz	short Media_Done
  9414                                  mChk_NoChangeLine:
  9415                                  		; If we come here, we have a floppy with no changeline support
  9416

  9419 000005C5 263A4504                		cmp	al, [es:di+4]	; [es:di+BDS.drivenum]
  9420                                  					; Is drive of last access the same?
  9421 000005C9 7505                    		jnz	short Media_Unk	; No, then "i don't know"
  9422 000005CB E82800                  		call	Check_Time_Of_Access

  9456                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
  9457                                  
  9458                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9459                                  ; perform a check on the time passed since the last access for this physical
  9460                                  ; drive.
  9461                                  ; we are accessing the same drive. if the time of last successful access was
  9462                                  ; less than 2 seconds ago, then we may presume that the disk was not changed.
  9463                                  ; returns in si:
  9464                                  ;	0 - if time of last access was >= 2 seconds
  9465                                  ;	1 - if time was < 2 seconds (i.e no media change assumed)
  9466                                  ; registers affected ax,cx,dx, flags.
  9467                                  ;
  9468                                  ;	assume es:di -> bds, ds->Bios_Data
  9469                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9470                                  
  9471                                  		; 19/10/2022
  9472                                  Check_Time_Of_Access:
  9473 000005F6 BE0100                  		mov	si, 1		; presume no change.
  9474 000005F9 E823FF                  		call	GetTickCnt	; cx:dx	is the elapsed time
  9475 000005FC 268B4547                		mov	ax, [es:di+47h]	; [es:di+BDS.tim_lo]
  9476                                  					; get stored time
  9477 00000600 29C2                    		sub	dx, ax
  9478 00000602 268B4549                		mov	ax, [es:di+49h]	; [es:di+BDS.tim_hi]
  9479 00000606 19C1                    		sbb	cx, ax
  9480                                  		; 11/08/2023
  9481                                  		; PCDOS 7.1 IBMBIO.COM - BIOSCODE:0646h
  9482                                  		;mov	al, [accesscount]
  9483 00000608 7515                    		jnz	short timecheck_unk ; cx<>0 => >1 hour
  9484 0000060A 09D2                    		or	dx, dx		; time must pass
  9485 0000060C 750C                    		jnz	short timepassed ; yes, examine max value
  9486                                  		; 11/08/2023
  9487                                  		;inc	al
  9488                                  		;cmp	al, 5
  9489                                  		;;inc	byte [accesscount]
  9490                                  		;;cmp	byte [accesscount], 5 
  9491                                  		;			; if count is less than threshold, ok
  9492                                  		;jb	short timecheck_ret
  9493                                  		;;dec	byte [accesscount] ; don't let the count wrap
  9494                                  		; 11/08/2023
  9495                                  		;dec	al
  9496                                  		;jmp	short timecheck_unk ; "i don't know" if media changed
  9497                                  		; 11/08/2023
  9498 0000060E 803E[1D01]04            		cmp	byte [accesscount], 4
  9499 00000613 730A                    		jnb	short timecheck_unk
  9500 00000615 FE06[1D01]              		inc	byte [accesscount]
  9501 00000619 C3                      		retn
  9502                                  
  9503                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9504                                  
  9505                                  timepassed:

  9507                                  					; min elapsed time? (2 seconds)
  9508 0000061D 7601                    		jbe	short timecheck_ret ; yes, presume no change
  9509                                  
  9510                                  		; everything indicates that we do not know what has happened.
  9511                                  timecheck_unk:				
  9512 0000061F 4E                      		dec	si		; presume i don't know
  9513                                  timecheck_ret:
  9514                                  		; 11/08/2023
  9515                                  		;mov	[accesscount], al
  9516 00000620 C3                      		retn
  9517                                  
  9518                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9519                                  ; 15/10/2022

  9531                                  		; 19/10/2022

  9641                                  			; Microsoft/IBM code has a bug here because the BDS's
  9642                                  			; .volid and .filesys_id fields will be reset
  9643                                  			; (to their default text) according to 'BDS.fatsiz' flags

  9652                                  			;
  9653                                  			; Same BUG is existing in PCDOS 7.1 IBMBIO.COM - BIOSCODE:06C3h
  9654                                  			; and in Windows ME IO.SYS - BIOSCODE:0E1Ah as 'test byte [es:di+59],20h'
  9655                                  			; (PCDOS 7.1 BUG note: 26/06/2023)

  9683                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9684                                  ;	getbp - return bpb from the drive specified by the bds.
  9685                                  ;	    if the return_fake_bpb flag is set, then it does nothing.
  9686                                  ;	    note that we never come here for fixed disks.
  9687                                  ;	    for all other cases,
  9688                                  ;	      - it reads boot sector to pull out the bpb
  9689                                  ;	      - if no valid bpb is found, it then reads the fat sector,
  9690                                  ;		to get the fat id byte to build the bpb from there.
  9691                                  ;
  9692                                  ;   inputs:	es:di point to correct bds.
  9693                                  ;
  9694                                  ;   outputs:	fills in bpb in current bds if valid bpb or fat id on disk.
  9695                                  ;		carry set, and al=7 if invalid disk.
  9696                                  ;		carry set and error code in al if other error.
  9697                                  ;		if failed to recognize the boot record, then will set the
  9698                                  ;		set_id_flag to 0.
  9699                                  ;		this routine will only work for a floppy diskette.
  9700                                  ;		     for a fixed disk, it will just return.
  9701                                  ;
  9702                                  ;	****** Note: getbp is a clone of getbp which uses the newer
  9703                                  ;	  segment definitions. It should be migrated towards.
  9704                                  ;	   now es:di has the bds, ds: has Bios_Data
  9705                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9706                                  
  9707                                  GetBp:		; if returning fake bpb then return bpb as is.
  9708                                  		;test	byte [es:di+BDS.flags], return_fake_bpb|fnon_removable		
  9709 00000696 26F6452305              		test	byte [es:di+23h], 5

  9711 0000069D E99A00                  		jmp	getret_exit

  9713                                  
  9714                                  getbp1:

  9716 000006A1 52                      		push	dx

  9718                                  
  9719                                  		; attempt to read in boot sector and determine bpb.
  9720                                  		; we assume that the 2.x and greater dos disks all
  9721                                  		; have a valid boot sector.
  9722                                  
  9723 000006A3 E8A900                  		call	readbootsec
  9724 000006A6 7209                    		jb	short getbp_err_ret_brdg ; carry set if there was error.
  9725 000006A8 09DB                    		or	bx, bx		; bx is	0 if boot sector is valid.
  9726 000006AA 7508                    		jnz	short dofatbpb
  9727 000006AC E8EE00                  		call	movbpb		; move bpb into	registers
  9728 000006AF EB57                    		jmp	short Has1

  9730

  9732 000006B1 E98700                  		jmp	getbp_err_ret

  9734                                  
  9735                                  		; we have a 1.x diskette. In this case read in the fat ID byte

  9739 000006B7 72F8                    		jb	short getbp_err_ret_brdg
  9740                                  		;cmp	ds:fhave96, 0	;  changeline support available?

  9744                                  					; jump to has1!!!!!! or	has720K

  9747                                  					; ffSmall

  9872                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
  9873                                  
  9874                                  ; 15/10/2022 - Retro DOS 4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
  9875                                  
  9876                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------
  9877                                  ; read in the boot sector. set carry if error in reading sector.
  9878                                  ; bx is set to 1 if the boot sector is invalid, otherwise it is 0.
  9879                                  ;
  9880                                  ;	assumes es:di -> bds, ds-> Bios_Data
  9881                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------
  9882                                  
  9883                                  ; 10/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
  9884                                  
  9885                                  readbootsec:	
  9886 0000074F B600                    		mov	dh, 0		; head 0
  9887 00000751 B90100                  		mov	cx, 1		; cylinder 0, sector 1
  9888 00000754 E8BF00                  		call	read_sector
  9889 00000757 7243                    		jb	short err_ret
  9890 00000759 31DB                    		xor	bx, bx		; assume valid boot sector
  9891                                  
  9892                                  		; put a sanity check for the boot sector in here to detect
  9893                                  		; boot sectors that do not have valid bpbs. we examine the
  9894                                  		; first two bytes - they must contain a long jump (69h) or a
  9895                                  		; short jump (EBh) followed by a nop (90h), or a short jump
  9896                                  		; (E9h). if this test is passed, we further check by examining
  9897                                  		; the signature at the end of the boot sector for the word
  9898                                  		; AA55h. if the signature is not present, we examine the media
  9899                                  		; descriptor byte to see if it is valid. for dos 3.3, this
  9900                                  		; logic is modified a little bit. we are not going to check
  9901                                  		; signature. instead we are going to sanity check the media
  9902                                  		; byte in bpb regardless of the validity of signature. this is
  9903                                  		; to save the already developed commercial products that have
  9904                                  		; good jump instruction and signature but with the false bpb
  9905                                  		; informations
  9906                                  
  9907                                  ; that will crash the diskette drive operation. (for example, symphony diskette).
  9908                                  
  9909                                  		; 02/09/2023
  9910                                  		; 19/10/2022
  9911                                  		;cmp	byte [disksector], 69h ; is it a direct jump?
  9912                                  		;jz	short check_bpb_mediabyte ; don't need to find a nop
  9913                                  		;cmp	byte [disksector], 0E9h ; dos 2.0 jump?
  9914                                  		;jz	short check_bpb_mediabyte ; no need for	nop
  9915                                  		;cmp	byte [disksector], 0EBh ; how about a short jump?
  9916                                  		;jnz	short invalidbootsec
  9917                                  		;cmp	byte [disksector+2], 90h ; is next one a nop?
  9918                                  		;jnz	short invalidbootsec
  9919                                  
  9920                                  		; 02/09/2023 (PCDOS 7.1)
  9921 0000075B A0[4E01]                		mov	al, [disksector]
  9922 0000075E 3C69                    		cmp	al, 69h		; is it a direct jump?
  9923 00000760 740F                    		je	short check_bpb_mediabyte
  9924                                  					; don't need to find a nop
  9925 00000762 3CE9                    		cmp	al, 0E9h	; dos 2.0 jump?
  9926 00000764 740B                    		je	short check_bpb_mediabyte
  9927                                  					; no need for nop
  9928 00000766 3CEB                    		cmp	al, 0EBh	; how about a short jump?
  9929 00000768 7530                    		jne	short invalidbootsec
  9930 0000076A 803E[5001]90            		cmp	byte [disksector+2], 90h ; is next one a nop?
  9931 0000076F 7529                    		jne	short invalidbootsec
  9932                                  
  9933                                  ; 15/10/5022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
  9934                                  ;
  9935                                  ;; 10/03/2019
  9936                                  ;; (MSDOS 3.3, MSDISK.ASM, 1988)
  9937                                  ;;
  9938                                  ;; Don't have to perform the following signature check since
  9939                                  ;; we need to check the media byte even with the good signatured diskette.
  9940                                  ;;
  9941                                  ;;check_signature:
  9942                                  ;;		cmp	word [cs:disksector+1FEh],0AA55h ; see if non-ibm
  9943                                  ;;							 ; disk or 1.x media.
  9944                                  ;;		jz	short checksinglesided ; go see if singled sided medium.
  9945                                  ;;					       ; may need some special handling
  9946                                  
  9947                                  ; check for non-ibm disks which do not have the signature AA55h at the
  9948                                  ; end of the boot sector, but still have a valid boot sector. this is done
  9949                                  ; by examining the media descriptor in the boot sector.
  9950                                  
  9951                                  		; 19/10/2022
  9952                                  check_bpb_mediabyte:
  9953 00000771 A0[6301]                		mov	al, [disksector+15h]
  9954                                  					; [disksector+EXT_BOOT.BPB+EBPB.MEDIADESCRIPTOR]
  9955 00000774 50                      		push	ax ; 02/09/2023
  9956 00000775 24F0                    		and	al, 0F0h
  9957 00000777 3CF0                    		cmp	al, 0F0h	; allow	for strange media
  9958 00000779 58                      		pop	ax ; 02/09/2023
  9959 0000077A 751E                    		jnz	short invalidbootsec
  9960                                  
  9961                                  ; there were some (apparently a lot of them) diskettes that had been formatted
  9962                                  ; under dos 3.1 and earlier versions which have invalid bpbs in their boot
  9963                                  ; sectors. these are specifically diskettes that were formatted in drives
  9964                                  ; with one head, or whose side 0 was bad. these contain bpbs in the boot
  9965                                  ; sector that have the sec/clus field set to 2 instead of 1, as is standard
  9966                                  ; in dos. in order to support them, we have to introduce a "hack" that will
  9967                                  ; help our build bpb routine to recognise these specific cases, and to
  9968                                  ; set up out copy of the bpb accordingly.
  9969                                  ; we do this by checking to see if the boot sector is off a diskette that
  9970                                  ; is single-sided and is a pre-dos 3.20 diskette. if it is, we set the
  9971                                  ; sec/clus field to 1. if not, we carry on as normal.
  9972                                  
  9973                                  checksinglesided:
  9974                                  		;mov	al, [disksector+15h]
  9975                                  		; 02/09/2023
  9976                                  		; al = [disksector+15h]
  9977 0000077C 3CF0                    		cmp	al, 0F0h
  9978 0000077E 741B                    		jz	short gooddsk
  9979 00000780 A801                    		test	al, 1
  9980 00000782 7517                    		jnz	short gooddsk
  9981 00000784 813E[5601]332E          		cmp	word [disksector+8], 2E33h ; "3."
  9982 0000078A 7507                    		jnz	short mustbeearlier
  9983 0000078C 803E[5801]32            		cmp	byte [disksector+0Ah], 32h ; "2"
  9984 00000791 7308                    		jnb	short gooddsk
  9985                                  
  9986                                  ; we must have a pre-3.20 diskette. set the sec/clus field to 1
  9987                                  
  9988                                  mustbeearlier:				
  9989 00000793 C606[5B01]01            		mov	byte [disksector+0Dh], 1
  9990                                  					; [disksector+EXT_BOOT.BPB+EBPB.SECTORSPERCLUSTER]
  9991 00000798 EB01                    		jmp	short gooddsk
  9992                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9993                                  
  9994                                  invalidbootsec:				
  9995 0000079A 43                      		inc	bx		; indicate that boot sector invalid
  9996                                  		; 10/12/2022
  9997                                  movbpb_ret:
  9998                                  gooddsk:				
  9999 0000079B F8                      		clc
 10000                                  err_ret:
 10001 0000079C C3                      		retn
 10002                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------

 10010                                  ; 15/10/2022
 10011                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10012                                  ; 'movbpb' moves the bpb read from the boot sector into registers for use by
 10013                                  ; getbp routine at has1
 10014                                  ;
 10015                                  ; if the set_id_flag is 1, and if an extended boot record, then set volume
 10016                                  ; serial number, volume label, file system id in bds according to
 10017                                  ; the boot record.  after that, this routine will set the set_id_flag to 2
 10018                                  ; to signal that volume label is set already from the extended boot record
 10019                                  ; (so, don't set it again by calling "set_volume_id" routine which uses
 10020                                  ; the volume label in the root directory.)
 10021                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10022                                  
 10023                                  ; 10/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 10024                                  
 10025                                  		; 19/10/2022
 10026                                  movbpb:	
 10027 0000079D 8A36[5B01]              		mov	dh, [disksector+0Dh]
 10028                                  					; disksector+EXT_BOOT.BPB+EBPB.SECTORSPERCLUSTER]
 10029                                  					; sectors per unit
 10030 000007A1 8A3E[5F01]              		mov	bh, [disksector+11h]
 10031                                  					; [disksector+EXT_BOOT.BPB+EBPB.ROOTENTRIES]
 10032                                  					; number of directory entries
 10033 000007A5 8B0E[6101]              		mov	cx, [disksector+13h]
 10034                                  					; [disksector+EXT_BOOT.BPB+EBPB.TOTALSECTORS]
 10035                                  					; size of drive
 10036 000007A9 8A26[6301]              		mov	ah, [disksector+15h]
 10037                                  					; [disksector+EXT_BOOT.BPB+EBPB.MEDIADESCRIPTOR]
 10038                                  					; media	descriptor
 10039 000007AD A0[6401]                		mov	al, [disksector+16h];
 10040                                  					; [disksector+EXT_BOOT.BPB+EBPB.SECTORSPERFAT]
 10041                                  					; number of fat	sectors
 10042 000007B0 8A1E[6601]              		mov	bl, [disksector+18h]
 10043                                  					; [disksector+EXT_BOOT.BPB+EBPB.SECTORSPERTRACK]
 10044                                  					; sectors per track
 10045 000007B4 8A16[6801]              		mov	dl, [disksector+1Ah]
 10046                                  					; [disksector+EXT_BOOT.BPB+EBPB.HEADS]
 10047                                  					; number of heads
 10048 000007B8 803E[0205]01            		cmp	byte [set_id_flag], 1 ; called by get_bpb?
 10049 000007BD 75DC                    		jnz	short movbpb_ret
 10050 000007BF E81200                  		call	mov_media_ids
 10051 000007C2 7205                    		jb	short movbpb_conv ; conventional boot record?
 10052 000007C4 C606[0205]02            		mov	byte [set_id_flag], 2 ; signals that volume id is set
 10053                                  movbpb_conv:				
 10054 000007C9 803E[7700]01            		cmp	byte [fhave96], 1
 10055 000007CE 75CB                    		jnz	short movbpb_ret
 10056 000007D0 E8B511                  		call	resetchanged	; reset	flags in bds to	not fchanged.
 10057                                  		; 10/12/2022
 10058                                  		; cf = 0
 10059                                  ;movbpb_ret:				
 10060                                  		;clc
 10061 000007D3 C3                      		retn
 10062                                  
 10063                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 10064                                  
 10065                                  ;copy the boot_serial number, volume id, and filesystem id from the
 10066                                  ;***extended boot record*** in ds:disksector to the bds table pointed
 10067                                  ;by es:di.
 10068                                  
 10069                                  ;in.) es:di -> bds
 10070                                  ;     ds:disksector = valid extended boot record.
 10071                                  ;out.) vol_serial, bds_volid and bds_system_id in bds are set according to
 10072                                  ;      the boot record information.
 10073                                  ;     carry flag set if not an extended bpb.
 10074                                  ;     all registers saved except the flag.
 10075                                  
 10076                                  		; 19/10/2022
 10077                                  mov_media_ids:		
 10078 000007D4 803E[7401]29            		cmp	byte [disksector+26h], 29h
 10079                                  					; [disksector+EXT_BOOT.SIG],
 10080                                  					; EXT_BOOT_SIGNATURE
 10081 000007D9 752C                    		jnz	short mmi_not_ext
 10082 000007DB 51                      		push	cx
 10083 000007DC 8B0E[7501]              		mov	cx, [disksector+27h]
 10084                                  					; [disksector+EXT_BOOT.SERIAL]
 10085 000007E0 26894D57                		mov	[es:di+57h], cx	; [es:di+BDS.vol_serial]
 10086 000007E4 8B0E[7701]              		mov	cx, [disksector+29h]
 10087                                  					; [disksector+EXT_BOOT.SERIAL+2]
 10088 000007E8 26894D59                		mov	[es:di+59h], cx	; [es:di+BDS.vol_serial+2]
 10089 000007EC 57                      		push	di
 10090 000007ED 56                      		push	si
 10091 000007EE B90B00                  		mov	cx, 11		; size_of_EXT_BOOT_VOL_LABEL
 10092 000007F1 BE[7901]                		mov	si, disksector+2Bh
 10093                                  		;mov	si, (offset disksector+2Bh) ;
 10094                                  					; disksector+EXT_BOOT.VOL_LABEL
 10095 000007F4 83C74B                  		add	di, 75		; BDS.volid
 10096 000007F7 F3A4                    		rep movsb
 10097                                  		;mov	cx, 8		; size_of_EXT_SYSTEM_ID
 10098                                  		; 10/12/2022
 10099 000007F9 B108                    		mov	cl, 8 ; cx = 8
 10100 000007FB BE[8401]                		mov	si, disksector+36h
 10101                                  		;mov	si, (offset disksector+36h) ; disksector+EXT_BOOT.SYSTEM_ID
 10102 000007FE 83C705                  		add	di, 5		; (BDS.filesys_id-BDS.volid)-size_of_EXT_BOOT_VOL_LABEL
 10103 00000801 F3A4                    		rep movsb
 10104 00000803 5E                      		pop	si
 10105 00000804 5F                      		pop	di
 10106 00000805 59                      		pop	cx
 10107                                  		; 10/12/2022
 10108                                  		; cf = 0
 10109                                  		;clc		; this clc is not required (16/06/2019 - Erdogan Tan)
