 12895                                  		; 02/09/2023
 12896                                  		;mov	cx, 14          ; (PCDOS 7.1) IOC_DC_TABLE_LEN
 12897 000012F1 B90B00                  		mov	cx, 11		; IOC_DC_TABLE_LEN
 12898                                  		; 10/12/2022
 12899 000012F4 BF[D50C]                		mov	di, IOC_DC_Table
 12900                                  		;mov	di, 0C60h	; IOC_DC_Table
 12901                                  					; at 2C7h:0C60h	= 70h:31D0h
 12902 000012F7 86C4                    		xchg	al, ah		; Put minor code in AL
 12903 000012F9 F2AE                    		repne scasb		; Scan for minor code in AL
 12904 000012FB 7505                    		jnz	short nosupport	; it was not found
 12905 000012FD B80001                  		mov	ax, 100h
 12906                                  		; 10/12/2022
 12907                                  		; (jump to ioctlsupexit is not required)
 12908                                  		;jmp	short $+2	; ioctlsupexit
 12909                                  					; Signal ioctl is supported
 12910                                  		;;jmp	short ioctlsupexit
 12911                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 12912                                  ioctlsupexit:
 12913 00001300 07                      		pop	es
 12914                                  		; 10/12/2022
 12915                                  		; cf = 0
 12916                                  		;clc
 12917 00001301 C3                      		retn
 12918                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 12919                                  nosupport:
 12920 00001302 07                      		pop	es
 12921 00001303 E9D3ED                  		jmp	bc_cmderr
 12922                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 12923                                  
 12924                                  ; 16/10/2022
 12925                                  
 12926                                  ; ==========================================================================
 12927                                  ;	GetMediaSenseStatus
 12928                                  ; ==========================================================================
 12929                                  ;
 12930                                  ; FUNCTION: Will return the type of diskette media in the specified DOS
 12931                                  ;	    diskette drive and whether the media is the default type
 12932                                  ;	    for that drive. (default type means the max size for that
 12933                                  ;	    drive)
 12934                                  ;
 12935                                  ; INPUT :   ES:DI -> BDS table
 12936                                  ; OUTPUT:   If carry clear
 12937                                  ;	    DS:BX -> Updated IOCtlPacket
 12938                                  ;
 12939                                  ;			 Special Function at offset 0:
 12940                                  ;				0	- Media detected is not default type
 12941                                  ;				1	- Media detected is default type
 12942                                  ;
 12943                                  ;			 Device Type at offset 1:
 12944                                  ;				2       - 720K 3.5" 80 tracks
 12945                                  ;				7	- 1.44M 3.5" 80 tracks
 12946                                  ;				9	- 2.88M 3.5" 80 tracks
 12947                                  ;
 12948                                  ; Error Codes returned in AX if carry set:
 12949                                  ;
 12950                                  ; 8102 - Drive not ready	- No disk is in the drive.
 12951                                  ; 8107 - Unknown media type	- Drive doesn't support this function or
 12952                                  ;				  the media is really unkown, any error
 12953                                  ;				  other than "media not present"
 12954                                  ; 
 12955                                  ; ==========================================================================
 12956                                  
 12957                                  		; 19/10/2022
 12958                                  SenseMediaType:				
 12959 00001306 C51E[1200]              		lds	bx, [ptrsav]	; DS:BX	points to request header.
 12960 0000130A C55F13                  		lds	bx, [bx+19]	; bx+IOCTL_REQ.GENERICIOCTL_PACKET]
 12961                                  		; 10/10/2022
 12962                                  		;mov	word [bx], 0	; Initialize the 2 packet bytes
 12963 0000130D 31D2                    		xor	dx, dx
 12964 0000130F 8917                    		mov	[bx], dx ; 0
 12965                                  		;
 12966 00001311 268A5504                		mov	dl, [es:di+4]	; [es:di+BDS.drivenum]
 12967                                  					; Get int 13h drive number from	BDS
 12968                                  		; 10/12/2022
 12969                                  		;xor	dh, dh		; DX = physical	drive number
 12970 00001315 B420                    		mov	ah, 20h		; Get Media Type function
 12971                                  					; If no	carry media type in AL
 12972 00001317 CD13                    		int	13h		; DISK - QCACHE	- DISMOUNT
 12973 00001319 7216                    		jb	short MediaSenseEr ; error code	in AH
 12974 0000131B FE07                    		inc	byte [bx]	; Signal media type is default (bit 1)
 12975                                  DetermineMediaType:			
 12976 0000131D FEC8                    		dec	al
 12977 0000131F 3C02                    		cmp	al, 2		; Chk for 720K ie: (3-1) = 2
 12978 00001321 740A                    		jz	short GotMediaType
 12979 00001323 0404                    		add	al, 4
 12980 00001325 3C07                    		cmp	al, 7		; Chk for 1.44M ie: (4-1+4) = 7
 12981 00001327 7404                    		jz	short GotMediaType
 12982 00001329 3C09                    		cmp	al, 9		; Chk for 2.88M	ie: (6-1+4) = 9
 12983 0000132B 7510                    		jnz	short UnknownMediaType ; Just didn't recognize media type
 12984                                  GotMediaType:				
 12985 0000132D 884701                  		mov	[bx+1],	al	; Save the return value
 12986                                  		; 10/12/2022
 12987                                  		; cf = 0
 12988                                  		;clc			; Signal success
 12989 00001330 C3                      		retn
 12990                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 12991                                  
 12992                                  MediaSenseEr:				
 12993 00001331 80FC32                  		cmp	ah, 32h		; See if not default media error
 12994 00001334 74E7                    		jz	short DetermineMediaType ; Not really an error
 12995 00001336 B002                    		mov	al, 2		; Now assume drive not ready
 12996 00001338 80FC31                  		cmp	ah, 31h		; See if media was present
 12997 0000133B 7402                    		jz	short SenseErrExit ; Return drive not ready
 12998                                  UnknownMediaType:			
 12999 0000133D B007                    		mov	al, 7		; Just don't know the media type
 13000                                  SenseErrExit:				
 13001 0000133F B481                    		mov	ah, 81h		; Signal error return
 13002 00001341 F9                      		stc
 13003 00001342 C3                      		retn
 13004                                  
 13005                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13006                                  		; 10/12/2022
 13007                                  		;db    0
 13008                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13009                                  
 13010                                  ; 16/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 13011                                  
 13012                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13013                                  ; MSINT13.ASM - MSDOS 6.0 - 1991
 13014                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13015                                  ; 16/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 13016                                  
 13017                                  ;	int 2f function 13h allows the user to change the orig13 int_13 vector
 13018                                  ;	after booting. this allows testing and implementation of custom int_13
 13019                                  ;	handlers, without giving up ms-dos error recovery
 13020                                  ;	entry:	ds:dx	== addr. of new int_13 handler
 13021                                  ;		es:bx	== addr. of new int_13 vector used by warm boot (int19)
 13022                                  ;	exit:	orig13	== address of new int_13 handler
 13023                                  ;		ds:dx	== old orig13 value
 13024                                  ;		es:bx	== old old13  value
 13025                                  ;
 13026                                  ; int 2f handler for external block drivers to communicate with the internal
 13027                                  ; block driver in msdisk. the multiplex number chosen is 8. the handler
 13028                                  ; sets up the pointer to the request packet in [ptrsav] and then jumps to
 13029                                  ; dsk_entry, the entry point for all disk requests.
 13030                                  ;
 13031                                  ; on exit from this driver, we will return to the external driver
 13032                                  ; that issued this int 2f, and can then remove the flags from the stack.
 13033                                  ; this scheme allows us to have a small external device driver, and makes
 13034                                  ; the maintainance of the various drivers (driver and msbio) much easier,
 13035                                  ; since we only need to make changes in one place (most of the time).
 13036                                  ;
 13037                                  ;   ax=800h - check for installed handler - reserved
 13038                                  ;   ax=801h - install the bds into the linked list
 13039                                  ;   ax=802h - dos request
 13040                                  ;   ax=803h - return bds table starting pointer in ds:di
 13041                                  ;	   (ems device driver hooks int 13h to handle 16kb dma overrun
 13042                                  ;	    problem. bds table is going to be used to get head/sector
 13043                                  ;	    informations without calling generic ioctl get device parm call.)
 13044                                  
 13045                                  ;BIOSSEGMENT equ 70h
 13046                                  DOSBIOSSEG equ 0070h ; 17/10/2022	
 13047                                  
 13048                                  ;;BIOSCODE:1302h (MSDOS 6.21, IO.SYS)
 13049                                  
 13050                                  i2f_handler:				; here is 02C7h:1302h =	0070h:3872h
 13051 00001343 80FC13                  		cmp	ah, 13h
 13052 00001346 7413                    		jz	short int2f_replace_int13
 13053 00001348 80FC08                  		cmp	ah, 8
 13054 0000134B 7431                    		jz	short mine
 13055                                  
 13056                                  ; Check for WIN386 startup and return the BIOS instance data
 13057                                  
 13058 0000134D 80FC16                  		cmp	ah, 16h		; MultWin386
 13059 00001350 746C                    		jz	short win386call
 13060 00001352 80FC4A                  		cmp	ah, 4Ah		; multMULT
 13061 00001355 7503                    		jnz	short i2f_handler_iret
 13062 00001357 E99700                  		jmp	handle_multmult
 13063                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13064                                  
 13065                                  i2f_handler_iret:			
 13066 0000135A CF                      		iret
 13067                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13068                                  
 13069                                  int2f_replace_int13:
 13070 0000135B 50                      		push	ax	; free up a register for caller's ds
 13071 0000135C 8CD8                    		mov	ax, ds	; then we can use ds: -> Bios_Data
 13072                                  		;;mov	ds, word [cs:0030h] ; 15/10/2022	
 13073                                  		;mov	ds, word ptr cs:BIOSDATAWORD ; [cs:0030h]
 13074                                  					; = [02C7h:0030h] = [0070h:25A0h]
 13075 0000135E 2E8E1E[3000]            		mov	ds, [cs:BIOSDATAWORD] ; 17/10/2022
 13076                                  		; 19/10/2022
 13077                                  		;push	word ptr ds:Orig13	; save old value of old13 and
 13078                                  		;push	word ptr ds:Orig13+2	; orig13 so that we can
 13079                                  		;push	word ptr ds:Old13	; return them to caller
 13080                                  		;push	word ptr ds:Old13+2
 13081                                  		
 13082                                  		; 02/09/2023 (PCDOS 7.1)
 13083                                  		;push	word [Orig13]
 13084 00001363 FF36[B600]              		push	word [Orig13+2]
 13085                                  		;push	word [Old13]
 13086 00001367 FF36[0801]              		push	word [Old13+2]
 13087                                  
 13088                                  		;mov	word ptr ds:Orig13, dx	; orig13 := addr. of new int_13
 13089                                  		;mov	word ptr ds:Orig13+2, ax
 13090                                  		;mov	word ptr ds:Old13, bx	; old13 := addr. of new boot_13
 13091                                  		;mov	word ptr ds:Old13+2, es
 13092                                  		
 13093                                  		;mov	[Orig13], dx
 13094                                  		; 02/09/2023
 13095 0000136B 8716[B400]              		xchg	dx, [Orig13]
 13096 0000136F A3[B600]                		mov	[Orig13+2], ax
 13097                                  		;mov	[Old13], bx
 13098                                  		; 02/09/2023
 13099 00001372 871E[0601]              		xchg	bx, [Old13]
 13100 00001376 8C06[0801]              		mov	[Old13+2], es
 13101                                  
 13102 0000137A 07                      		pop	es			; es:bx := old old13 vector
 13103                                  		; 02/09/2023
 13104                                  		;pop	bx
 13105 0000137B 1F                      		pop	ds			; ds:dx := old orig13 vector
 13106                                  		;pop	dx ; 02/09/2023
 13107 0000137C 58                      		pop	ax
 13108                                  i2f_iret:
 13109 0000137D CF                      		iret
 13110                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13111                                  
 13112                                  mine:
 13113 0000137E 3CF8                    		cmp	al, 0F8h 		; iret on reserved functions
 13114 00001380 73FB                    		jnb	short i2f_iret
 13115 00001382 08C0                    		or	al, al			; a get installed state request?
 13116 00001384 7503                    		jnz	short disp_func
 13117 00001386 B0FF                    		mov	al, 0FFh
 13118                                  		;jmp	short i2f_iret
 13119                                  		; 02/09/2023
 13120 00001388 CF                      		iret
 13121                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13122                                  
 13123                                  disp_func:
 13124 00001389 3C01                    		cmp	al, 1			; request for installing bds?
 13125 0000138B 7418                    		jz	short do_subfun_01
 13126 0000138D 3C03                    		cmp	al, 3			; get bds vector?
 13127 0000138F 7423                    		jz	short do_get_bds_vector
 13128                                  
 13129                                  ; set up pointer to request packet
 13130                                  
 13131 00001391 1E                      		push	ds
 13132 00001392 2E8E1E[3000]            		mov	ds, [cs:BIOSDATAWORD] ; 17/10/2022	
 13133                                  		;mov	ds, word ptr cs:BIOSDATAWORD ; [cs:Bios_Data_Word]
 13134                                  					; = [0070h:25A0h] = [02C7h:0030h]
 13135                                  		; 19/10/2022
 13136                                  		;mov	word ptr ds:ptrsav, bx
 13137                                  		;mov	word ptr ds:ptrsav+2, es
 13138 00001397 891E[1200]              		mov	[ptrsav], bx
 13139 0000139B 8C06[1400]              		mov	[ptrsav+2], es
 13140 0000139F 1F                      		pop	ds
 13141                                  		;jmp	far ptr	i2f_dskentry
 13142                                  		; 07/08/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 IO.SYS (optimization)
 13143                                  		; PCDOS 7.1 IBMBIO.COM - BIOSCODE:1708h
 13144 000013A0 EA[1907]7000            		jmp	DOSBIOSSEG:dsk_entry ; BIOSDATA:dsk_entry
 13145                                  		;; 17/10/2022
 13146                                  		;;jmp	far DOSBIOSSEG:dsk_entry		
 13147                                  		;jmp	DOSBIOSSEG:i2f_dskentry ; 70h:i2f_dskentry
 13148                                  					; NOTE: jump to a FAR function, not an
 13149                                  					;  IRET type function. Callers of
 13150                                  					;  this int2f subfunction will have
 13151                                  					;  to be careful to do a popf
 13152                                  
 13153                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13154                                  
 13155                                  do_subfun_01:
 13156 000013A5 06                      		push	es
 13157 000013A6 1E                      		push	ds
 13158 000013A7 1E                      		push	ds
 13159 000013A8 07                      		pop	es
 13160                                  		; 17/10/2022
 13161 000013A9 2E8E1E[3000]            		mov	ds, [cs:BIOSDATAWORD]	
 13162                                  		;mov	ds, word ptr cs:BIOSDATAWORD ; [cs:Bios_Data_Word]
 13163                                  					; point	ds: -> Bios_Data
 13164 000013AE E8BC03                  		call	install_bds
 13165 000013B1 1F                      		pop	ds
 13166 000013B2 07                      		pop	es
 13167                                  		;jmp	short i2f_iret
 13168                                  		; 02/09/2023
 13169 000013B3 CF                      		iret
 13170                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13171                                  
 13172                                  do_get_bds_vector:
 13173                                  		; 17/10/2022
 13174 000013B4 2E8E1E[3000]            		mov	ds, [cs:BIOSDATAWORD]			
 13175                                  		;mov	ds, word ptr cs:BIOSDATAWORD ; [cs:Bios_Data_Word]
 13176 000013B9 C53E[1901]              		lds	di, [start_bds]
 13177                                  		;lds	di, ds:start_bds
 13178                                  ;ii2f_iret:	; 10/12/2022
 13179                                  		;jmp	short i2f_iret
 13180                                  		; 02/09/2023
 13181 000013BD CF                      		iret
 13182                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13183                                  
 13184                                  ; 17/10/2022
 13185                                  ; 16/10/2022
 13186                                  
 13187                                  ; WIN386 startup stuff is done here. If starting up we set our WIN386 present
 13188                                  ; flag and return instance data. If exiting, we reset the WIN386 present flag
 13189                                  ; NOTE: We assume that the BIOS int 2fh is at the bottom of the chain.
 13190                                  
 13191                                  win386call:				
 13192 000013BE 1E                      		push	ds
 13193 000013BF 2E8E1E[3000]            		mov	ds, [cs:BIOSDATAWORD]
 13194                                  		;mov	ds, word ptr cs:BIOSDATAWORD ; [cs:Bios_Data_Word]
 13195                                  					; at 2C7h:30h =	70h:25A0h
 13196 000013C4 3C05                    		cmp	al, 5		; Win386_Init
 13197                                  					; is it	win386 initializing?
 13198 000013C6 7410                    		jz	short Win386Init
 13199 000013C8 3C06                    		cmp	al, 6		; Win386_Exit
 13200                                  					; is it	win386 exiting?
 13201 000013CA 7523                    		jnz	short win_iret	; if not, continue int2f chain
 13202                                  		; 12/12/2022
 13203 000013CC F6C201                  		test	dl, 1
 13204                                  		;test	dx, 1		; is it	win386 or win286 dos extender?
 13205 000013CF 751E                    		jnz	short win_iret	; if not win386, then continue
 13206                                  		;and	ds:IsWin386, 0	; indicate that	win386 is not present  
 13207 000013D1 8026[6F08]00            		and	byte [IsWin386], 0 
 13208 000013D6 EB17                    		jmp	short win_iret
 13209                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13210                                  
 13211                                  Win386Init:
 13212                                  		; 12/12/2022
 13213 000013D8 F6C201                  		test	dl, 1
 13214                                  		;test	dx, 1		; is it win386 or win286 dos extender?
 13215 000013DB 7512                    		jnz	short win_iret	; if not win386, then continue
 13216                                  		;or	ds:IsWin386, 1	; Indicate WIN386 present
 13217 000013DD 800E[6F08]01            		or	byte [IsWin386], 1
 13218                                  		;mov	word ptr ds:SI_Next, bx	; Hook our structure into chain
 13219                                  		;mov	word ptr ds:SI_Next+2, es
 13220 000013E2 891E[3D08]              		mov	[SI_Next], bx
 13221 000013E6 8C06[3F08]              		mov	[SI_Next+2], es
 13222                                  		;mov	bx, offset Win386_SI ; point ES:BX to Win386_SI
 13223 000013EA BB[3B08]                		mov	bx, Win386_SI	; 19/10/2022
 13224 000013ED 1E                      		push	ds
 13225 000013EE 07                      		pop	es
 13226                                  win_iret:
 13227 000013EF 1F                      		pop	ds
 13228                                  ii2f_iret:	; 10/12/2022
 13229                                  		;jmp	short i2f_iret	; return back up the chain
 13230                                  		; 02/09/2023
 13231 000013F0 CF                      		iret
 13232                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13233                                  
 13234                                  handle_multmult:
 13235 000013F1 3C01                    		cmp	al, 1
 13236 000013F3 7514                    		jnz	short try_2
 13237 000013F5 1E                      		push	ds
 13238 000013F6 E84500                  		call	HMAPtr		; get offset of free HMA
 13239                                  		; 10/12/2022
 13240                                  		;xor	bx, bx
 13241                                  		;dec	bx
 13242 000013F9 BBFFFF                  		mov	bx, 0FFFFh
 13243 000013FC 8EC3                    		mov	es, bx		; seg of HMA
 13244 000013FE 89FB                    		mov	bx, di
 13245 00001400 F7D3                    		not	bx
 13246 00001402 09DB                    		or	bx, bx
 13247 00001404 7401                    		jz	short try_1
 13248 00001406 43                      		inc	bx
 13249                                  try_1:
 13250 00001407 1F                      		pop	ds
 13251                                  		;jmp	short ii2f_iret
 13252                                  		; 02/09/2023
 13253 00001408 CF                      		iret
 13254                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13255                                  
 13256                                  try_2:
 13257 00001409 3C02                    		cmp	al, 2		; multMULTALLOCHMA
 13258 0000140B 7530                    		jnz	short try_3
 13259 0000140D 1E                      		push	ds
 13260                                  		; 10/12/2022
 13261                                  		;xor	di, di
 13262                                  		;dec	di
 13263 0000140E BFFFFF                  		mov	di, 0FFFFh	; assume not enough space
 13264 00001411 8EC7                    		mov	es, di
 13265 00001413 E82800                  		call	HMAPtr		; get offset of free HMA
 13266 00001416 83FFFF                  		cmp	di, 0FFFFh
 13267 00001419 7421                    		jz	short InsuffHMA
 13268 0000141B F7DF                    		neg	di		; free space in HMA
 13269 0000141D 39FB                    		cmp	bx, di
 13270 0000141F 7605                    		jbe	short try_4
 13271                                  		; 10/12/2022
 13272                                  		;sub	di, di
 13273                                  		;dec	di
 13274 00001421 BFFFFF                  		mov	di, 0FFFFh
 13275                                  		;jmp	short InsuffHMA
 13276                                  		; 02/09/2023
 13277 00001424 1F                      		pop	ds
 13278 00001425 CF                      		iret
 13279                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13280                                  
 13281                                  try_4:
 13282                                  		;mov	di, ds:FreeHMAPtr
 13283 00001426 8B3E[9608]              		mov	di, [FreeHMAPtr]
 13284 0000142A 83C30F                  		add	bx, 15
 13285                                  		;and	bx, 0FFF0h
 13286                                  		; 10/12/2022
 13287 0000142D 80E3F0                  		and	bl, 0F0h
 13288                                  		;add	ds:FreeHMAPtr, bx ; update the free pointer	
 13289 00001430 011E[9608]              		add	[FreeHMAPtr], bx
 13290 00001434 7506                    		jnz	short InsuffHMA
 13291 00001436 C706[9608]FFFF          		mov	word [FreeHMAPtr], 0FFFFh ; -1
 13292                                  		;mov	ds:FreeHMAPtr, 0FFFFh
 13293                                  					; no more HMA if we have wrapped
 13294                                  InsuffHMA:
 13295 0000143C 1F                      		pop	ds
 13296                                  		; 10/12/2022
 13297                                  try_3:		
 13298                                  		;jmp	short ii2f_iret
 13299                                  		; 02/09/2023
 13300 0000143D CF                      		iret
 13301                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13302                                  
 13303                                  		; 10/12/2022
 13304                                  ;try_3:
 13305                                  		;jmp	ii2f_iret
 13306                                  
 13307                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 13308                                  
 13309                                  ; 16/10/2022
 13310                                  
 13311                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13312                                  ;
 13313                                  ; procedure : HMAPtr
 13314                                  ;
 13315                                  ;		Gets the offset of the free HMA area ( with respect to
 13316                                  ;							seg ffff )
 13317                                  ;		If DOS has not moved high, tries to move DOS high.
 13318                                  ;		In the course of doing this, it will allocate all the HMA
 13319                                  ;		and set the FreeHMAPtr to past the end of the BIOS and 
 13320                                  ;		DOS code. The call to MoveDOSIntoHMA (which is a pointer)
 13321                                  ;		enters the routine in sysinit1 called FTryToMovDOSHi.
 13322                                  ;
 13323                                  ;	RETURNS : offset of free HMA in DI
 13324                                  ;		  BIOS_DATA, seg in DS
 13325                                  ;
 13326                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13327                                  
 13328                                  		; 17/10/2022
 13329                                  HMAPtr:
 13330 0000143E 2E8E1E[3000]            		mov	ds, [cs:BIOSDATAWORD]
 13331                                  		;mov	ds, word ptr cs:BIOSDATAWORD ; [cs:Bios_Data_Word]
 13332 00001443 8B3E[9608]              		mov	di, [FreeHMAPtr]
 13333                                  		;mov	di, ds:FreeHMAPtr
 13334 00001447 83FFFF                  		cmp	di, 0FFFFh
 13335 0000144A 750F                    		jnz	short HMAPtr_retn
 13336 0000144C 803E[9C08]00            		cmp	byte [SysinitPresent], 0
 13337                                  		;cmp	ds:SysinitPresent, 0
 13338 00001451 7408                    		jz	short HMAPtr_retn
 13339 00001453 FF1E[9808]              		call	far [MoveDOSIntoHMA]
 13340                                  		;call	ds:MoveDOSIntoHMA ; call far [MoveDOSIntoHMA]
 13341 00001457 8B3E[9608]              		mov	di, [FreeHMAPtr]
 13342                                  		;mov	di, ds:FreeHMAPtr
 13343                                  HMAPtr_retn:				
 13344 0000145B C3                      		retn
 13345                                  
 13346                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 13347                                  
 13348                                  ; 16/10/2022
 13349                                  
 13350                                  ; move a 512 byte sector from ds:si to es:di, do not trash cx
 13351                                  ; but go ahead and update direction flag, si, & di
 13352                                  
 13353                                  move_sector:
 13354                                  
 13355                                  ; The 80386 microprocessor considers an access to WORD 0FFFFh in
 13356                                  ; any segment to be a fault. Theoretically, this could be handled
 13357                                  ; by the fault handler and the behavior of an 8086 could be emulated
 13358                                  ; by wrapping the high byte to offset 0000h. This would be a lot
 13359                                  ; of work and was, indeed, blown off by the Win386 guys. COMPAQ
 13360                                  ; also handles the fault incorrectly in their ROM BIOS for real
 13361                                  ; mode. Their fault handler was only designed to deal with one
 13362                                  ; special case which occurred in a magazine benchmark, but didn't
 13363                                  ; handle the general case worth beans.
 13364                                  ;
 13365                                  ; Simply changing this code to do a byte loop would work okay but
 13366                                  ; would involve a general case performance hit. Therefore, we'll
 13367                                  ; check for either source or destination offsets being within one
 13368                                  ; sector of the end of their segments and only in that case fall
 13369                                  ; back to a byte move.
 13370                                  
 13371 0000145C FC                      		cld
 13372 0000145D 51                      		push	cx
 13373 0000145E B90001                  		mov	cx, 256
 13374 00001461 81FE00FE                		cmp	si, 0FE00h
 13375 00001465 770A                    		ja	short movsec_bytes
 13376 00001467 81FF00FE                		cmp	di, 0FE00h
 13377 0000146B 7704                    		ja	short movsec_bytes
 13378 0000146D F3A5                    		rep movsw
 13379 0000146F 59                      		pop	cx
 13380 00001470 C3                      		retn
 13381                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13382                                  
 13383                                  movsec_bytes:				
 13384 00001471 D1E1                    		shl	cx, 1
 13385 00001473 F3A4                    		rep movsb
 13386 00001475 59                      		pop	cx
 13387 00001476 C3                      		retn
 13388                                  
 13389                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 13390                                  
 13391                                  ; 16/10/2022
 13392                                  
 13393                                  ; check_wrap is a routine that adjusts the starting sector, starting head
 13394                                  ; and starting cylinder for an int 13 request that requests i/o of a lot
 13395                                  ; of sectors. it only does this for fixed disks. it is used in the sections
 13396                                  ; of code that handle ecc errors and dma errors. it is necessary, because
 13397                                  ; ordinarily the rom would take care of wraps around heads and cylinders,
 13398                                  ; but we break down a request when we get an ecc or dma error into several
 13399                                  ; i/o of one or more sectors. in this case, we may already be beyond the
 13400                                  ; number of sectors on a track on the medium, and the request would fail.
 13401                                  ;
 13402                                  ; input conditions:
 13403                                  ;	all registers set up for an int 13 request.
 13404                                  ;
 13405                                  ; output:
 13406                                  ;	dh - contains starting head number for request
 13407                                  ;	cx - contains starting sector and cylinder numbers
 13408                                  ;	(the above may or may not have been changed, and are 0-based)
 13409                                  ;	all other registers preserved.
 13410                                  
 13411                                  check_wrap:	
 13412 00001477 50                      		push	ax
 13413 00001478 53                      		push	bx
 13414 00001479 06                      		push	es
 13415 0000147A 57                      		push	di
 13416 0000147B E86C00                  		call	find_bds	; get pointer to bds for drive in dl
 13417 0000147E 725E                    		jb	short no_wrap	; finished if DOS doesn't use it
 13418                                  		; 12/12/2022
 13419 00001480 26F6452301              		test	byte [es:di+23h], 1
 13420                                  		;test	word [es:di+23h], 1 ; [es:di+BDS.flags],fnon_removable
 13421 00001485 7457                    		jz	short no_wrap	; no wrapping for removable media
 13422 00001487 268B5D13                		mov	bx, [es:di+13h]	; [es:di+BDS.secpertrack]
 13423 0000148B 89C8                    		mov	ax, cx
 13424 0000148D 83E03F                  		and	ax, 3Fh		; extract sector number
 13425 00001490 39D8                    		cmp	ax, bx		; are we going to wrap?
 13426 00001492 764A                    		jbe	short no_wrap
 13427 00001494 F6F3                    		div	bl		; ah=new sector	#, al=#	of head	wraps
 13428                                  
 13429                                  ; we need to be careful here. if the new sector # is 0, then we are on the
 13430                                  ; last sector on that track.
 13431                                  
 13432 00001496 08E4                    		or	ah, ah
 13433 00001498 7503                    		jnz	short not_on_bound
 13434                                  		; 18/12/2022
 13435 0000149A 48                      		dec	ax ; *
 13436 0000149B 88DC                    		mov	ah, bl		; set sector=BDS_BPB.BPB_SECTORSPERTRACK
 13437                                  					; if on	boundary
 13438                                  		;dec	al ; *		; also decrement # of head wraps
 13439                                  not_on_bound:
 13440 0000149D 80E1C0                  		and	cl, 0C0h	; zero out sector #
 13441 000014A0 08E1                    		or	cl, ah		; or in	new sector #
 13442 000014A2 30E4                    		xor	ah, ah		; ax = # of head wraps
 13443 000014A4 40                      		inc	ax
 13444 000014A5 00F0                    		add	al, dh		; add in starting head #
 13445 000014A7 80D400                  		adc	ah, 0		; catch	any carry
 13446                                  		; 02/09/2023
 13447 000014AA 268B5D15                		mov	bx, [es:di+15h]	; [es:di+BDS.heads]
 13448 000014AE 39D8                    		cmp	ax, bx
 13449                                  		;cmp	ax, [es:di+15h]	; [es:di+BDS.heads]
 13450                                  					; are we going to wrap around a	head?
 13451 000014B0 7632                    		jbe	short no_wrap_head ; do	not lose new head number!!
 13452 000014B2 52                      		push	dx		; preserve drive number and head number
 13453 000014B3 31D2                    		xor	dx, dx
 13454                                  		;mov	bx, [es:di+15h]	; [es:di+BDS.heads]
 13455 000014B5 F7F3                    		div	bx		; dx=new head #, ax=# of cylinder wraps
 13456                                  
 13457                                  ; careful here! if new head # is 0, then we are on the last head.
 13458                                  
 13459 000014B7 09D2                    		or	dx, dx
 13460 000014B9 7507                    		jnz	short no_head_bound
 13461 000014BB 89DA                    		mov	dx, bx		; on boundary. set to BDS_BPB.BPB_HEADS
 13462                                  
 13463                                  ; if we had some cylinder wraps, we need to reduce them by one!!
 13464                                  
 13465 000014BD 09C0                    		or	ax, ax
 13466 000014BF 7401                    		jz	short no_head_bound
 13467 000014C1 48                      		dec	ax		; reduce number	of cylinder wraps
 13468                                  no_head_bound:				
 13469 000014C2 88D7                    		mov	bh, dl		; bh has new head number
 13470 000014C4 5A                      		pop	dx		; restore drive number and head number
 13471 000014C5 FECF                    		dec	bh		; get it 0-based
 13472 000014C7 88FE                    		mov	dh, bh		; set up new head number in dh
 13473 000014C9 88CF                    		mov	bh, cl
 13474 000014CB 80E73F                  		and	bh, 3Fh		; preserve sector number
 13475 000014CE B306                    		mov	bl, 6
 13476 000014D0 86CB                    		xchg	cl, bl
 13477 000014D2 D2EB                    		shr	bl, cl		; get ms cylinder bits to ls end
 13478 000014D4 00C5                    		add	ch, al		; add in cylinder wrap
 13479 000014D6 10E3                    		adc	bl, ah		; add in high byte
 13480 000014D8 D2E3                    		shl	bl, cl		; move up to ms	end
 13481 000014DA 86D9                    		xchg	bl, cl		; restore cylinder bits	into cl
 13482 000014DC 08F9                    		or	cl, bh		; or in	sector number
 13483                                  no_wrap:				
 13484 000014DE F8                      		clc
 13485 000014DF 5F                      		pop	di
 13486 000014E0 07                      		pop	es
 13487 000014E1 5B                      		pop	bx
 13488 000014E2 58                      		pop	ax
 13489 000014E3 C3                      		retn
 13490                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13491                                  
 13492                                  no_wrap_head:				
 13493 000014E4 88C6                    		mov	dh, al		; do not lose new head number
 13494 000014E6 FECE                    		dec	dh		; get it 0-based
 13495 000014E8 EBF4                    		jmp	short no_wrap
 13496                                  
 13497                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 13498                                  
 13499                                  ; 16/10/2022
 13500                                  
 13501                                  ; this is a special version of the bds lookup code which is
 13502                                  ; based on physical drives rather than the usual logical drives
 13503                                  ; carry is set if the physical drive in dl is found, es:di -> its bds
 13504                                  ; otherwise carry is clear
 13505                                  ;
 13506                                  ; guaranteed to trash no registers except es:di
 13507                                  
 13508                                  		; 19/10/2022
 13509                                  find_bds:	
 13510 000014EA C43E[1901]              		les	di, [start_bds]	; point es:di to first bds
 13511                                  fbds_1:					
 13512 000014EE 26385504                		cmp	[es:di+4], dl	; [es:di+BDS.drivenum]
 13513 000014F2 7409                    		jz	short fdbs_2
 13514 000014F4 26C43D                  		les	di, [es:di]	; [es:di+BDS.link]
 13515                                  					; go to next bds
 13516 000014F7 83FFFF                  		cmp	di, 0FFFFh
 13517 000014FA 75F2                    		jnz	short fbds_1
 13518 000014FC F9                      		stc
 13519                                  fdbs_2:					
 13520 000014FD C3                      		retn
 13521                                  
 13522                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 13523                                  
 13524                                  ; 16/10/2022
 13525                                  		; 17/10/2022
 13526                                  doint:
 13527                                  		; 10/12/2022
 13528 000014FE 8A5608                  		mov	dl, [bp+8]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.olddx]
 13529                                  					; get physical drive number
 13530                                  		; 19/10/2022 - Temporary !
 13531                                  		;db	8Ah, 96h, 8, 0	; mov dl, [bp+8]	
 13532                                  		
 13533 00001501 30E4                    		xor	ah, ah
 13534 00001503 08C0                    		or	al, al
 13535 00001505 7410                    		jz	short dointdone	; if zero sectors, return ax=0
 13536                                  		; 10/12/2022
 13537 00001507 8A6603                  		mov	ah, [bp+3]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.oldax+1]
 13538                                  					; get request code
 13539                                  		;db	8Ah, 0A6h, 3, 0	; mov ah, [bp+3]
 13540 0000150A FF7610                  		push	word [bp+10h]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.oldf]
 13541                                  		;db	0FFh, 0B6h, 10h, 0 ; push word [bp+10h]
 13542 0000150D 9D                      		popf
 13543                                  		;call	far 70h:797h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:14EAh
 13544                                  		; 17/10/2022
 13545 0000150E 9A[7207]7000            		call	DOSBIOSSEG:call_orig13
 13546                                  		;;call	call_orig13	; call far 70h:797h
 13547                                  					; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:call_orig13
 13548 00001513 9C                      		pushf
 13549                                  		; 10/12/2022
 13550 00001514 8F4610                  		pop	word [bp+10h]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.oldf]
 13551                                  		;db	8Fh, 86h, 10h, 0 ; pop word [bp+10h]
 13552                                  dointdone:				
 13553 00001517 C3                      		retn
 13554                                  
 13555                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13556                                  
 13557                                  ; 16/10/2022
 13558                                  
 13559                                  ; this is the true int 13 handler. we parse the request to see if there is
 13560                                  ; a dma violation. if so, depending on the function, we:
 13561                                  ;   read/write break the request into three pieces and move the middle one
 13562                                  ;	       into our internal buffer.
 13563                                  ;
 13564                                  ;   format     copy the format table into the buffer
 13565                                  ;   verify     point the transfer address into the buffer
 13566                                  ;
 13567                                  ; this is the biggest bogosity of all. the ibm controller does not handle
 13568                                  ; operations that cross physical 64k boundaries. in these cases, we copy
 13569                                  ; the offending sector into the buffer below and do the i/o from there.
 13570                                  
 13571                                  ;struc INT13FRAME
 13572                                  ;.oldbp: resw
 13573                                  ;.oldax: resw 
 13574                                  ;.oldbx: resw
 13575                                  ;.oldcx: resw
 13576                                  ;.olddx: resw
 13577                                  ;.oldds: resw	; now we save caller's ds, too
 13578                                  ;.olddd: resd
 13579                                  ;.oldf:	resw
 13580                                  ;end struc
 13581                                  
 13582                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13583                                  
 13584                                  ;   entry conditions:
 13585                                  ;	ah = function
 13586                                  ;	al = number of sectors
 13587                                  ;	es:bx = dma address
 13588                                  ;	cx = packed track and sector
 13589                                  ;	dx = head and drive
 13590                                  ;   output conditions:
 13591                                  ;	no dma violation.
 13592                                  
 13593                                  ;	use extreme caution when working with this code. In general,
 13594                                  ;	  all registers are hot at all times.
 13595                                  ;
 13596                                  ;	question:  does this code handle cases where dma errors
 13597                                  ;	  occur during ecc retries, and where ecc errors occur during
 13598                                  ;	  dma breakdowns???? Hmmmmm.
 13599                                  
 13600                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13601                                  
 13602                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13603                                  
 13604 00001518 90004000                dtype_array:	dd 400090h		; 40:90	is drive type array
 13605                                  
 13606                                  ; 17/10/2022
 13607                                  ;DTYPEARRAY equ dtype_array - DOSBIOSEG_2C7h ; (14F5h for MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 13608                                  ; 09/12/2022
 13609                                  DTYPEARRAY equ dtype_array
 13610                                  
 13611                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13612                                  
 13613                                  ; stick some special stuff out of mainline
 13614                                  
 13615                                  ; we know we're doing a format command. if we have changeline
 13616                                  ; support, then flag some special changed stuff and set changed
 13617                                  ; by format bit for all logical drives using this physical drive
 13618                                  
 13619                                  format_special_stuff:			
 13620 0000151C 803E[7700]00            		cmp	byte [fhave96], 0	; do we have changeline support?
 13621 00001521 7459                    		jz	short format_special_stuff_done ; brif not
 13622 00001523 53                      		push	bx
 13623 00001524 BB4001                  		mov	bx, 140h	; fchanged_by_format+fchanged
 13624 00001527 E83D04                  		call	set_changed_dl	; indicate that media changed by format
 13625 0000152A 5B                      		pop	bx
 13626 0000152B EB4F                    		jmp	short format_special_stuff_done
 13627                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13628                                  
 13629                                  ; 16/10/2022
 13630                                  
 13631                                  ; we know we've got ec35's on the system. Now see if we're doing
 13632                                  ; a floppy. If so, create a mask and see if this particular
 13633                                  ; drive is an ec35. If so, set dtype_array[drive]=93h
 13634                                  
 13635                                  		; 19/10/2022
 13636                                  ec35_special_stuff:			
 13637 0000152D 84D2                    		test	dl, dl		; floppy or hard disk?
 13638 0000152F 7852                    		js	short ec35_special_stuff_done ;	if hard	drive, we're done
 13639 00001531 50                      		push	ax		; see if this PARTICULAR drive is ec35
 13640 00001532 51                      		push	cx
 13641 00001533 88D1                    		mov	cl, dl		; turn drive number into bit map
 13642 00001535 B001                    		mov	al, 1		; assume drive 0
 13643 00001537 D2E0                    		shl	al, cl		; shift	over correct number of times
 13644 00001539 8406[2905]              		test	[ec35flag], al	; electrically compatible 3.5 incher?
 13645 0000153D 59                      		pop	cx
 13646 0000153E 58                      		pop	ax
 13647 0000153F 7442                    		jz	short ec35_special_stuff_done
 13648                                  					; done if this floppy is not an	ec35
 13649 00001541 53                      		push	bx		; free up a far	pointer	(es:bx)
 13650 00001542 06                      		push	es
 13651                                  		; 17/10/2022
 13652 00001543 2EC41E[1815]            		les	bx, [cs:DTYPEARRAY]
 13653                                  		;les	bx, dword ptr cs:DTYPEARRAY ; [cs:dtype_array]
 13654                                  					; 0070h:3A65h =	2C7h:14F5h
 13655 00001548 00D3                    		add	bl, dl
 13656 0000154A 80D700                  		adc	bh, 0		; find entry for this drive
 13657 0000154D 26C60793                		mov	byte [es:bx], 93h ; establish drive type as:
 13658                                  					; (360k	disk in	360k drive,
 13659                                  					; no double-stepping, 250 kbs transfer rate)
 13660 00001551 07                      		pop	es
 13661 00001552 5B                      		pop	bx
 13662 00001553 EB2E                    		jmp	short ec35_special_stuff_done
 13663                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13664                                  
 13665                                  ; 16/10/2022
 13666                                  
 13667                                  ; ps2_30 machine has some problem with ah=8h (read drive parm), int 13h.
 13668                                  ; this function does not reset the common buses after the execution.
 13669                                  ; to solve this problem, when we detect ah=8h, then we will save the result and
 13670                                  ; will issue ah=1 (read status) call to reset the buses.
 13671                                  
 13672                                  ps2_special_stuff:			
 13673 00001555 803E[1E00]08            		cmp	byte [prevoper], 8 ; (ps2_30)
 13674                                  					; read driver parm ?
 13675 0000155A 7407                    		jz	short ps2_30_problem
 13676 0000155C 803E[1E00]15            		cmp	byte [prevoper], 15h
 13677                                  					; apparently function 15h fails, too
 13678 00001561 752D                    		jnz	short ps2_special_stuff_done
 13679                                  ps2_30_problem:				
 13680 00001563 50                      		push	ax
 13681 00001564 B401                    		mov	ah, 1
 13682                                  		;;call	far 70:797h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:1543h
 13683                                  		; 17/10/2022
 13684 00001566 9A[7207]7000            		call	DOSBIOSSEG:call_orig13
 13685                                  		;call	call_orig13	; call far 70:797h
 13686                                  					; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:call_orig13
 13687 0000156B 58                      		pop	ax
 13688 0000156C EB22                    		jmp	short ps2_special_stuff_done
 13689                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13690                                  
 13691                                  ; 17/10/2022
 13692                                  ; 16/10/2022
 13693                                  
 13694                                  ; here is the actual int13 handler
 13695                                  
 13696                                  i13z:					; 0070h:3ABBh =	02C7h:154Bh
 13697                                  
 13698                                  ; cas -- inefficient! could push ds and load ds-> Bios_Data before
 13699                                  ; vectoring up here from Bios_Data
 13700                                  
 13701                                  		; 19/10/2022
 13702 0000156E 1E                      		push	ds		; save caller's ds register first thing
 13703                                  		;;mov	ds, word [cs:0030h]
 13704                                  					; and set up our own ds -> Bios_Data
 13705 0000156F 2E8E1E[3000]            		mov	ds, [cs:BIOSDATAWORD]
 13706                                  		;mov	ds, word ptr cs:BIOSDATAWORD ; [cs:0030h]
 13707                                  					; = [02C7h:0030h] = [0070h:25A0h]
 13708                                  
 13709                                  ; let the operation proceed. if there is a dma violation, then we do things
 13710                                  
 13711 00001574 A3[1E00]                		mov	[prevoper], ax	; save request
 13712 00001577 80FC05                  		cmp	ah, 5		; romformat
 13713 0000157A 74A0                    		jz	short format_special_stuff
 13714                                  					; go do special stuff for format
 13715                                   format_special_stuff_done:		
 13716 0000157C 803E[2905]00            		cmp	byte [ec35flag], 0 ; any electrically compat 3.5 inchers?
 13717 00001581 75AA                    		jnz	short ec35_special_stuff
 13718                                  					; go handle it out of line if so
 13719                                  ec35_special_stuff_done:
 13720                                  		;;call	far 70:797h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:1560h		
 13721 00001583 9A[7207]7000            		call	DOSBIOSSEG:call_orig13
 13722                                  		;call	call_orig13	; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:call_orig13
 13723                                  		
 13724 00001588 9C                      		pushf			; save result flags
 13725
