 13727                                  					; mdl_ps2_30
 13728 0000158E 74C5                    		jz	short ps2_special_stuff
 13729                                  					; exit mainline to address special
 13730                                  ps2_special_stuff_done:			; ps2/30 problem if so		
 13731 00001590 9D                      		popf
 13732 00001591 7221                    		jb	short goterr13	; error	on original orig13 call-thru?
 13733                                  ret_from_i13:				
 13734 00001593 1F                      		pop	ds
 13735 00001594 CA0200                  		retf	2		; restore ds &	iret w/flags
 13736                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13737                                  
 13738                                  ; most of our code exits through here. If carry isn't set, then
 13739                                  ; just do a simple exit. Else doublecheck that we aren't getting
 13740                                  ; a changeline error.
 13741                                  
 13742                                  i13ret_ck_chglinerr:			
 13743 00001597 73FA                    		jnb	short ret_from_i13 ; done if not an error termination
 13744                                  i13_ret_error:				
 13745 00001599 80FC06                  		cmp	ah, 6		; did i	see a change event?
 13746 0000159C 7513                    		jnz	short int13b	; skip if wrong	error
 13747 0000159E 08D2                    		or	dl, dl		; is this for the hard disk?
 13748 000015A0 780F                    		js	short int13b	; yes, ignore
 13749 000015A2 803E[7700]00            		cmp	byte [fhave96], 0
 13750 000015A7 7408                    		jz	short int13b	; just in case ROM returned this
 13751                                  					; error	even though it told us it
 13752                                  					; never	would
 13753 000015A9 53                      		push	bx
 13754 000015AA BB4000                  		mov	bx, 40h		; fchanged
 13755 000015AD E8B703                  		call	set_changed_dl
 13756 000015B0 5B                      		pop	bx
 13757                                  int13b:					
 13758 000015B1 F9                      		stc			; now return the error
 13759 000015B2 EBDF                    		jmp	short ret_from_i13
 13760                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13761                                  
 13762                                  ; some kind of error occurred. see if it is dma violation
 13763                                  
 13764                                  goterr13:				
 13765 000015B4 80FC09                  		cmp	ah, 9		; dma error?
 13766 000015B7 747C                    		jz	short gotdmaerr
 13767                                  goterr13_xxxx:				
 13768 000015B9 80FC11                  		cmp	ah, 11h		; ecc error?
 13769 000015BC 75DB                    		jnz	short i13_ret_error ; other error. just	return back.
 13770 000015BE 803E[3006]01            		cmp	byte [media_set_for_format], 1 ; formatting?
 13771 000015C3 74D4                    		jz	short i13_ret_error
 13772                                  
 13773 000015C5 803E[1F00]02            		cmp	byte [prevoper+1], 2
 13774                                  		;cmp	byte ptr ds:prevoper+1,	2 ; ecc-corrected error
 13775                                  					; (2 = romread)
 13776                                  					; ECC correction only applies to reads
 13777 000015CA 75CD                    		jnz	short i13_ret_error
 13778                                  
 13779 000015CC 30E4                    		xor	ah, ah
 13780                                  		;;call	far 70:797h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:15ABh
 13781                                  		; 17/10/2022
 13782 000015CE 9A[7207]7000            		call	DOSBIOSSEG:call_orig13
 13783                                  		;call	call_orig13	; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:call_orig13
 13784                                  					; call far 70:797h
 13785 000015D3 A1[1E00]                		mov	ax, [prevoper]
 13786 000015D6 30E4                    		xor	ah, ah		; return code =	no error
 13787 000015D8 3C01                    		cmp	al, 1		; if request for one sector, assume ok
 13788 000015DA 74B7                    		jz	short ret_from_i13 ; return with carry clear
 13789 000015DC 53                      		push	bx
 13790 000015DD 51                      		push	cx
 13791 000015DE 52                      		push	dx
 13792 000015DF A2[2000]                		mov	[number_of_sec], al
 13793                                  loop_ecc:				
 13794 000015E2 B80102                  		mov	ax, 201h	; read one sector
 13795                                  
 13796                                  ; we do reads one sector at a time. this ensures that we will eventually
 13797                                  ; finish the request since ecc errors on one sector do read in that sector.
 13798                                  ;
 13799                                  ; we need to put in some "intelligence" into the ecc handler to handle reads
 13800                                  ; that attempt to read more sectors than are available on a particular
 13801                                  ; track.
 13802                                  ;
 13803                                  ; we call check_wrap to set up the sector #, head # and cylinder # for
 13804                                  ; this request.
 13805                                  ;
 13806                                  ; at this point, all registers are set up for the call to orig13, except
 13807                                  ; that there may be a starting sector number that is bigger than the number
 13808                                  ; of sectors on a track.
 13809                                  ;
 13810 000015E5 E88FFE                  		call	check_wrap	; get correct parameters for int 13
 13811                                  		;;call	far 70:797h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:15C5h
 13812                                  		; 17/10/2022
 13813 000015E8 9A[7207]7000            		call	DOSBIOSSEG:call_orig13
 13814                                  		;call	call_orig13	; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:call_orig13
 13815 000015ED 730C                    		jnb	short ok11_op
 13816 000015EF 80FC09                  		cmp	ah, 9		; DMA error during ECC read?
 13817 000015F2 741B                    		jz	short handle_dma_during_ecc
 13818 000015F4 80FC11                  		cmp	ah, 11h		; only allow ecc errors
 13819 000015F7 7510                    		jnz	short ok11_exit_err
 13820                                  		; 10/12/2022
 13821                                  		; xor ax ax -> ah = 0
 13822                                  		;mov	ah, 0		; ecc error. reset the system again.
 13823 000015F9 31C0                    		xor	ax, ax		; clear	the error code so that if this
 13824                                  					; was the last sector, no error	code
 13825                                  					; will be returned for the corrected
 13826                                  					; read.	(clear carry too.)
 13827                                  ok11_op:				
 13828 000015FB FE0E[2000]              		dec	byte [number_of_sec]
 13829 000015FF 7409                    		jz	short ok11_exit	; all done?
 13830 00001601 FEC1                    		inc	cl		; advance sector number
 13831                                  					; add 200h to address
 13832 00001603 FEC7                    		inc	bh
 13833 00001605 FEC7                    		inc	bh
 13834 00001607 EBD9                    		jmp	short loop_ecc
 13835                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13836                                  
 13837                                  ; locate error returns centrally
 13838                                  
 13839                                  ok11_exit_err:				
 13840 00001609 F9                      		stc			; set carry bit again.
 13841                                  ok11_exit:				
 13842 0000160A 5A                      		pop	dx
 13843 0000160B 59                      		pop	cx
 13844 0000160C 5B                      		pop	bx
 13845 0000160D EB88                    		jmp	short i13ret_ck_chglinerr
 13846                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13847                                  
 13848                                  ; do the single sector read again, this time into our temporary
 13849                                  ; buffer, which is guaranteed not to have a DMA error, then
 13850                                  ; move the data to its proper location and proceed
 13851                                  
 13852                                  handle_dma_during_ecc:			
 13853 0000160F 06                      		push	es
 13854 00001610 53                      		push	bx
 13855 00001611 BB[4E01]                		mov	bx, disksector
 13856 00001614 1E                      		push	ds
 13857 00001615 07                      		pop	es		; point es:bx to buffer
 13858 00001616 B80102                  		mov	ax, 201h	; read one sector
 13859                                  		;;call	far 70:797h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:15F8h
 13860                                  		; 17/10/2022
 13861 00001619 9A[7207]7000            		call	DOSBIOSSEG:call_orig13
 13862                                  		;call	call_orig13	; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:call_orig13
 13863 0000161E 5B                      		pop	bx
 13864 0000161F 07                      		pop	es
 13865 00001620 7305                    		jnb	short handle_dma_during_ecc_noerr
 13866 00001622 80FC11                  		cmp	ah, 11h
 13867 00001625 75E2                    		jnz	short ok11_exit_err ; if anything but ecc error, bomb out
 13868                                  
 13869                                  ; now we're kosher. Copy the data to where it belongs and resume
 13870                                  ; the ECC looping code.
 13871                                  
 13872                                  handle_dma_during_ecc_noerr:		
 13873 00001627 56                      		push	si
 13874 00001628 57                      		push	di
 13875 00001629 89DF                    		mov	di, bx
 13876 0000162B BE[4E01]                		mov	si, disksector
 13877 0000162E E82BFE                  		call	move_sector
 13878 00001631 5F                      		pop	di
 13879 00001632 5E                      		pop	si
 13880 00001633 EBC6                    		jmp	short ok11_op
 13881                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13882                                  
 13883                                  ; we truly have a dma violation. restore register ax and retry the
 13884                                  ; operation as best we can.
 13885                                  
 13886                                  gotdmaerr:				
 13887 00001635 A1[1E00]                		mov	ax, [prevoper]	; 19/10/2022
 13888 00001638 FB                      		sti
 13889 00001639 80FC02                  		cmp	ah, 2		; romread
 13890 0000163C 723B                    		jb	short i13_done_dmaerr
 13891                                  					; just pass dma error thru for
 13892                                  					; functions we don't handle
 13893 0000163E 80FC04                  		cmp	ah, 4		; romverify
 13894 00001641 743C                    		jz	short intverify
 13895 00001643 80FC05                  		cmp	ah, 5		; romformat
 13896 00001646 7448                    		jz	short intformat
 13897 00001648 772F                    		ja	short i13_done_dmaerr
 13898                                  
 13899                                  ; we are doing a read/write call. check for dma problems
 13900                                  
 13901                                  ;	******** set up stack frame here!!! ********
 13902                                  
 13903 0000164A 52                      		push	dx
 13904 0000164B 51                      		push	cx
 13905 0000164C 53                      		push	bx
 13906 0000164D 50                      		push	ax
 13907 0000164E 55                      		push	bp
 13908 0000164F 89E5                    		mov	bp, sp
 13909 00001651 8CC2                    		mov	dx, es		; check	for 64k	boundary error
 13910 00001653 D1E2                    		shl	dx, 1
 13911 00001655 D1E2                    		shl	dx, 1
 13912 00001657 D1E2                    		shl	dx, 1
 13913 00001659 D1E2                    		shl	dx, 1		; segment converted to absolute	address
 13914 0000165B 01DA                    		add	dx, bx		; combine with offset
 13915 0000165D 81C2FF01                		add	dx, 511		; simulate a transfer
 13916                                  
 13917                                  ; if carry is set, then we are within 512 bytes of the end of the segment.
 13918                                  ; we skip the first transfer and perform the remaining buffering and transfer
 13919                                  
 13920 00001661 7303                    		jnb	short no_skip_first
 13921 00001663 E98300                  		jmp	bufferx		; restore dh=head & do buffer
 13922                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13923                                  
 13924                                  no_skip_first:				
 13925 00001666 D0EE                    		shr	dh, 1		; dh = number of sectors before	address
 13926 00001668 B480                    		mov	ah, 128		; ah = max number of sectors in	segment
 13927 0000166A 28F4                    		sub	ah, dh
 13928                                  
 13929                                  ; ah is now the number of sectors that we can successfully write in this
 13930                                  ; segment. if this number is above or equal to the requested number, then we
 13931                                  ; continue the operation as normal. otherwise, we break it into pieces.
 13932                                  ;
 13933                                  ; wait a sec. this is goofy. the whole reason we got here in the
 13934                                  ; first place is because we got a dma error. so it's impossible
 13935                                  ; for the whole block to fit, unless the dma error was returned
 13936                                  ; in error.
 13937                                  
 13938 0000166C 38C4                    		cmp	ah, al		; can we fit it	in?
 13939 0000166E 7236                    		jb	short doblock	; no, perform blocking.
 13940                                  
 13941                                  ; yes, the request fits. let it happen.
 13942                                  
 13943 00001670 8A7609                  		mov	dh, [bp+9]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.olddx+1]
 13944                                  					; set up head number
 13945 00001673 E888FE                  		call	doint
 13946 00001676 E9D900                  		jmp	bad13		; and return from this place
 13947                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13948                                  
 13949                                  i13_done_dmaerr:			
 13950 00001679 B409                    		mov	ah, 9		; pass dma error thru to caller
 13951 0000167B F9                      		stc
 13952 0000167C E914FF                  		jmp	ret_from_i13	; return with error,
 13953                                  					; we know it's not a changeline error
 13954                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13955                                  
 13956                                  ; verify the given sectors. place the buffer pointer into our space.
 13957                                  
 13958                                  intverify:				
 13959 0000167F 06                      		push	es		; save caller's dma address
 13960 00001680 53                      		push	bx
 13961 00001681 1E                      		push	ds		; es:bx	-> Bios_Data:disksector
 13962 00001682 07                      		pop	es
 13963                                  dosimple:				
 13964 00001683 BB[4E01]                		mov	bx, disksector
 13965                                  					; do the i/o from Bios_Data:disksector
 13966                                  		;;call	far 70:797h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:1665h
 13967                                  		; 17/10/2022
 13968 00001686 9A[7207]7000            		call	DOSBIOSSEG:call_orig13
 13969                                  		;call	call_orig13	; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:call_orig13
 13970 0000168B 5B                      		pop	bx
 13971 0000168C 07                      		pop	es
 13972 0000168D E907FF                  		jmp	i13ret_ck_chglinerr
 13973                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13974                                  
 13975                                  ; format operation. copy the parameter table into Bios_Data:disksector
 13976                                  
 13977                                  intformat:				
 13978 00001690 06                      		push	es
 13979 00001691 53                      		push	bx
 13980 00001692 56                      		push	si
 13981 00001693 57                      		push	di
 13982 00001694 1E                      		push	ds
 13983                                  
 13984                                  ; point ds to the caller's dma buffer, es to Bios_Data
 13985                                  ; in other words, swap (ds, es)
 13986                                  
 13987 00001695 06                      		push	es
 13988 00001696 1E                      		push	ds
 13989 00001697 07                      		pop	es
 13990 00001698 1F                      		pop	ds
 13991 00001699 89DE                    		mov	si, bx
 13992 0000169B BF[4E01]                		mov	di, disksector
 13993 0000169E E8BBFD                  		call	move_sector	; user's data into Bios_Data:disksector
 13994 000016A1 1F                      		pop	ds
 13995 000016A2 5F                      		pop	di
 13996 000016A3 5E                      		pop	si		; do the i/o from
 13997 000016A4 EBDD                    		jmp	short dosimple	; Bios_Data:disksector
 13998                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13999                                  
 14000                                  ; we can't fit the request into the entire block. perform the operation on
 14001                                  ; the first block.
 14002                                  ;
 14003                                  ; doblock is modified to correctly handle multi-sector disk i/o.
 14004                                  ; old doblock had added the number of sectors i/oed (ah in old doblock) after
 14005                                  ; the doint call to cl. observing only the lower 6 bits of cl(=max. 64) can
 14006                                  ; represent a starting sector, if ah was big, then cl would be clobbered.
 14007                                  ; by the way, we still are going to use cl for this purpose since checkwrap
 14008                                  ; routine will use it as an input. to prevent cl from being clobbered, a
 14009                                  ; safe number of sectors should be calculated like "63 - # of sectors/track".
 14010                                  ; doblock will handle the first block of requested sectors within the
 14011                                  ; boundary of this safe value.
 14012                                  
 14013                                  doblock:
 14014                                  
 14015                                  ; try to get the # of sectors/track from bds via rom drive number.
 14016                                  ; for any mini disks installed, here we have to pray that they have the
 14017                                  ; same # of sector/track as the main dos partition disk drive.
 14018                                  				
 14019 000016A6 8B5608                  		mov	dx, [bp+8]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.olddx]
 14020                                  					; get head #, drive #
 14021 000016A9 51                      		push	cx
 14022 000016AA 06                      		push	es
 14023 000016AB 57                      		push	di		; ah - # of sectors before dma boundary
 14024                                  					; al - requested # of sectors for i/o.
 14025 000016AC E83BFE                  		call	find_bds
 14026 000016AF 268B4D13                		mov	cx, [es:di+13h]	; [es:di+BDS.secpertrack]
 14027                                  		; 12/12/2022
 14028 000016B3 26F6452301              		test	byte [es:di+23h], 1
 14029                                  		;test	word [es:di+23h], 1 ; [es:di+BDS.flags],fnon_removable
 14030 000016B8 5F                      		pop	di
 14031 000016B9 07                      		pop	es
 14032 000016BA 88E0                    		mov	al, ah		; set al=ah for	floppies
 14033 000016BC 7404                    		jz	short doblockflop ; they are track by track operation
 14034 000016BE B43F                    		mov	ah, 63		; ah = 63-secpt	(# safe	sectors??)
 14035 000016C0 28CC                    		sub	ah, cl		; al - # of sectors before dma boundary
 14036                                  doblockflop:				
 14037 000016C2 59                      		pop	cx
 14038                                  doblockcontinue:			
 14039 000016C3 38C4                    		cmp	ah, al		; if safe_# >= #_of_sectors_to_go_before dma,
 14040 000016C5 7305                    		jnb	short doblocklast ; then #_of_sectors_to_go as it is for doint.
 14041 000016C7 50                      		push	ax
 14042 000016C8 88E0                    		mov	al, ah		; otherwise, set al to ah to operate.
 14043 000016CA EB03                    		jmp	short doblockdoint
 14044                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14045                                  
 14046                                  doblocklast:				
 14047 000016CC 88C4                    		mov	ah, al
 14048 000016CE 50                      		push	ax
 14049                                  doblockdoint:				; let ah = al =	# of sectors for this shot	
 14050 000016CF E82CFE                  		call	doint
 14051 000016D2 727E                    		jb	short bad13	; something happened, bye!
 14052 000016D4 58                      		pop	ax
 14053 000016D5 286602                  		sub	[bp+2],	ah	; sub [bp+INT13FRAME.oldax], ah
 14054                                  					; decrement by the successful operation
 14055 000016D8 00E1                    		add	cl, ah		; advance sector #. safety gauranteed.
 14056 000016DA 00E7                    		add	bh, ah		; advance dma addres
 14057 000016DC 00E7                    		add	bh, ah		; twice	for 512	byte sectors
 14058 000016DE 38C4                    		cmp	ah, al		; check	the previous value
 14059 000016E0 740A                    		jz	short buffer	; if #_of_sectors_to_go	< safe_#,
 14060                                  					; then we are done already.
 14061 000016E2 28E0                    		sub	al, ah		; otherwise,
 14062                                  					; #_sector_to_go = #_of_sector_to_go - safe_#
 14063 000016E4 E890FD                  		call	check_wrap	; get new cx, dh for the next operation.
 14064 000016E7 EBDA                    		jmp	short doblockcontinue ;	handles	next sectors left.
 14065                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14066                                  
 14067                                  bufferx:				
 14068 000016E9 8A7609                  		mov	dh, [bp+9]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.olddx+1]
 14069                                  					; set up head number
 14070                                  buffer:					
 14071 000016EC 53                      		push	bx
 14072 000016ED 8A6603                  		mov	ah, [bp+3]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.oldax+1]
 14073 000016F0 80FC03                  		cmp	ah, 3		; romwrite
 14074 000016F3 7525                    		jnz	short doread	;
 14075                                  					
 14076                                  ; copy the offending sector into local buffer
 14077                                  
 14078 000016F5 06                      		push	es
 14079 000016F6 1E                      		push	ds
 14080 000016F7 56                      		push	si
 14081 000016F8 57                      		push	di
 14082 000016F9 1E                      		push	ds		; exchange segment registers
 14083 000016FA 06                      		push	es
 14084 000016FB 1F                      		pop	ds
 14085 000016FC 07                      		pop	es
 14086 000016FD BF[4E01]                		mov	di, disksector	; where to move
 14087 00001700 57                      		push	di		; save it
 14088 00001701 89DE                    		mov	si, bx		; source
 14089 00001703 E856FD                  		call	move_sector	; move sector into local buffer
 14090 00001706 5B                      		pop	bx		; new transfer address
 14091                                  					; (es:bx = Bios_Data:diskbuffer)
 14092 00001707 5F                      		pop	di		; restore caller's di & si
 14093 00001708 5E                      		pop	si
 14094 00001709 1F                      		pop	ds		; restore Bios_Data
 14095                                  
 14096                                  ; see if we are wrapping around a track or head
 14097                                  
 14098 0000170A B001                    		mov	al, 1		; [bp+INT13FRAME.olddx]
 14099                                  					; get drive number
 14100 0000170C 8A5608                  		mov	dl, [bp+8]
 14101 0000170F E865FD                  		call	check_wrap	; sets up registers if wrap-around
 14102                                  					;
 14103                                  					; ah is	function
 14104                                  					; al is	1 for single sector transfer
 14105                                  					; es:bx	is local transfer addres
 14106                                  					; cx is	track/sector number
 14107                                  					; dx is	head/drive number
 14108                                  					; si,di	unchanged
 14109 00001712 E8E9FD                  		call	doint
 14110 00001715 07                      		pop	es		; restore caller's dma segment
 14111 00001716 723A                    		jb	short bad13	; go clean up
 14112 00001718 EB22                    		jmp	short dotail
 14113                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14114                                  
 14115                                  ; reading a sector. do int first, then move things around
 14116                                  
 14117                                  doread:					
 14118 0000171A 06                      		push	es
 14119 0000171B 53                      		push	bx
 14120 0000171C 1E                      		push	ds		; es = Bios_Code
 14121 0000171D 07                      		pop	es
 14122 0000171E BB[4E01]                		mov	bx, disksector
 14123 00001721 B001                    		mov	al, 1
 14124 00001723 8A5608                  		mov	dl, [bp+8]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.olddx]
 14125                                  					; get drive number
 14126 00001726 E84EFD                  		call	check_wrap	;
 14127                                  					; ah = function
 14128                                  					; al = 1 for single sector
 14129                                  					; es:bx	points to local	buffer
 14130                                  					; cx, dx are track/sector, head/drive
 14131 00001729 E8D2FD                  		call	doint
 14132 0000172C 5B                      		pop	bx
 14133 0000172D 07                      		pop	es
 14134 0000172E 7222                    		jb	short bad13
 14135 00001730 56                      		push	si
 14136 00001731 57                      		push	di
 14137 00001732 89DF                    		mov	di, bx
 14138 00001734 BE[4E01]                		mov	si, disksector
 14139 00001737 E822FD                  		call	move_sector
 14140 0000173A 5F                      		pop	di
 14141 0000173B 5E                      		pop	si
 14142                                  
 14143                                  ; note the fact that we've done 1 more sector
 14144                                  
 14145                                  dotail:					
 14146 0000173C 5B                      		pop	bx		; retrieve new dma area
 14147 0000173D 80C702                  		add	bh, 2		; advance over sector
 14148 00001740 41                      		inc	cx
 14149 00001741 8A4602                  		mov	al, [bp+2]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.oldax]
 14150 00001744 F8                      		clc
 14151 00001745 FEC8                    		dec	al
 14152 00001747 7409                    		jz	short bad13	; no more i/o
 14153                                  
 14154                                  ; see if we wrap around a track or head boundary with starting sector
 14155                                  ; we already have the correct head number to pass to check_wrap
 14156                                  
 14157 00001749 8A5608                  		mov	dl, [bp+8]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.olddx]
 14158 0000174C E828FD                  		call	check_wrap
 14159 0000174F E8ACFD                  		call	doint
 14160                                  
 14161                                  ; we are done. ax has the final code; we throw away what we got before
 14162                                  
 14163                                  ; M046  -- okay gang. Now we've either terminated our DMA loop,
 14164                                  ;	   or we've finished. If carry is set now, our only
 14165                                  ;	   hope for salvation is that it was a read operation
 14166                                  ;	   and the error code is ECC error. In that case, we'll
 14167                                  ;	   just pop the registers and go do the old ECC thing.
 14168                                  ;	   When the DMA error that got us here in the first
 14169                                  ;	   place occurs, it'll handle it.
 14170                                  
 14171                                  bad13:					
 14172 00001752 89EC                    		mov	sp, bp
 14173 00001754 5D                      		pop	bp
 14174 00001755 5B                      		pop	bx
 14175 00001756 5B                      		pop	bx
 14176 00001757 59                      		pop	cx
 14177 00001758 5A                      		pop	dx
 14178 00001759 7203                    		jb	short xgoterr13_xxxx ; go handle ECC errors
 14179 0000175B E935FE                  		jmp	ret_from_i13	; non-error exit
 14180                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14181                                  
 14182                                  xgoterr13_xxxx:				
 14183 0000175E E958FE                  		jmp	goterr13_xxxx
 14184                                  
 14185                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14186                                  		; 10/12/2022
 14187                                  		;db 	0
 14188                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14189                                  
 14190                                  ;Bios_Code ends

 14200                                  dsk_init:				; 2C7h:1742h = 70h:3CB2h

 14208                                  
 14209                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14210                                  ; install_bds installs a bds at location es:di into the current linked list of
 14211                                  ; bds maintained by this device driver. it places the bds at the end of the
 14212                                  ; list. Trashes (at least) ax, bx, di, si
 14213                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14214                                  
 14215                                  install_bds:
 14216 0000176D 1E                      		push	ds		; save Bios_Data segment
 14217 0000176E BE[1901]                		mov	si, start_bds	; beginning of chain
 14218                                  
 14219                                  		; ds:si now points to link to first bds
 14220                                  		; assume bds list is non-empty
 14221                                  loop_next_bds:
 14222 00001771 C534                    		lds	si, [si]	; [si+BDS.link]
 14223                                  					; fetch	next bds
 14224 00001773 268A4504                		mov	al, [es:di+4]	; [es:di+BDS.drivenum]
 14225 00001777 384404                  		cmp	[si+4],	al	; does this one	share a	physical
 14226                                  					; drive	with new one?
 14227 0000177A 7518                    		jnz	short next_bds
 14228 0000177C B310                    		mov	bl, 10h		; fi_am_mult
 14229 0000177E 26085D23                		or	[es:di+23h], bl	; [es:di+BDS.flags]
 14230                                  					; set both of them to i_am_mult	if so
 14231 00001782 085C23                  		or	[si+23h], bl	; [si+BDS.flags]
 14232 00001785 26806523DF              		and	byte [es:di+23h], 0DFh ; [es:di+BDS.flags],~fi_own_physical
 14233                                  					; we don't own it
 14234 0000178A 8A5C23                  		mov	bl, [si+23h]	; [si+BDS.flags]
 14235                                  					; determine if changeline available
 14236 0000178D 80E302                  		and	bl, 2		; fchangeline
 14237 00001790 26085D23                		or	[es:di+23h], bl	; [es:di+BDS.flags]
 14238                                  next_bds:
 14239                                  		; 02/09/2023 (PCDOS 7.1)
 14240 00001794 B8FFFF                  		mov	ax, 0FFFFh	; -1
 14241 00001797 3904                    		cmp	[si], ax	; [si+BDS.link],-1
 14242                                  		;cmp	word [si], 0FFFFh ; [si+BDS.link],-1
 14243                                  					; are we at end	of list?
 14244 00001799 75D6                    		jnz	short loop_next_bds
 14245 0000179B 8C4402                  		mov	[si+2], es	; [si+BDS.link+2],es
 14246                                  					; install bds
 14247 0000179E 893C                    		mov	[si], di
 14248 000017A0 268905                  		mov	[es:di], ax	; [es:di+BDS.link],-1
 14249                                  		;mov	word [es:di], 0FFFFh ; [es:di+BDS.link],-1
 14250                                  					; set next pointer to null
 14251 000017A3 1F                      		pop	ds
 14252

 14354                                  ; 16/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)

 14356                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------
 14357                                  ; include msbio.cl2 (MSDOS 6.0, 1991)
 14358                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------
 14359                                  ; (MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:17D5h)
 14360                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------
 14361                                  ; 17/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 14362                                  
 14363                                  		; MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS offset 0070h:3D38h or 02C7h:17C8h
 14364 000017F4 0D0A                    sngmsg:		db 0Dh,0Ah
 14365 000017F6 496E73657274206469-     		db 'Insert diskette for drive '
 14365 000017FF 736B6574746520666F-
 14365 00001808 7220647269766520   
 14366                                  
 14367                                  		; MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS offset 0070h:3D54h or 02C7h:17E4h
 14368 00001810 413A20616E64207072-     drvlet:		db 'A: and press any key when ready',0Dh,0Ah
 14368 00001819 65737320616E79206B-
 14368 00001822 6579207768656E2072-
 14368 0000182B 656164790D0A       
 14369 00001831 0A00                    		db 0Ah,0
 14370                                  
 14371                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 14372                                  
 14373                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14374                                  ; input : es:di points to current bds for drive.
 14375                                  ; return : zero set if no open files
 14376                                  ;	   zero reset if open files
 14377                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14378                                  
 14379                                  chkopcnt:		
 14380 00001833 26837D2000              		cmp	word [es:di+20h], 0 ; [es:di+BDS.opcnt]
 14381 00001838 C3                      		retn
 14382                                  
 14383                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 14384                                  
 14385                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14386                                  ; at media check time, we need to really get down and check what the change is.
 14387                                  ; this is guaranteed to be expensive.
 14388                                  ;
 14389                                  ;	es:di -> bds, ds -> Bios_Data
 14390                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14391                                  
 14392                                  mediacheck:	
 14393 00001839 E89CF0                  		call	checksingle	; make sure correct disk is in place
 14394 0000183C 31F6                    		xor	si, si
 14395 0000183E E84D01                  		call	haschange
 14396 00001841 742F                    		jz	short mediaret
 14397 00001843 E83C01                  		call	checkromchange
 14398 00001846 752B                    		jnz	short mediadovolid
 14399 00001848 50                      		push	ax
 14400 00001849 52                      		push	dx
 14401 0000184A 268A5504                		mov	dl, [es:di+4]	; [es:di+BDS.drivenum]
 14402                                  					; set logical drive number
 14403 0000184E B416                    		mov	ah, 16h
 14404 00001850 CD13                    		int	13h		; DISK - FLOPPY	DISK - CHANGE OF DISK STATUS (AT,XT2,XT286,CONV,PS)
 14405                                  					; DL = drive to	check
 14406                                  					; Return: AH = disk change status
 14407 00001852 5A                      		pop	dx
 14408 00001853 58                      		pop	ax
 14409 00001854 721D                    		jb	short mediadovolid
 14410 00001856 BE0100                  		mov	si, 1		; signal no change
 14411                                  
 14412                                  ; there are some drives with changeline that "lose" the changeline indication
 14413                                  ; if a different drive is accessed after the current one. in order to avoid
 14414                                  ; missing a media change, we return an "i don't know" to dos if the changeline
 14415                                  ; is not active and we are accessing a different drive from the last one.
 14416                                  ; if we are accessing the same drive, then we can safely rely on the changeline
 14417                                  ; status.
 14418                                  		; 19/10/2022
 14419 00001859 8A1E[1E01]              		mov	bl, [tim_drv]	; get last drive accessed
 14420 0000185D 26385D04                		cmp	[es:di+4], bl	; [es:di+BDS.drivenum]
 14421                                  					; (If the last drive accessed is not current drive
 14422                                  					; media	change status may be incorrect.	So,
 14423                                  					; "I don't now" will be returned even if it is indicated
 14424                                  					; as media is not changed.)
 14425 00001861 740F                    		jz	short mediaret	; (same	drive,
 14426                                  					; media	changeline indication is reliable)
 14427                                  
 14428                                  ; do the 2 second twiddle. if time >= 2 seconds, do a volid check.
 14429                                  ; otherwise return "i don't know" (strictly speaking, we should return a
 14430                                  ; "not changed" here since the 2 second test said no change.)
 14431                                  
 14432 00001863 50                      		push	ax
 14433 00001864 51                      		push	cx
 14434 00001865 52                      		push	dx
 14435 00001866 E88DED                  		call	Check_Time_Of_Access
 14436 00001869 5A                      		pop	dx
 14437 0000186A 59                      		pop	cx
 14438 0000186B 58                      		pop	ax
 14439 0000186C 09F6                    		or	si, si
 14440 0000186E 7403                    		jz	short mediadovolid ; check_time	says ">= 2 secs	passed"
 14441                                  					; (volume id will be checked)
 14442 00001870 31F6                    		xor	si, si		; return "i don't know"
 14443                                  mediaret:				
 14444 00001872 C3                      		retn
 14445                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14446                                  
 14447                                  ; somehow the media was changed. look at vid to see. we do not look at fat
 14448                                  ; because this may be different since we only set medbyt when doing a read
 14449                                  ; or write.
 14450                                  
 14451                                  mediadovolid:				
 14452 00001873 E820EE                  		call	GetBp		; build	a new bpb in current bds
 14453 00001876 72FA                    		jb	short mediaret
 14454 00001878 E82D00                  		call	check_vid
 14455 0000187B 73F5                    		jnb	short mediaret
 14456 0000187D E9EBF3                  		jmp	maperror	; fix up al for	return to dos
 14457                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14458                                  
 14459                                  ; simple, quick check of latched change. if no indication, then return
 14460                                  ; otherwise do expensive check. if the expensive test fails, pop off the
 14461                                  ; return and set al = 15 (for invalid media change) which will be returned to
 14462                                  ; dos.
 14463                                  ;
 14464                                  ; for dos 3.3, this will work only for the drive that has changeline.
 14465                                  
 14466                                  ;	call with es:di -> bds, ds -> Bios_Data
 14467                                  ;	***** warning:  this routine will return one level up on the stack
 14468                                  ;			if an error occurs!
 14469                                  
 14470                                  checklatchio:	
 14471                                  
 14472                                  ; if returning fake bpb then assume the disk has not changed
 14473                                  			
 14474 00001880 E8B0FF                  		call	chkopcnt
 14475 00001883 741B                    		jz	short checkret	; done if zero
 14476                                  
 14477                                  ; check for past rom indications. if no rom change indicated, then return ok.
 14478                                  
 14479 00001885 E8FA00                  		call	checkromchange
 14480 00001888 7416                    		jz	short checkret
 14481                                  
 14482                                  ; we now see that a change line has been seen in the past. let's do the
 14483                                  ; expensive verification.
 14484                                  
 14485 0000188A E809EE                  		call	GetBp		; build	bpb in current bds
 14486 0000188D 720F                    		jb	short ret_no_error_map ; getbp has already called maperror
 14487 0000188F E81600                  		call	check_vid
 14488 00001892 7207                    		jb	short checklatchret ; disk error trying	to read	in.
 14489 00001894 09F6                    		or	si, si		; is changed for sure?
 14490 00001896 7908                    		jns	short checkret
 14491 00001898 E87B00                  		call	returnvid
 14492                                  checklatchret:				
 14493 0000189B E8CDF3                  		call	maperror	; fix up al for	return to dos
 14494                                  ret_no_error_map:			
 14495 0000189E F9                      		stc
 14496 0000189F 5E                      		pop	si		; pop off return address
 14497                                  checkret:				
 14498 000018A0 C3                      		retn
 14499                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14500                                  
 14501                                  ; check the fat and the vid. return in di -1 or 0. return with carry set
 14502                                  ; only if there was a disk error. return that error code in ax.
 14503                                  ;
 14504                                  ;	called with es:di -> bds, ds -> Bios_Data
 14505                                  
 14506                                  checkfatvid:				
 14507 000018A1 E8BD01                  		call	fat_check	; check	the fat	and the	vid
 14508 000018A4 09F6                    		or	si, si
 14509 000018A6 7827                    		js	short changed_drv ;
 14510                                  
 14511                                  ; the fat was the same. fall into check_vid and check volume id.
 14512                                  
 14513                                  		; fall into check_vid
 14514                                  
 14515                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 14516                                  
 14517                                  ; now with the extended boot record, the logic should be enhanced.
 14518                                  ;
 14519                                  ; if it is the extended boot record, then we check the volume serial
 14520                                  ; number instead of volume id. if it is different, then set si to -1.
 14521                                  ;
 14522                                  ; if it is same, then si= 1 (no change).
 14523                                  ;
 14524                                  ; if it is not the extended boot record, then just follows the old
 14525                                  ; logic. dos 4.00 will check if the # of fat in the boot record bpb
 14526                                  ; is not 0.  if it is 0 then it must be non_fat based system and
 14527                                  ; should have already covered by extended boot structure checking.
 14528                                  ; so, we will return "i don't know" by setting si to 0.
 14529                                  ;
 14530                                  ; this routine assume the newest valid boot record is in cs:[disksector].
 14531                                  ; (this will be gauranteed by a successful getbp call right before this
 14532                                  ; routine.)
 14533                                  ;
 14534                                  ;	called with es:di -> bds, ds -> bds
 14535                                  
 14536                                  		; 19/10/2022
 14537                                  check_vid:
 14538                                  
 14539                                  ; check the disksector.EXT_BOOT_SIG variable for the extended
 14540                                  ; boot signature. if it is set then go to do the extended
 14541                                  ; id check otherwise continue with code below
 14542                                  
 14543 000018A8 803E[7401]29            		cmp	byte [disksector+26h], 29h
 14544                                  					; [disksector+EXT_BOOT.SIG],
 14545                                  					; EXT_BOOT_SIGNATURE
 14546 000018AD 7427                    		jz	short do_ext_check_id
 14547 000018AF E8DC00                  		call	haschange
 14548 000018B2 74EC                    		jz	short checkret
 14549 000018B4 31F6                    		xor	si, si
 14550 000018B6 803E[5E01]00            		cmp	byte [disksector+10h], 0 
 14551                                  					; [disksector+EXT_BOOT.BPB+EBPB.NUMBEROFFATS]
 14552 000018BB 7411                    		jz	short checkfatret ; don't read vol id
 14553                                  					; if not fat system
 14554 000018BD E8EE00                  		call	read_volume_id
 14555 000018C0 720C                    		jb	short checkfatret
 14556 000018C2 E89201                  		call	check_volume_id
 14557 000018C5 BEFFFF                  		mov	si, 0FFFFh	; -1
 14558                                  					; definitely changed
 14559 000018C8 7505                    		jnz	short changed_drv
 14560                                  
 14561 000018CA 46                      		inc	si		; not changed
 14562                                  vid_no_changed:				
 14563 000018CB E8BA00                  		call	resetchanged
 14564                                  		; 12/12/2022
 14565                                  		; cf=0 ('and' instruction in 'resetchanged' clears cf) 
 14566                                  		;clc
 14567                                  checkfatret:				
 14568 000018CE C3                      		retn
 14569                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14570                                  
 14571                                  		; 12/12/2022
 14572                                  changed_drv:
 14573 000018CF F8                      		clc			; cas -- return	no error
 14574 000018D0 C606[1E01]FF            		mov	byte  [tim_drv], 0FFh 
 14575                                  					; ensure that we ask rom for media
 14576 000018D5 C3                      		retn			; check	next time round
 14577                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14578                                  
 14579                                  ; extended id check
 14580                                  
 14581                                  ; 16/10/2022
 14582                                  
 14583                                  ; the code to check extended id is basically a check to see if the
 14584                                  ; volume serial number is still the same. the volume serial number
 14585                                  ; previously read is in cs:disksector.EXT_BOOT_SERIAL
 14586                                  ; ds:di points to the bds of the drive under consideration.
 14587                                  ; the bds has fields containing the high and low words 
 14588                                  ; of the volume serial number of the media in the drive.
 14589                                  ; compare these fields to the fields mentioned above. if these fields
 14590                                  ; do not match the media has changed and so we should jump to the code
 14591                                  ; starting at ext_changed else return "i don't know" status
 14592                                  ; in the register used for the changeline status and continue executing
 14593                                  ; the code given below. for temporary storage use the register which
 14594                                  ; has been saved and restored around this block.
 14595                                  ;
 14596                                  ; bds fields in inc\msbds.inc
 14597                                  
 14598                                  		; 19/10/2022
 14599                                  do_ext_check_id:
 14600 000018D6 50                      		push	ax
 14601                                  		;mov	ax, word ptr ds:disksector+27h
 14602                                  					; [DiskSector+EXT_BOOT.SERIAL]
 14603 000018D7 A1[7501]                		mov	ax, [disksector+27h]
 14604                                  		; 02/09/2023
 14605 000018DA 31F6                    		xor	si, si ; 0
 14606 000018DC 263B4557                		cmp	ax, [es:di+57h]	; [di+BDS.vol_serial]
 14607 000018E0 750C                    		jnz	short ext_changed
 14608 000018E2 A1[7701]                		mov	ax, [disksector+29h] ; [DiskSector+EXT_BOOT.SERIAL+2]
 14609 000018E5 263B4559                		cmp	ax, [es:di+59h]	; [di+BDS.vol_serial+2]
 14610 000018E9 7503                    		jnz	short ext_changed
 14611                                  		;xor	si, si		; 0
 14612                                  					; don't know
 14613 000018EB 58                      		pop	ax
 14614 000018EC EBDD                    		jmp	short vid_no_changed
 14615                                  					; reset the flag
 14616                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14617                                  
 14618                                  ext_changed:
 14619 000018EE 58                      		pop	ax
 14620                                  		; 02/09/2023
 14621 000018EF 4E                      		dec	si ; mov si, 0FFFFh ; -1
 14622                                  		;mov	si, 0FFFFh	; -1
 14623                                  					; disk changed!
 14624                                  		; 12/12/2022
 14625                                  		; ('changed_drv' clears cf)
 14626                                  		;clc
 14627 000018F0 EBDD                    		jmp	short changed_drv
 14628                                  
 14629                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14630                                  
 14631                                  ; at i/o time, we detected the error. now we need to determine whether the
 14632                                  ; media was truly changed or not. we return normally if media change unknown.
 14633                                  ; and we pop off the call and jmp to harderr if we see an error.
 14634                                  ;
 14635                                  ; es:di -> bds
 14636                                  
 14637                                  checkio:				
 14638 000018F2 80FC06                  		cmp	ah, 6
 14639 000018F5 75D7                    		jnz	short checkfatret
 14640 000018F7 E839FF                  		call	chkopcnt
 14641 000018FA 74D2                    		jz	short checkfatret
 14642 000018FC E897ED                  		call	GetBp
 14643 000018FF 7212                    		jb	short no_error_map
 14644 00001901 E89DFF                  		call	checkfatvid
 14645 00001904 7209                    		jb	short checkioret ; disk	error trying to	read in.
 14646 00001906 09F6                    		or	si, si		; is changed for sure?
 14647 00001908 7802                    		js	short checkioerr ; yes changed
 14648 0000190A 45                      		inc	bp		; allow	a retry
 14649 0000190B C3                      		retn
 14650                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14651                                  
 14652                                  checkioerr:				
 14653 0000190C E80700                  		call	returnvid
 14654                                  
 14655                                  checkioret:				
 14656 0000190F F9                      		stc			; make sure carry gets passed through
 14657 00001910 E908F3                  		jmp	harderr
 14658                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14659                                  
 14660                                  no_error_map:				
 14661 00001913 E908F3                  		jmp	harderr2
 14662                                  
 14663                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 14664                                  
 14665                                  ; return vid sets up the vid for a return to dos.
 14666                                  ;  es:di -> bds, returns pointer in packet to bds_volid
 14667                                  ;  **** trashes si! ****
 14668                                  
 14669                                  returnvid:		
 14670 00001916 BE1600                  		mov	si, 22		; extra
 14671                                  					; offset into pointer to return	value
 14672 00001919 E80700                  		call	vid_into_packet
 14673 0000191C B406                    		mov	ah, 6
 14674 0000191E F9                      		stc
 14675 0000191F C3                      		retn
 14676                                  
 14677                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14678                                  
 14679                                  ; moves the pointer to the volid for the drive into the original request packet
 14680                                  ; no attempt is made to preserve registers.
 14681                                  ;
 14682                                  ; assumes es:di -> bds
 14683                                  ; **trashes si**
 14684                                  
 14685                                  media_set_vid:

 14687                                  					; return the value here	in packet
 14688                                  
 14689                                  		; fall into vid_into_packet
 14690                                  
 14691                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 14692                                  
 14693                                  ; return pointer to vid in bds at es:di in packet[si]
 14694                                  
 14695                                  		; 19/10/2022
 14696                                  vid_into_packet:
 14697 00001923 1E                      		push	ds		; return pointer to vid	in bds at es:di	in packet[si]
 14698 00001924 C51E[1200]              		lds	bx, [ptrsav]
 14699 00001928 83C74B                  		add	di, 75		; BDS.volid
 14700 0000192B 8938                    		mov	[bx+si], di
 14701 0000192D 83EF4B                  		sub	di, 75		; BDS.volid
 14702 00001930 8C4002                  		mov	[bx+si+2], es
 14703 00001933 1F                      		pop	ds
 14704                                  dofloppy:	; 18/12/2022
 14705 00001934 C3                      		retn

 14707                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14708                                  
 14709                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14710                                  ;   hidensity - examine a drive/media descriptor to set the media type. if
 14711                                  ;   the media descriptor is not f9 (not 96tpi or 3 1/2), we return and let the
 14712                                  ;   caller do the rest. otherwise, we pop off the return and jump to the tail
 14713                                  ;   of getbp. for 3.5" media, we just return.
 14714                                  ;
 14715                                  ;   inputs:	es:di point to correct bds for this drive
 14716                                  ;		ah has media byte
 14717                                  ;
 14718                                  ;   outputs:	carry clear
 14719                                  ;		    no registers modified
 14720                                  ;		carry set
 14721                                  ;		    al = sectors/fat
 14722                                  ;		    bh = number of root directory entries
 14723                                  ;		    bl = sectors per track
 14724                                  ;		    cx = number of sectors
 14725                                  ;		    dh = sectors per allocation unit
 14726                                  ;		    dl = number of heads
 14727                                  ;
 14728                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14729                                  
 14730                                  hidensity:
 14731                                  
 14732                                  ; check for correct drive
 14733                                  		
 14734                                  		; 12/12/2022
 14735 00001935 26F6452302              		test	byte [es:di+23h], 2		
 14736                                  		;test	word [es:di+23h], 2 ; is it special?	
 14737                                  					; [es:di+BDS.flags], fchangeline
 14738 0000193A 74F8                    		jz	short dofloppy	; no, do normal floppy test
 14739                                  
 14740                                  ; we have a media byte that is pretty complex. examine drive information
 14741                                  ; table to see what kind it is.
 14742                                  
 14743 0000193C 26807D2202              		cmp	byte [es:di+22h], 2 ; is it single-media?
 14744 00001941 74F1                    		jz	short dofloppy	; [es:di+BDS.formfactor], ffSmall
 14745                                  					; yes, use fatid...
 14746                                  ; 96 tpi drive?
 14747 00001943 80FCF9                  		cmp	ah, 0F9h
 14748 00001946 75EC                    		jnz	short dofloppy
 14749                                  
 14750                                  ;------ If formfactor of drive = ffother or ff288 it has to be
 14751                                  ;------ a 720K diskette
 14752                                  
 14753                                  		; 02/09/2023 (PCDOS 7.1)
 14754 00001948 268A4522                		mov	al, [es:di+22h]	; [es:di+BDS.formfactor]
 14755 0000194C 3C07                    		cmp	al, 7
 14756                                  		;cmp	byte [es:di+22h], 7 ; [es:di+BDS.formfactor]
 14757                                  					; ffOther
 14758 0000194E 7413                    		jz	short Is720K
 14759 00001950 3C09                    		cmp	al, 9
 14760                                  		;cmp	byte [es:di+22h], 9 ; [es:di+BDS.formfactor]
 14761                                  					; ff288
 14762 00001952 740F                    		jz	short Is720K
 14763 00001954 B007                    		mov	al, 7		; seven	sectors	/ fat
 14764 00001956 BB0FE0                  		mov	bx, 57359	; 224*256+0Fh
 14765                                  					; 224 root dir entries
 14766                                  					; & 0Fh sector max
 14767 00001959 B96009                  		mov	cx, 2400	; 80*15*2
 14768                                  					; 80 tracks, 15 sectors/track,
 14769                                  					; 2 sides
 14770                                  		; 02/09/2023
 14771 0000195C 5A                      		pop	dx		; pop off return address
 14772 0000195D BA0201                  		mov	dx, 258		; 1*256+2
 14773                                  					; sectors/allocation unit
 14774                                  					; & head max
 14775                                  		;add	sp, 2		; pop off return address
 14776 00001960 E9A5ED                  		jmp	Has1		; return to tail of getbp
 14777                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14778                                  
 14779                                  Is720K:
 14780                                  		; 02/09/2023
 14781 00001963 5B                      		pop	bx		; pop off return address	
 14782                                  		;add	sp, 2		; pop off return address
 14783 00001964 E968ED                  		jmp	Has720K		; return to 720K code
 14784                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14785                                  
 14786                                  		; 18/12/2022
 14787                                  ;dofloppy:
 14788                                  		;retn

 14790                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 14791                                  
 14792                                  ; 16/10/2022
 14793                                  
 14794                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14795                                  ; set_changed_dl - sets flag bits according to bits set in bx.
 14796                                  ;		   essentially used to indicate changeline, or format.
 14797                                  ;
 14798                                  ;   inputs:	dl contains physical drive number
 14799                                  ;		bx contains bits to set in the flag field in the bdss
 14800                                  ;   outputs:	none
 14801                                  ;   registers modified: flags
 14802                                  ;
 14803                                  ;	called from int13 hooker.  Must preserve ALL registers!!!
 14804                                  ;
 14805                                  ; in the virtual drive system we *must* flag the other drives as being changed
 14806                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14807                                  
 14808                                  set_changed_dl:	
 14809 00001967 06                      		push	es
 14810 00001968 57                      		push	di
 14811                                  		;les	di, ds:start_bds
 14812                                  		; 19/10/2022
 14813 00001969 C43E[1901]              		les	di, [start_bds]
 14814                                  
 14815                                  ; note: we assume that the list is non-empty
 14816                                  
 14817                                  scan_bds:				
 14818 0000196D 26385504                		cmp	[es:di+4], dl	; [es:di+BDS.drivenum]
 14819 00001971 7504                    		jnz	short get_next_bds
 14820                                  
 14821                                  ; someone may complain, but this *always* must be done when a disk change is
 14822                                  ; noted. there are *no* other compromising circumstances.
 14823                                  
 14824 00001973 26095D23                		or	[es:di+23h], bx	; [es:di+BDS.flags]
 14825                                  					; signal change	on other drive
 14826                                  get_next_bds:				
 14827 00001977 26C43D                  		les	di, [es:di]	; [es:di+BDS.link]
 14828                                  					; go to	next bds
 14829 0000197A 83FFFF                  		cmp	di, 0FFFFh
 14830 0000197D 75EE                    		jnz	short scan_bds	; loop unless we hit end of chain
 14831 0000197F 5F                      		pop	di
 14832 00001980 07                      		pop	es
 14833 00001981 C3                      		retn

 14837                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14838                                  ; checkromchange - see if external program has diddled rom change line.
