 14891                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14892                                  
 14893                                  ; 16/10/2022
 14894                                  
 14895                                  ;-------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14896                                  ; set_volume_id      -	main routine, calls other routines.
 14897                                  ; read_volume_id     -	read the volume id and tells if it has been changed.
 14898                                  ; transfer_volume_id -	copy the volume id from tmp to special drive.
 14899                                  ; check_volume_id    -	compare volume id in tmp area with one expected for drive.
 14900                                  ; fat_check          -	see of the fatid has changed in the specified drive.
 14901                                  ;-------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14902                                  
 14903                                  ; set_volume_id
 14904                                  ;   if drive has changeline support, read in and set the volume_id
 14905                                  ; and the last fat_id byte. if no change line support then do nothing.
 14906                                  ;
 14907                                  ;   on entry:
 14908                                  ;	es:di points to the bds for this disk.
 14909                                  ;	ah contains media byte
 14910                                  ;
 14911                                  ;   on exit:
 14912                                  ;	carry clear:
 14913                                  ;	   successful call
 14914                                  ;	carry set
 14915                                  ;	   error and ax has error code
 14916                                  
 14917                                  set_volume_id:				
 14918 00001994 52                      		push	dx		; save registers
 14919 00001995 50                      		push	ax
 14920 00001996 E8F5FF                  		call	haschange	; does drive have changeline support?
 14921 00001999 740B                    		jz	short setvret	; no, get out
 14922 0000199B E81000                  		call	read_volume_id
 14923 0000199E 7209                    		jb	short seterr
 14924 000019A0 E8A800                  		call	transfer_volume_id ; copy the volume id	to special drive
 14925 000019A3 E8E2FF                  		call	resetchanged	; restore value	of change line
 14926                                  setvret:				
 14927                                  		; 10/12/2022
 14928                                  		; cf = 0
 14929                                  		;clc			; no error, clear carry flag
 14930 000019A6 58                      		pop	ax		; restore registers
 14931 000019A7 5A                      		pop	dx
 14932 000019A8 C3                      		retn
 14933                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14934                                  
 14935                                  seterr:					
 14936 000019A9 5A                      		pop	dx		; pop stack but don't overwrite ax
 14937 000019AA 5A                      		pop	dx		; restore dx
 14938 000019AB C3                      		retn
 14939                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14940 000019AC 0000                    root_sec:	dw 0			; root sector #
 14941                                  
 14942                                  ; 16/10/2022
 14943                                  ;ROOTSEC equ root_sec - DOSBIOSEG_2C7h		
 14944                                  ; 09/12/2022
 14945                                  ROOTSEC equ root_sec
 14946                                  
 14947                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 14948                                  
 14949                                  ; 16/10/2022
 14950                                  
 14951                                  ; read_volume_id read the volume id and tells if it has been changed.
 14952                                  ;
 14953                                  ;   on entry:
 14954                                  ;	es:di points to current bds for drive.
 14955                                  ;
 14956                                  ;   on exit:
 14957                                  ;	carry clear
 14958                                  ;	    si = 1  no change
 14959                                  ;	    si = 0  ?
 14960                                  ;	    si = -1 change
 14961                                  ;
 14962                                  ;	carry set:
 14963                                  ;	    error and ax has error code.
 14964                                  
 14965                                  read_volume_id:
 14966 000019AE 52                      		push	dx		; preserve registers
 14967 000019AF 51                      		push	cx
 14968 000019B0 53                      		push	bx
 14969 000019B1 50                      		push	ax
 14970 000019B2 06                      		push	es		; stack the bds last
 14971 000019B3 57                      		push	di
 14972 000019B4 1E                      		push	ds		; point es to Bios_Data
 14973 000019B5 07                      		pop	es
 14974 000019B6 BF[AB08]                		mov	di, tmp_vid	; "NO NAME	 "
 14975 000019B9 BE[9F08]                		mov	si, nul_vid	; "NO NAME	 "
 14976                                  		;mov	cx, 11		; PCDOS 7.1 - 02/09/2023
 14977 000019BC B90C00                  		mov	cx, 12		; initialize tmp_vid to	null vi_id
 14978 000019BF F3A4                    		rep movsb
 14979 000019C1 5F                      		pop	di
 14980 000019C2 07                      		pop	es
 14981 000019C3 268A450B                		mov	al, [es:di+11]	; [es:di+BDS.fats]
 14982                                  					; # of fats
 14983 000019C7 268B4D11                		mov	cx, [es:di+17]	; [es:di+BDS.fatsecs]
 14984                                  					; sectors / fat
 14985 000019CB F6E1                    		mul	cl		; size taken by	fats
 14986 000019CD 26034509                		add	ax, [es:di+9]	; [es:di+BDS.resectors]
 14987                                  					; add on reserved sectors
 14988                                  					;
 14989                                  					; ax is	now sector # (0	based)
 14990                                  		; 17/10/2022
 14991 000019D1 2EA3[AC19]              		mov	[cs:ROOTSEC], ax
 14992                                  		;mov	word ptr cs:198Fh, ax ; [cs:root_sec]
 14993                                  					; 0070h:3EFFh =	2C7h:198Fh
 14994 000019D5 268B450C                		mov	ax, [es:di+12]	; [es:di+BDS.direntries]
 14995                                  					; # root dir entries
 14996 000019D9 B104                    		mov	cl, 4		; 16 entries/sector
 14997 000019DB D3E8                    		shr	ax, cl		; divide by 16
 14998                                  		;mov	cx, ax		; cx is	# of sectors to	scan
 14999                                  		; 02/09/2023 (PCDOS 7.1, one byte opcode)
 15000 000019DD 91                      		xchg	ax, cx		; cx is	# of sectors to	scan
 15001                                  next_sec:
 15002 000019DE 51                      		push	cx		; save outer loop counter
 15003 000019DF 2EA1[AC19]              		mov	ax, [cs:ROOTSEC]
 15004                                  		;mov	ax, word ptr cs:198Fh ; [cs:root_sec]
 15005                                  					; get sector #
 15006 000019E3 268B4D13                		mov	cx, [es:di+19]	; [es:di+BDS.secpertrack]
 15007                                  					; sectors / track
 15008 000019E7 31D2                    		xor	dx, dx
 15009 000019E9 F7F1                    		div	cx
 15010                                  
 15011                                  ; set up registers for call to read_sector
 15012                                  
 15013 000019EB 42                      		inc	dx		; dx= sectors into track
 15014                                  					; ax= track count from 0
 15015 000019EC 88D1                    		mov	cl, dl		; sector to read
 15016 000019EE 31D2                    		xor	dx, dx
 15017 000019F0 26F77515                		div	word [es:di+21] ; [es:di+BDS.heads]
 15018                                  					; # heads on this disc
 15019 000019F4 88D6                    		mov	dh, dl		; head number
 15020 000019F6 88C5                    		mov	ch, al		; track	#
 15021 000019F8 E81BEE                  		call	read_sector	; get first sector of the root directory,
 15022                                  					; ds:bx	-> directory sector
 15023 000019FB 723F                    		jb	short readviderr
 15024 000019FD B91000                  		mov	cx, 16		; # of dir entries in a	block of root
 15025 00001A00 B008                    		mov	al, 8		; volume label bit
 15026                                  fvid_loop:
 15027                                  		; 02/09/2023 (PCDOS 7.1)
 15028 00001A02 382F                    		cmp	[bx], ch ; 0				
 15029                                  		;cmp	byte [bx], 0 ; end of dir?
 15030 00001A04 7433                    		jz	short no_vid	; yes, no vol id
 15031 00001A06 803FE5                  		cmp	byte [bx], 0E5h ; empty entry?
 15032 00001A09 7405                    		jz	short ent_loop	; yes, skip
 15033 00001A0B 84470B                  		test	[bx+11], al	; is volume label bit set in fcb?
 15034 00001A0E 750F                    		jnz	short found_vid	; jmp yes
 15035                                  ent_loop:
 15036 00001A10 83C320                  		add	bx, 32		; add length of	directory entry
 15037 00001A13 E2ED                    		loop	fvid_loop
 15038 00001A15 59                      		pop	cx		; outer loop
 15039 00001A16 2EFF06[AC19]            		inc	word [cs:ROOTSEC]
 15040                                  		;inc	word ptr cs:198Fh ; inc word [root_sec]
 15041                                  					; next sector
 15042 00001A1B E2C1                    		loop	next_sec	; continue
 15043                                  notfound:
 15044                                  		; 02/09/2023
 15045                                  		;xor	si, si
 15046 00001A1D EB13                    		jmp	short fvid_ret
 15047                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15048                                  
 15049                                  found_vid:
 15050                                  		; 02/09/2023
 15051                                  		; cf = 0  ('test' instruction clears cf)  			
 15052 00001A1F 59                      		pop	cx		; clean stack of outer loop counter
 15053 00001A20 89DE                    		mov	si, bx		; point	to volume_id
 15054 00001A22 06                      		push	es		; preserve current bds
 15055 00001A23 57                      		push	di
 15056 00001A24 1E                      		push	ds
 15057 00001A25 07                      		pop	es		; point es to Bios_Data
 15058 00001A26 BF[AB08]                		mov	di, tmp_vid	; "NO NAME	 "
 15059 00001A29 B90B00                  		mov	cx, 11		; VOLID_SIZ-1
 15060                                  					; length of string minus nul
 15061 00001A2C F3A4                    		rep movsb		; mov volume label to tmp_vid
 15062                                  		;xor	al, al
 15063                                  		; 02/09/2023
 15064 00001A2E 91                      		xchg	ax, cx		; ax = 0
 15065 00001A2F AA                      		stosb			; null terminate
 15066                                  		;;xor	si, si
 15067                                  		; 02/09/2023
 15068                                  		;xchg	ax, si		; si = 0
 15069 00001A30 5F                      		pop	di		; restore current bds
 15070 00001A31 07                      		pop	es
 15071                                  fvid_ret:
 15072                                  		; 02/09/2023
 15073 00001A32 31F6                    		xor	si, si ; 0
 15074                                  				
 15075 00001A34 58                      		pop	ax
 15076                                  		; 10/12/2022
 15077                                  		; cf = 0
 15078                                  		;clc
 15079                                  rvidret:
 15080 00001A35 5B                      		pop	bx		; restore registers
 15081 00001A36 59                      		pop	cx
 15082 00001A37 5A                      		pop	dx
 15083 00001A38 C3                      		retn
 15084                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15085                                  
 15086                                  no_vid:
 15087 00001A39 59                      		pop	cx		; clean stack of outer loop counter
 15088                                  		;jmp	short notfound	; not found
 15089                                  		; 02/09/2023
 15090 00001A3A EBF6                    		jmp	short fvid_ret
 15091                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15092                                  
 15093                                  readviderr:
 15094 00001A3C 5E                      		pop	si		; trash the outer loop counter
 15095 00001A3D 5E                      		pop	si		; caller's ax, return error code instead 
 15096 00001A3E EBF5                    		jmp	short rvidret
 15097                                  
 15098                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15099                                  		; 02/09/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 (IO.SYS optimization)
 15100                                  		; PCDOS 7.1 - IBMBIO.COM - BIOSCODE:1DCFh 
 15101                                  preset_volid_addr:
 15102 00001A40 BE[AB08]                		mov	si, tmp_vid	; "NO NAME    "
 15103                                  		;
 15104                                  		; PCDOS 7.1
 15105                                  		;add	di, 125		; BDS.volid
 15106                                  		;mov	cx, 11		; VOLID_SIZ (12 for MSDOS 5.0-6.22 versions)
 15107                                  		; MSDOS 6.21 (MSDOS 5.0 & 6.?)
 15108 00001A43 83C74B                  		add	di, 75		; BDS.volid
 15109 00001A46 B90C00                  		mov	cx, 12		; VOLID_SIZ
 15110                                  		;
 15111 00001A49 FC                      		cld
 15112 00001A4A C3                      		retn
 15113                                  
 15114                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 15115                                  
 15116                                  ; transfer_volume_id - copy the volume id from tmp to special drive
 15117                                  ;
 15118                                  ; inputs:	es:di has current bds
 15119                                  ; outputs:	bds for drive has volume id from tmp
 15120                                  
 15121                                  transfer_volume_id:
 15122 00001A4B 57                      		push	di		; copy the volume id from tmp to special drive
 15123 00001A4C 56                      		push	si
 15124 00001A4D 51                      		push	cx
 15125                                  		
 15126                                  		;mov	si, tmp_vid	; "NO NAME	 "
 15127                                  		;;add	di, BDS.volid
 15128                                  		;add	di, 75		; BDS.volid
 15129                                  		;;mov	cx, VOLID_SIZ
 15130                                  		;mov	cx, 12		; VOLID_SIZ
 15131                                  		;cld
 15132                                  		; 02/09/2023 (PCDOS 7.1)
 15133 00001A4E E8EFFF                  		call	preset_volid_addr
 15134                                  
 15135 00001A51 F3A4                    		rep movsb
 15136 00001A53 59                      		pop	cx
 15137 00001A54 5E                      		pop	si
 15138 00001A55 5F                      		pop	di
 15139 00001A56 C3                      		retn
 15140                                  
 15141                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 15142                                  
 15143                                  ;  check_volume_id - compare volume id in tmp area with
 15144                                  ;		     one expected for drive
 15145                                  ;
 15146                                  ;   inputs:	es:di has current bds for drive
 15147                                  ;   outputs:	zero true means it matched
 15148                                  
 15149                                  check_volume_id:
 15150 00001A57 57                      		push	di
 15151 00001A58 51                      		push	cx
 15152                                  		
 15153                                  		;mov	si, tmp_vid	; "NO NAME	 "
 15154                                  		;;add	di, BDS.volid
 15155                                  		;add	di, 75		; BDS.volid
 15156                                  		;;mov	cx, VOLID_SIZ
 15157                                  		;mov	cx, 12		; VOLID_SIZ
 15158                                  		;cld
 15159                                  		; 02/09/2023 (PCDOS 7.1)
 15160 00001A59 E8E4FF                  		call	preset_volid_addr
 15161                                  
 15162 00001A5C F3A6                    		repe cmpsb		; are the 2 volume_ids the same?
 15163 00001A5E 59                      		pop	cx
 15164 00001A5F 5F                      		pop	di
 15165 00001A60 C3                      		retn
 15166                                  
 15167                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 15168                                  
 15169                                  ;   fat_check - see of the fatid has changed in the specified drive.
 15170                                  ;	      - uses the fat id obtained from the boot sector.
 15171                                  ;
 15172                                  ;   inputs:	medbyt is expected fat id
 15173                                  ;		es:di points to current bds
 15174                                  ;
 15175                                  ;   output:	si = -1 if fat id different,
 15176                                  ;		si = 0 otherwise
 15177                                  ;
 15178                                  ;   no other registers changed.
 15179                                  
 15180                                  fat_check:		
 15181 00001A61 50                      		push	ax
 15182 00001A62 31F6                    		xor	si, si		; say fat id's are same.
 15183 00001A64 A0[1F01]                		mov	al, [medbyt]	; 19/10/2022
 15184 00001A67 263A4510                		cmp	al, [es:di+10h]	; [es:di+BDS.media]
 15185                                  					; compare it with the bds medbyte
 15186 00001A6B 7401                    		jz	short okret1	; carry	clear
 15187 00001A6D 4E                      		dec	si
 15188                                  okret1:					
 15189 00001A6E 58                      		pop	ax
 15190 00001A6F C3                      		retn
 15191                                  
 15192                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15193                                  
 15194                                  ; BIOSCODE:1A69h (MSDOS 6.21, IO.SYS)
 15195                                  		;times 7 db 0
 15196                                  
 15197                                  ; BIOSCODE:180Bh (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)	
 15198                                  
 15199                                  		; 09/12/2022
 15200                                  		;times 4 db 0	; 17/10/2022
 15201                                  		;db 4 dup(0)	; times 4 db 0
 15202                                  
 15203                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15204                                  
 15205                                  		; 09/12/2022
 15206                                  		;db 0
 15207                                  
 15208                                  number2div	equ ($-BCode_start)
 15209                                  number2mod	equ (number2div % 16)
 15210                                  
 15211                                  %if number2mod>0 & number2mod<16
 15212 00001A70 00<rep 10h>             		times (16-number2mod) db 0
 15213                                  %endif
 15214                                  
 15215                                  ;align 16
 15216                                  
 15217                                  ; 09/12/2022
 15218                                  BCODE_END	equ $ - BCode_start
 15219                                  ;SYSINITSEG	equ IOSYSCODESEG+(BCODE_END>>4)
 15220                                  ; 13/12/2022
 15221                                  SYSINITOFFSET	equ BCODE_END
 15222                                  SYSINITSEG	equ IOSYSCODESEG+(SYSINITOFFSET>>4)
 15223                                  
 15224                                  ;--- End of DOSBIOS code segment ---------------------------------------------

 15243                                  ; ****************************************************************************
 15244                                  ; SYSINIT.BIN (MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS) - RETRO DOS v4.0 by ERDOGAN TAN - 21/10/2022
 15245                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15246                                  ; Last Update: 04/01/2023 (Modified IO.SYS)  ((Previous: 30/12/2022))
 15247                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15248                                  ; Beginning: 03/06/2018 (Retro DOS 3.0), 21/03/2019 (Retro DOS 4.0)
 15249                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15250                                  ; Assembler: NASM version 2.15
 15251                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15252                                  ;	   ((nasm sysinit6.s -l sysinit6.lst -o SYSINIT6.BIN -Z error.txt)) 	
 15253                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15254                                  ; Modified from 'sysinit2.s' (SYSINIT2.BIN) file of Retro DOS v3.0 (6/7/2018)
 15255                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15256                                  ; Derived from 'SYSINIT1.ASM' and 'SYSINIT2.ASM' files of MSDOS 6.0
 15257                                  ; source code by Microsoft, 1991 
 15258                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15259                                  ; Derived from 'SYSINIT.ASM' file of MSDOS 2.0 (IBM PCDOS v2.0) source code
 15260                                  ; by Microsoft, 12/10/1983
 15261                                  ; ****************************************************************************
 15262                                  ; main file: 'retrodos4.s'
 15263                                  ; incbin 'SYSINIT3.BIN' ; (SYINITSEG)
 15264                                  
 15265                                  ; 30/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.2 
 15266                                  ; Retro DOS v4.0 - 2019
 15267                                  ; SYSINIT (MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS) draft: 'sysinit3.s' (01/07/2019)
 15268                                   
 15269                                  ; 21/10/2022
 15270                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15271                                  ; This source code (version) is based on SYSINIT source code of disassembled
 15272                                  ; MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS file (SYSINIT.BIN) 
 15273                                  ; Dissassembler: Hex-Rays Interactive Disassembler (IDA)
 15274                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15275                                  ; Binary file splitter & joiner: FFSJ v3.3
 15276                                  
 15277                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------
 15278                                  ; SYSINIT.TXT (27/01/1983)
 15279                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------
 15280                                  ;    SYSINIT is  a module linked behind the OEM bios.  It takes
 15281                                  ;over  the  system  initialization  after  the  OEM  bios   has
 15282                                  ;performed any  initialization  it  needs  to  do.   Control is
 15283                                  ;transfered with a long jump to the external  variable  SYSINIT
 15284                                  ;
 15285                                  ;
 15286                                  ;   The OEM  has  the  following  variables declared external:
 15287                                  ;
 15288                                  ;   CURRENT_DOS_LOCATION    WORD
 15289                                  ;
 15290                                  ;This word  contains  the  segment  number of the DOS before it
 15291                                  ;is relocated.  The OEM bios must set this value.
 15292                                  ;
 15293                                  ;   FINAL_DOS_LOCATION      WORD
 15294                                  ;
 15295                                  ;This word contains the segment number of the DOS after SYSINIT
 15296                                  ;moves it.  The OEM bios must set this value.
 15297                                  ;
 15298                                  ;   DEVICE_LIST             DWORD
 15299                                  ;
 15300                                  ;This  double  word  pointer  points  to  the  linked  list  of
 15301                                  ;character and block device drivers.  The  OEM  must  set  this
 15302                                  ;value.
 15303                                  ;
 15304                                  ;   MEMORY_SIZE             WORD
 15305                                  ;
 15306                                  ;This word  contains  the  number  of  RAM  paragraphs.  If the
 15307                                  ;bios doesn't set  this  variable  SYSINIT  will  automatically
 15308                                  ;calculate it.   NOTE:  systems with PARITY checked memory must
 15309                                  ;size memory in the BIOS.  SYSINITs method is to  write  memory
 15310                                  ;and read it back until it gets a mismatch.
 15311                                  ;
 15312                                  ;   DEFAULT_DRIVE           BYTE
 15313                                  ;
 15314                                  ;This is  the initial default drive when the system first comes
 15315                                  ;up.  drive a=0, drive b=1,  etc.   If  the  bios  doesn't  set
 15316                                  ;it then drive a is assumed.
 15317                                  ;
 15318                                  ;   BUFFERS                 BYTE
 15319                                  ;
 15320                                  ;This is  the  default  number of buffers for the system.  This
 15321                                  ;value may be overridden by the user in  the  CONFIG.SYS  file.
 15322                                  ;It is DBed to 2 in SYSINIT it should be greater than 1.
 15323                                  ;
 15324                                  ;   FILES                   BYTE
 15325                                  ;
 15326                                  ;This is  the  default  number  of  files for the system.  This
 15327                                  ;value may be overridden by the user in  the  CONFIG.SYS  file.
 15328                                  ;It is  DBed  to  8 in SYSINIT, values less than 5 are ignored.
 15329                                  ;
 15330                                  ;   SYSINIT                 FAR
 15331                                  ;
 15332                                  ;The entry  point  of  the  SYSINIT  module.  OEM BIOS jumps to
 15333                                  ;this label at the end of its INIT code.
 15334                                  ;
 15335                                  ;   The OEM  has  the  following  variables declared public:
 15336                                  ;
 15337                                  ;   RE_INIT                 FAR
 15338                                  ;
 15339                                  ;This is an entry point which allows the BIOS to do some INIT
 15340                                  ;work  after  the  DOS is initialized.  ALL REGISTERS MUST BE
 15341                                  ;PRESERVED.  On entry DS points to the first available memory
 15342                                  ;(after  the DOS).  DS:0 points to a 100H byte program header
 15343                                  ;prefix which represents  the  "program"  currently  running.
 15344                                  ;This  program  should  be  thought  of  as  the OEM BIOS and
 15345                                  ;SYSINIT taken together.  This is not  a  normal  program  in
 15346                                  ;that  no  memory  is  allocated to it, it is running in free
 15347                                  ;memory.
 15348                                  ;NOTES:
 15349                                  ;     At the time this routine is called SYSINIT occupies the
 15350                                  ;highest 10K of memory ("highest" is determined by the  value
 15351                                  ;of the MEMORY_SIZE variable), DO NOT DO WRITES THERE.
 15352                                  ;     Since this is called AFTER DOS is initialized, you can
 15353                                  ;make system calls.  This also implies that the code for this
 15354                                  ;routine    CANNOT   be   thrown   away   by   use   of   the
 15355                                  ;FINAL_DOS_LOCATION since the DOS has already been moved.
 15356                                  ;     If you don't want  anything done just set this to point
 15357                                  ;at a FAR RET instruction.
 15358                                  
 15359                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 15360                                  ; TITLE   BIOS SYSTEM INITIALIZATION
 15361                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 15362                                  
 15363                                  ;include version.inc
 15364                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 15365                                  
 15366                                  ;FALSE   EQU     0
 15367                                  ;TRUE    EQU     0FFFFh
 15368                                  
 15369                                  ;IBMVER	    EQU     TRUE
 15370                                  ;IBMCOPYRIGHT EQU   FALSE
 15371                                  ;STACKSW    EQU	    TRUE		;Include Switchable Hardware Stacks
 15372                                  ;IBMJAPVER  EQU     FALSE		; If TRUE set KANJI true also
 15373                                  ;MSVER      EQU     FALSE
 15374                                  ;ALTVECT    EQU     FALSE		; Switch to build ALTVECT version
 15375                                  ;KANJI      EQU     FALSE
 15376                                  
 15377                                  ;(MSDOS 6.0, versiona.inc, 1991)
 15378                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 15379                                  ;MAJOR_VERSION  EQU	6
 15380                                  ;;MINOR_VERSION	EQU	0	;6.00
 15381                                  ;MINOR_VERSION  EQU	21	;6.21  ; 21/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 15382                                  
 15383                                  ; 22/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0)
 15384                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 15385                                  ;MAJOR_VERSION   EQU	5
 15386                                  ;MINOR_VERSION   EQU	0
 15387                                  
 15388                                  ; 01/01/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21)
 15389                                  MAJOR_VERSION   EQU	6
 15390                                  MINOR_VERSION   EQU	22
 15391                                  
 15392                                  expected_version equ	(MINOR_VERSION<<8)+MAJOR_VERSION
 15393                                  
 15394                                  ;DOSREVNM equ	00000000b       ; m037 - bits 0-2 = revision number of DOS
 15395                                  				; currently 0.
 15396                                  DOSREVNM equ	00000111b	; [[[ 7 for Retro DOS v4.0 ]]] (21/03/2019)	
 15397                                  DOSINROM equ	00001000B       ; bit 3 of ver flags returned in BH
 15398                                  DOSINHMA equ	00010000B       ; bit 4 of ver flags 
 15399                                  
 15400                                  ;      if1
 15401                                  ;      %OUT  ... for DOS Version 5.00 ...
 15402                                  ;      endif
 15403                                  
 15404                                         ;******************************
 15405                                         ;Each assembler program should:
 15406                                         ;  mov ah,030h                   ;DOS Get Version function
 15407                                         ;  int 021h                      ;Version ret. in AX,minor version first
 15408                                         ;  cmp ax,expected_version       ;ALL utilities should check for an
 15409                                         ;  jne error_handler             ; EXACT version match.
 15410                                         ;******************************
 15411                                  
 15412                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 15413                                  ; device definitions
 15414                                  
 15415                                  ;Attribute bit masks
 15416                                  DEVTYP  EQU     8000h           ;Bit 15 - 1  if Char, 0 if block
 15417                                  DEVIOCTL EQU    4000h           ;Bit 14 - CONTROL mode bit
 15418                                  ISFATBYDEV EQU  2000h           ;Bit 13 - Device uses FAT ID bytes, comp media.
 15419                                  ISCIN   EQU     0001h           ;Bit 0 - This device is the console input.
 15420                                  ISCOUT  EQU     0002h           ;Bit 1 - This device is the console output.
 15421                                  ISNULL  EQU     0004h           ;Bit 2 - This device is the null device.
 15422                                  ISCLOCK EQU     0008h           ;Bit 3 - This device is the clock device.
 15423                                  ISIBM   EQU     0010h           ;Bit 4 - This device is special
 15424                                  
 15425                                  ; The device table list has the form:
 15426                                  struc	SYSDEV
 15427 00000000 ????????                .NEXT:		resd 1		;Pointer to next device header
 15428 00000004 ????                    .ATT:		resw 1		;Attributes of the device
 15429 00000006 ????                    .STRAT:		resw 1		;Strategy entry point
 15430 00000008 ????                    .INT:		resw 1		;Interrupt entry point
 15431 0000000A ????????????????        .NAME:		resb 8		;Name of device (only first byte used for block)
 15432                                  .size:
 15433                                  endstruc
 15434                                  
 15435                                  ;Static Reguest Header
 15436                                  struc	SRHEAD
 15437 00000000 ??                      .REQLEN:	resb 1		;Length in bytes of request block
 15438 00000001 ??                      .REQUNIT:	resb 1		;Device unit number
 15439 00000002 ??                      .REQFUNC:	resb 1		;Type of request
 15440 00000003 ????                    .REQSTAT:	resw 1		;Status Word
 15441 00000005 ????????????????                	resb 8		;Reserved for queue links
 15442                                  .size:
 15443                                  endstruc
 15444                                  
 15445                                  ;Status word masks
 15446                                  STERR   EQU     8000H           ;Bit 15 - Error
 15447                                  STBUI   EQU     0200H           ;Bit 9 - Buisy
 15448                                  STDON   EQU     0100H           ;Bit 8 - Done
 15449                                  STECODE EQU     00FFH           ;Error code
 15450                                  WRECODE EQU     0
 15451                                  
 15452                                  ;Function codes
 15453                                  DEVINIT EQU     0               ;Initialization
 15454                                  DINITHL EQU     26              ;Size of init header
 15455                                  DEVMDCH EQU     1               ;Media check
 15456                                  DMEDHL  EQU     15              ;Size of media check header
 15457                                  DEVBPB  EQU     2               ;Get BPB
 15458                                  DEVRDIOCTL EQU  3               ;IOCTL read
 15459                                  DBPBHL  EQU     22              ;Size of Get BPB header
 15460                                  DEVRD   EQU     4               ;Read
 15461                                  DRDWRHL EQU     22              ;Size of RD/WR header
 15462                                  DEVRDND EQU     5               ;Non destructive read no wait (character devs)
 15463                                  DRDNDHL EQU     14              ;Size of non destructive read header
 15464                                  DEVIST  EQU     6               ;Input status
 15465                                  DSTATHL EQU     13              ;Size of status header
 15466                                  DEVIFL  EQU     7               ;Input flush
 15467                                  DFLSHL  EQU     15              ;Size of flush header
 15468                                  DEVWRT  EQU     8               ;Write
 15469                                  DEVWRTV EQU     9               ;Write with verify
 15470                                  DEVOST  EQU     10              ;Output status
 15471                                  DEVOFL  EQU     11              ;Output flush
 15472                                  DEVWRIOCTL EQU  12              ;IOCTL write
 15473                                  
 15474                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 15475                                  struc	SYS_FCB
 15476 00000000 ??                      .fcb_drive:	resb 1
 15477 00000001 ????????????????        .fcb_name:	resb 8
 15478 00000009 ??????                  .fcb_ext:	resb 3
 15479 0000000C ????                    .fcb_EXTENT:	resw 1
 15480 0000000E ????                    .fcb_RECSIZ:	resw 1	; Size of record (user settable)
 15481 00000010 ????                    .fcb_FILSIZ:	resw 1	; Size of file in bytes; used with the following
 15482                                                          ; word
 15483 00000012 ????                    .fcb_DRVBP:	resw 1	; BP for SEARCH FIRST and SEARCH NEXT
 15484 00000014 ????                    .fcb_FDATE:	resw 1	; Date of last writing
 15485 00000016 ????                    .fcb_FTIME:	resw 1	; Time of last writing
 15486 00000018 ??                      .fcb_DEVID:	resb 1	; Device ID number, bits 0-5 if file.
 15487                                                          ; bit 7=0 for file, bit 7=1 for I/O device
 15488                                                          ; If file, bit 6=0 if dirty
 15489                                                          ; If I/O device, bit 6=0 if EOF (input)
 15490                                                          ;               Bit 5=1 if Raw mode
 15491                                                          ;               Bit 0=1 if console input device
 15492                                                          ;               Bit 1=1 if console output device
 15493                                                          ;               Bit 2=1 if null device
 15494                                                          ;               Bit 3=1 if clock device
 15495 00000019 ????                    .fcb_FIRCLUS:	resw 1	; First cluster of file
 15496 0000001B ????                    .fcb_CLUSPOS:	resw 1	; Position of last cluster accessed
 15497 0000001D ????                    .fcb_LSTCLUS:	resw 1	; Last cluster accessed and directory
 15498 0000001F ??                                   	resb 1	; pack 2 12 bit numbers into 24 bits...
 15499 00000020 ??                      .fcb_NR:	resb 1	; Next record
 15500 00000021 ????????                .fcb_RR:	resb 4	; Random record
 15501                                  .size:
 15502                                  endstruc
 15503                                  
 15504                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 15505                                  ; Field definition for I/O buffer information
 15506                                  
 15507                                  ; 22/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0 (MSDOS 6.0, BUFFER.INC, 1991)
 15508                                  
 15509                                  struc buffinfo
 15510 00000000 ????                    .buf_next:	resw 1	; Pointer to next buffer in list
 15511 00000002 ????                    .buf_prev:	resw 1	; Pointer to previous buffer in list
 15512 00000004 ??                      .buf_ID:	resb 1	; Drive of buffer (bit 7 = 0)
 15513                                  			; SFT table index (bit 7 = 1)
 15514                                  			; = FFh if buffer free
 15515 00000005 ??                      .buf_flags:	resb 1	; Bit 7 = 1 if Remote file buffer
 15516                                  			;	= 0 if Local device buffer
 15517                                  			; Bit 6 = 1 if buffer dirty
 15518                                  			; Bit 5 = Reserved
 15519                                  			; Bit 4 = Search bit (bit 7 = 1)
 15520                                  			; Bit 3 = 1 if buffer is DATA
 15521                                  			; Bit 2 = 1 if buffer is DIR
 15522                                  			; Bit 1 = 1 if buffer is FAT
 15523                                  			; Bit 0 = Reserved
 15524 00000006 ????????                .buf_sector:	resd 1	; Sector number of buffer (bit 7 = 0)
 15525                                  ; The next two items are often refed as a word (bit 7 = 0)
 15526 0000000A ??                      .buf_wrtcnt:	resb 1	; For FAT sectors, # times sector written out
 15527 0000000B ????                    .buf_wrtcntinc:	resw 1	; "   "     "   , # sectors between each write
 15528 0000000D ????????                .buf_DPB :	resd 1	; Pointer to drive parameters
 15529 00000011 ????                    .buf_fill:	resw 1	; How full buffer is (bit 7 = 1)
 15530 00000013 ??                      .buf_reserved:	resb 1	; make DWORD boundary for 386
 15531                                  .size:
 15532                                  endstruc
 15533                                  
 15534                                  %define buf_offset	dword [buf_sector]
 15535                                  			;For bit 7 = 1, this is the byte
 15536                                  			;offset of the start of the buffer in
 15537                                  			;the file pointed to by buf_ID.  Thus
 15538                                  			;the buffer starts at location
 15539                                  			;buf_offset in the file and contains
 15540                                  			;buf_fill bytes.
 15541                                  
 15542                                  bufinsiz	equ	buffinfo.size ; ; Size of structure in bytes
 15543                                  
 15544                                  
 15545                                  buf_Free	equ	0FFh		; buf_id of free buffer
 15546                                  
 15547                                  ;Flag byte masks
 15548                                  buf_isnet	EQU	10000000B
 15549                                  buf_dirty	EQU	01000000B
 15550                                  ;***
 15551                                  buf_visit	EQU	00100000B
 15552                                  ;***
 15553                                  buf_snbuf	EQU	00010000B
 15554                                  
 15555                                  buf_isDATA	EQU	00001000B
 15556                                  buf_isDIR	EQU	00000100B
 15557                                  buf_isFAT	EQU	00000010B
 15558                                  buf_type_0	EQU	11110001B	; AND sets type to "none"
 15559                                  
 15560                                  buf_NetID	EQU	bufinsiz
 15561                                  
 15562                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 15563                                  
 15564                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 15565                                  ;**	DPB - Drive Parameter Block
 15566                                  
 15567                                  ; 25/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0 (MSDOS 6.0, DPB.INC, 1991)
 15568                                  
 15569                                  ;	BUGBUG - this isn't authorative - it's my probably incomplete and
 15570                                  ;	possibly inaccurate deductions from code study... - jgl
 15571                                  ;
 15572                                  ;	The DPB is DOS's main structure for describing block devices.
 15573                                  ;	It contains info about the "Drive" intermingled with info about
 15574                                  ;	the FAT file system which is presumably on the drive.  I don't know
 15575                                  ;	how those fields are used if it's not the FAT file system - BUGBUG
 15576                                  ;
 15577                                  ;	The DPBs are statically allocated and chained off of DPBHead.
 15578                                  ;	Users scan this chain looking for a match on DPB_DRIVE.
 15579                                  ;	The DPBs are built at init time from info in the SYSDEV structure.
 15580                                  
 15581                                  ; 08/06/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0 (MSDOS 3.3, DPB.INC, 24/07/1987)
 15582                                  
 15583                                  ; 12/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 15584                                  
 15585                                  struc	DPB
 15586 00000000 ??                      .DRIVE:		resb 1		; Logical drive # assoc with DPB (A=0,B=1,...)
 15587 00000001 ??                      .UNIT:		resb 1		; Driver unit number of DPB
 15588 00000002 ????                    .SECTOR_SIZE:	resw 1		; Size of physical sector in bytes
 15589 00000004 ??                      .CLUSTER_MASK:	resb 1		; Sectors/cluster - 1
 15590 00000005 ??                      .CLUSTER_SHIFT:	resb 1		; Log2 of sectors/cluster
 15591 00000006 ????                    .FIRST_FAT:	resw 1		; Starting record of FATs
 15592 00000008 ??                      .FAT_COUNT:	resb 1		; Number of FATs for this drive
 15593 00000009 ????                    .ROOT_ENTRIES:	resw 1		; Number of directory entries
 15594 0000000B ????                    .FIRST_SECTOR:	resw 1		; First sector of first cluster
 15595 0000000D ????                    .MAX_CLUSTER:	resw 1		; Number of clusters on drive + 1
 15596                                  ;.FAT_SIZE:	resb 1  ; MSDOS 3.3
 15597 0000000F ????                    .FAT_SIZE:	resw 1		; Number of records occupied by FAT
 15598 00000011 ????                    .DIR_SECTOR:	resw 1		; Starting record of directory
 15599 00000013 ????????                .DRIVER_ADDR:	resd 1		; Pointer to driver
 15600 00000017 ??                      .MEDIA:		resb 1		; Media byte
 15601 00000018 ??                      .FIRST_ACCESS:	resb 1		; This is initialized to -1 to force a media
 15602                                  				; check the first time this DPB is used
 15603 00000019 ????????                .NEXT_DPB:	resd 1		; Pointer to next Drive parameter block
 15604 0000001D ????                    .NEXT_FREE:	resw 1		; Cluster # of last allocated cluster
 15605 0000001F ????                    .FREE_CNT:	resw 1		; Count of free clusters, -1 if unknown
 15606                                  .size:
 15607                                  endstruc
 15608                                  
 15609                                  DPBSIZ  EQU     DPB.size	; Size of the structure in bytes
 15610                                  
 15611                                  DSKSIZ  EQU	DPB.MAX_CLUSTER	; Size of disk (temp used during init only)

 15668                                  ; 25/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0  (MSDOS 6.0, BPB.INC, IOCTL.INC)
 15669                                  
 15670                                  ;**	BIOS PARAMETER BLOCK DEFINITION
 15671                                  ;
 15672                                  ;	The BPB contains information about the disk structure.  It dates
 15673                                  ;	back to the earliest FAT systems and so FAT information is
 15674                                  ;	intermingled with physical driver information.
 15675                                  ;
 15676                                  ;	A boot sector contains a BPB for its device; for other disks
 15677                                  ;	the driver creates a BPB.  DOS keeps copies of some of this
 15678                                  ;	information in the DPB.
 15679                                  ;
 15680                                  ;	The BDS structure contains a BPB within it.
 15681                                  
 15682                                  struc A_BPB
 15683 00000000 ????                    .BPB_BYTESPERSECTOR:	resw	1
 15684 00000002 ??                      .BPB_SECTORSPERCLUSTER:	resb	1
 15685 00000003 ????                    .BPB_RESERVEDSECTORS:	resw	1
 15686 00000005 ??                      .BPB_NUMBEROFFATS:	resb	1
 15687 00000006 ????                    .BPB_ROOTENTRIES: 	resw	1
 15688 00000008 ????                    .BPB_TOTALSECTORS:	resw	1
 15689 0000000A ??                      .BPB_MEDIADESCRIPTOR:	resb	1
 15690 0000000B ????                    .BPB_SECTORSPERFAT:	resw	1
 15691 0000000D ????                    .BPB_SECTORSPERTRACK:	resw	1
 15692 0000000F ????                    .BPB_HEADS:		resw	1
 15693 00000011 ????                    .BPB_HIDDENSECTORS:	resw	1
 15694 00000013 ????                    			resw	1
 15695 00000015 ????                    .BPB_BIGTOTALSECTORS:	resw	1
 15696 00000017 ????                    			resw	1
 15697 00000019 ????????????            			resb	6	; NOTE:  many times these
 15698                                  ;					; 	 6 bytes are omitted
 15699                                  ;					;	 when BPB manipulations
 15700                                  ;					;	 are performed!
 15701                                  .size:
 15702                                  endstruc
 15703

 15709 00000006 ??                      .DP_MEDIATYPE:		resb	1
 15710 00000007 <res 1Fh>               .DP_BPB:		resb	A_BPB.size

 15712 00000028 <res FCh>               .DP_SECTORTABLE:	resb	MAX_SECTORS_IN_TRACK * A_SECTORTABLE.size

 15961                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 15962                                  ; BIOSTRUC.INC (MSDOS 3.3 - 24/07/1987) 	
 15963                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 15964                                  					  ;;Rev 3.30 Modification
 15965                                  ; ROM BIOS CALL PACKET STRUCTURES					  
 15966                                  									  
 15967                                  ;*******************************					  
 15968                                  ;System Service call ( Int 15h )					  
 15969                                  ;*******************************					  
 15970                                  ;Function AH = 0C0h, Return system configuration			  
 15971                                  ;For PC and PCJR on return:						  
 15972                                  ;	(AH)	= 80h							  
 15973                                  ;	(CY)	= 1							  
 15974                                  ;For PCXT, PC PORTABLE and PCAT on return:				  
 15975                                  ;	(AH)	= 86h							  
 15976                                  ;	(CY)	= 1							  
 15977                                  ;For all others:							  
 15978                                  ;	(AH)	= 0							  
 15979                                  ;	(CY)	= 0							  
 15980                                  ;	(ES:BX) = pointer to system descriptor vector in ROS		  
 15981                                  ; System descriptor :							  
 15982                                  ;	DW	xxxx		length of descriptor in bytes,		  
 15983                                  ;				minimum length = 8			  
 15984                                  ;	DB	xx		model byte				  
 15985                                  ;				0FFh	= PC				  
 15986                                  ;				0FEh	= PC/XT, Portable		  
 15987                                  ;				0FDh	= PC/JR 			  
 15988                                  ;				0FCh	= PC/AT				  
 15989                                  ;				0F9h	= Convertable			  
 15990                                  ;				0F8h	= Model 80			  
 15991                                  ;				0E0 thru 0EFh = reserved		  
 15992                                  ;									  
 15993                                  ;	DB	xx		secondary model byte			  
 15994                                  ;				000h	= PC1				  
 15995                                  ;				000h	= PC/XT, Portable		  
 15996                                  ;				000h	= PC/JR 			  
 15997                                  ;				000h	= PC/AT 			  
 15998                                  ;				001h	= PC/AT Model 339		  
 15999                                  ;				003h	= PC/RT				  
 16000                                  ;				000h	= Convertable			  
 16001                                  ;									  
 16002                                  ;	DB	xx		bios revision level			  
 16003                                  ;				00 for first release, subsequent release  
 16004                                  ;				of code with same model byte and	  
 16005                                  ;				secondary model byte require revison level
 16006                                  ;				to increase by one.			  
 16007                                  ;									  
 16008                                  ;	DB	xx		feature information byte 1		  
 16009                                  ;				X0000000 = 1, bios use DMA channel 3	  
 16010                                  ;					 = 0, DMA channel 3 not used	  
 16011                                  ;									  
 16012                                  ;				0X000000 = 1, 2nd Interrupt chip present  
 16013                                  ;					 = 0, 2nd Interrupt chip not present
 16014                                  ;									  
 16015                                  ;				00X00000 = 1, Real Time Clock present	  
 16016                                  ;					 = 0, Real Time Clock not present 
 16017                                  ;									  
 16018                                  ;				000X0000 = 1, Keyboard escape sequence(INT 15h)
 16019                                  ;						called in keyboard interrupt
 16020                                  ;						(Int 09h).		  
 16021                                  ;					 = 0, Keyboard escape sequence not
 16022                                  ;						called.

 16152                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 16153                                  ; CURDIR.INC (MSDOS 6.0 - 1991) 	
 16154                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 16155                                  ; 22/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 16156                                  
 16157                                  ;**	CDS - Current Directory Structure
 16158                                  ;
 16159                                  ; CDS items are used bu the internal routines to store cluster numbers and
 16160                                  ; network identifiers for each logical name.  The ID field is used dually,
 16161                                  ; both as net ID and for a cluster number for local devices. In the case
 16162                                  ; of local devices, the cluster number will be -1 if there is a potential
 16163                                  ; of the disk being changed or if the path must be recracked.
 16164                                  ;
 16165                                  ;	Some pathnames have special preambles, such as
 16166                                  ;
 16167                                  ;		\\machine\sharename\...
 16168                                  ;	For these pathnames we can't allow ".." processing to back us
 16169                                  ;	up into the special front part of the name.  The CURDIR_END field
 16170                                  ;	holds the address of the seperator character which marks
 16171                                  ;	the split between the special preamble and the regular
 16172                                  ;	path list; ".." processing isn't allowed to back us up past
 16173                                  ;	(i.e., before) CURDIR_END
 16174                                  ;	For the root, it points at the leading /. For net
 16175                                  ;	assignments it points at the end (nul) of the initial assignment:
 16176                                  ;	A:/	\\foo\bar	    \\foo\bar\blech\bozo
 16177                                  ;	  ^		 ^		     ^
 16178                                  
 16179                                  DIRSTRLEN	EQU	64+3		; Max length in bytes of directory strings
 16180                                  TEMPLEN 	EQU	DIRSTRLEN*2
 16181                                  
 16182                                  struc 		curdir_list
 16183                                  ; MSDOS 3.3
 16184 00000000 <res 43h>               .cdir_text	resb	DIRSTRLEN	; text of assignment and curdir
 16185 00000043 ????                    .cdir_flags	resw	1		; various flags
 16186 00000045 ????????                .cdir_devptr	resd	1		; local pointer to DPB or net device
 16187 00000049 ????????                .cdir_ID	resw	2		; cluster of current dir (net ID)
 16188 0000004D ????                    .cdir_usr_word	resw	1
 16189 0000004F ????                    .cdir_end	resw	1		; end of assignment
 16190                                  ; MSDOS 6.0
 16191 00000051 ??                      .cdir_type:	resb	1		; IFS drive (2=ifs, 4=netuse)
 16192 00000052 ????????                .cdir_ifd_hdr:	resd	1		; Ptr to File System Header
 16193 00000056 ????                    .cdir_fsda:	resb	2		; File System Dependent Data Area
 16194                                  .size:
 16195                                  endstruc
 16196                                  
 16197                                  curdirlen	EQU	curdir_list.size	; Needed for screwed up
 16198                                  						; ASM87 which doesn't allow
 16199                                  						; Size directive as a macro
 16200                                  						; argument
 16201                                  %define curdir_netID	dword [curdir_list.cdir_ID]
 16202                                  
 16203                                  ;**	Flag values for CURDIR_FLAGS
 16204                                  
 16205                                  ;Flag word masks
 16206                                  curdir_isnet	EQU	1000000000000000B
 16207                                  curdir_isifs	EQU	1000000000000000B
 16208                                  curdir_inuse	EQU	0100000000000000B
 16209                                  curdir_splice	EQU	0010000000000000B
 16210                                  curdir_local	EQU	0001000000000000B

 16212                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 16213                                  ; SF.INC (MSDOS 6.0 - 1991) 	
 16214                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 16215                                  ; 25/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 16216                                  
 16217                                  ; system file table
 16218                                  
 16219                                  ;**	System File Table SuperStructure
 16220                                  ;
 16221                                  ;	The system file table entries are allocated in contiguous groups.
 16222                                  ;	There may be more than one such groups; the SF "superstructure"
 16223                                  ;	tracks the groups.
 16224                                  
 16225                                  struc	SF
 16226 00000000 ????????                .SFLink:	resd	1
 16227 00000004 ????                    .SFCount:	resw	1		; number of entries
 16228 00000006 ????                    .SFTable:	resw	1		; beginning of array of the following
 16229                                  .size:
 16230                                  endstruc
 16231                                  
 16232                                  ;**	System file table entry
 16233                                  ;
 16234                                  ;	These are the structures which are at SFTABLE in the SF structure.
 16235                                  
 16236                                  struc	SF_ENTRY
 16237 00000000 ????                    .sf_ref_count:	resw	1		; number of processes sharing entry
 16238                                  					;   if FCB then ref count
 16239 00000002 ????                    .sf_mode: 	resw	1		; mode of access or high bit on if FCB
 16240 00000004 ??                      .sf_attr: 	resb	1		; attribute of file
 16241 00000005 ????                    .sf_flags:	resw	1		;Bits 8-15
 16242                                  					; Bit 15 = 1 if remote file
 16243                                  					;	 = 0 if local file or device
 16244                                  					; Bit 14 = 1 if date/time is not to be
 16245                                  					;   set from clock at CLOSE.  Set by
 16246                                  					;   FILETIMES and FCB_CLOSE.  Reset by
 16247                                  					;   other reseters of the dirty bit
 16248                                  					;   (WRITE)
 16249                                  					; Bit 13 = Pipe bit (reserved)
 16250                                  					;
 16251                                  					; Bits 0-7 (old FCB_devid bits)
 16252                                  					; If remote file or local file, bit
 16253                                  					; 6=0 if dirty Device ID number, bits
 16254                                  					; 0-5 if local file.
 16255                                  					; bit 7=0 for local file, bit 7
 16256                                  					;      =1 for local I/O device
 16257                                  					; If local I/O device, bit 6=0 if EOF (input)
 16258                                  					;		Bit 5=1 if Raw mode
 16259                                  					;		Bit 0=1 if console input device
 16260                                  					;		Bit 1=1 if console output device
 16261                                  					;		Bit 2=1 if null device
 16262                                  					;		Bit 3=1 if clock device
 16263 00000007 ????????                .sf_devptr:	resd	1		; Points to DPB if local file, points
 16264                                  					; to device header if local device,
 16265                                  					; points to net device header if
 16266                                  					; remote
 16267 0000000B ????                    .sf_firclus:	resw	1		; First cluster of file (bit 15 = 0)
 16268                                  ;.sf_lstclus:	resw	1 ; *	
 16269 0000000D ????                    .sf_time: 	resw	1		; Time associated with file
 16270 0000000F ????                    .sf_date: 	resw	1		; Date associated with file
 16271 00000011 ????????                .sf_size: 	resd	1		; Size associated with file
 16272 00000015 ????????                .sf_position:	resd	1		; Read/Write pointer or LRU count for FCBs
 16273                                  ;
 16274                                  ; Starting here, the next 7 bytes may be used by the file system to store an
 16275                                  ; ID
 16276                                  ;
 16277 00000019 ????                    .sf_cluspos:	resw	1		; Position of last cluster accessed
 16278 0000001B ????                    .sf_dirsec:	resw	1		; Sector number of directory sector for this file
 16279 0000001D ??                      .sf_dirpos:	resb	1		; Offset of this entry in the above
 16280                                  ;
 16281                                  ; End of 7 bytes of file-system specific info.
 16282                                  ;
 16283 0000001E <res Bh>                .sf_name:	resb	11		; 11 character name that is in the
 16284                                  					; directory entry.  This is used by
 16285                                  					; close to detect file deleted and
 16286                                  					; disk changed errors.
 16287                                  ; SHARING INFO
 16288 00000029 ????????                .sf_chain:	resd	1		; link to next SF
 16289 0000002D ????                    .sf_UID:	resw	1
 16290 0000002F ????                    .sf_PID:	resw	1
 16291 00000031 ????                    .sf_MFT:	resw	1
 16292 00000033 ????                    .sf_lstclus:	resw	1 ; *		; Last cluster accessed
 16293 00000035 ????????                .sf_IFS_HDR:	resd 	1 ; **
 16294                                  .size:
 16295                                  endstruc
 16296

 16566                                  SYSINIT$:
 16567                                  	;IF	STACKSW 
 16568                                  	; include MSSTACK.INC	;Main stack program and data definitions
 16569                                  	; include STKMES.INC	;Fatal stack error message

 16573                                  
 16574                                  ; 05/07/2018
 16575                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 16576                                  ; 04/06/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 16577                                  
 16578                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 16579                                  ; 21/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS - SYSINIT)
 16580                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 16581                                  
 16582                                  ;	MSStack.inc
 16583                                  ;
 16584                                  ;	Interrupt level 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 7,(10, 11, 12, 14, 15 - AT level)
 16585                                  ;	should follow the standard Interrupt Sharing Scheme which has
 16586                                  ;	a standard header structure.
 16587                                  ;	Fyi, the following shows the relations between
 16588                                  ;	the interrupt vector and interrupt level.
 16589                                  ; VEC(Hex)    2  8  9  A  B  C	D  E  70  72  73  74  76  77
 16590                                  ; LVL(Deci)   9  0  1  2  3  4	5  6   8  10  11  12  14  15
 16591                                  ;	MSSTACK module modifies the following interrupt vectors
 16592                                  ;	to meet the standard Interrupt Sharing standard;
 16593                                  ;	  A, B, C, D, E, 72, 73, 74, 76, 77.
 16594                                  ;	Also, for interrupt level 7 and 15, the FirstFlag in a standard header
 16595                                  ;	should be initialized to indicat whether this interrupt handler is
 16596                                  ;	the first (= 80h) or not.  The FirstFlag entry of INT77h's
 16597                                  ;	program header is initialized in STKINIT.INC module.
 16598                                  ;	FirstFlag is only meaningful for interrupt level 7 and 15.
 16599                                  ;
 16600                                  
 16601                                  ;  User specifies the number of stack elements - default = 9
 16602                                  ;						 minimum = 8
 16603                                  ;						 maximum = 64
 16604                                  ;
 16605                                  ;  Intercepts Asynchronous Hardware Interrupts only
 16606                                  ;
 16607                                  ;  Picks a stack from pool of stacks and switches to it
 16608                                  ;
 16609                                  ;  Calls the previously saved interrupt vector after pushing flags
 16610                                  ;
 16611                                  ;  On return, returns the stack to the stack pool
 16612                                  ;
 16613                                  
 16614                                  ; This is a modification of STACKS:
 16615                                  ; 1. To fix a bug which was causing the program to take up too much space.
 16616                                  ; 2. To dispense stack space from hi-mem first rather than low-mem first.
 16617                                  ;    . Clobbers the stack that got too big instead of innocent stack
 16618                                  ;    . Allows system to work if the only stack that got too big was the most
 16619                                  ;      deeply nested one
 16620                                  ; 3. Disables NMI interrupts while setting the NMI vector.
 16621                                  ; 4. Does not intercept any interupts on a PCjr.
 16622                                  ; 5. Double checks that a nested interrupt didn't get the same stack.
 16623                                  ; 6. Intercepts Ints 70, 72-77 for PC-ATs and other future products
 16624                                  
 16625                                  		;EVEN
 16626                                  ;align 2
 16627                                  		; 21/10/2022
 16628                                  
 16629 00000000 0000                    		dw	0	; spare field but leave these in order
 16630 00000002 0000                    stackcount:	dw	0
 16631 00000004 0000                    stackat: 	dw	0
 16632 00000006 0000                    stacksize:	dw	0
 16633 00000008 0000                    stacks:		dw	0
 16634 0000000A 0000                    		dw	0
 16635                                  
 16636 0000000C [0800]                  firstentry:	dw	stacks
 16637 0000000E [4800]                  lastentry:	dw	stacks+(defaultcount*entrysize)-entrysize
 16638 00000010 [4800]                  nextentry:	dw	stacks+(defaultcount*entrysize)-entrysize
 16639                                  
 16640                                  ;***********************************************************************
 16641                                  ; THESE ARE THE INDIVIDUAL INTERRUPT HANDLERS
 16642                                  
 16643                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 16644                                  
 16645 00000012 00000000                old02:	dd	0
 16646                                  
 16647                                  int02:
 16648                                  
 16649                                  ; *********************************************************************
 16650                                  ;
 16651                                  ; this is special support for the pc convertible / nmi handler
 16652                                  ;
 16653                                  ;	on the pc convertible, there is a situation where an nmi can be 
 16654                                  ;	caused by using the "out" instructions to certain ports. when this
 16655                                  ;	occurs, the pc convertible hardware *guarantees* that **nothing** 
 16656                                  ;	can stop the nmi or interfere with getting to the nmi handler. this
 16657                                  ;	includes other type of interrupts (hardware and software), and
 16658                                  ;	also includes other type of nmi's. when any nmi has occured,
 16659                                  ;	no other interrtupt (hardware, software or nmi) can occur until
 16660                                  ;	the software takes specific steps to allow further interrupting.
 16661                                  ;
 16662                                  ;	for pc convertible, the situation where the nmi is generated by the
 16663                                  ;	"out" to a control port requires "fixing-up" and re-attempting. in
 16664                                  ;	otherwords, it is actually a "restartable exception". in this
 16665                                  ;	case, the software handler must be able to get to the stack in
 16666                                  ;	order to figure out what instruction caused the problem, where
 16667                                  ;	it was "out"ing to and what value it was "out"ing.  therefore,
 16668                                  ;	we will not switch stacks in this situation. this situation is
 16669                                  ;	detected by interrogating port 62h, and checking for a bit value
 16670                                  ;	of 80h. if set, *****do not switch stacks*****.
 16671                                  ;
 16672                                  ; *********************************************************************
 16673                                  
 16674 00000016 50                      	push	ax
 16675 00000017 06                      	push	es
 16676 00000018 B800F0                  	mov	ax,0F000h
 16677 0000001B 8EC0                    	mov	es,ax
 16678                                  	; 02/11/2022
 16679 0000001D 26803EFEFFF9            	cmp	byte [es:0FFFEh],0F9h ; mdl_convert ; check if convertible
 16680 00000023 07                      	pop	es
 16681 00000024 750C                    	jne	short normal02
 16682                                  
 16683 00000026 E462                    	in	al,62h		; PC/XT PPI port C. Bits:
 16684                                  				; 0-3: values of DIP switches
 16685                                  				; 5: 1=Timer 2 channel out
 16686                                  				; 6: 1=I/O channel check
 16687                                  				; 7: 1=RAM parity check error occurred.
 16688 00000028 A880                    	test	al,80h
 16689 0000002A 7406                    	jz	short normal02
 16690                                  special02:
