 16924                                  ;********************************************************************
 16925                                  ;common routines
 16926                                  ;********************************************************************
 16927                                  
 16928                                  ; do interrupt stack switching. the fake return address holds
 16929                                  ; a pointer to the far-pointer of the actual interrupt
 16930                                  ; service routine
 16931                                  
 16932                                  ; 21/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 SYSINIT)
 16933                                  ; 21/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 16934                                  
 16935                                  ;allocbyte   equ 0
 16936                                  ;intlevel    equ 1
 16937                                  ;savedsp     equ 2
 16938                                  ;savedss     equ 4
 16939                                  ;newsp       equ 6
 16940                                  
 16941                                  ; 30/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 SYSINIT)
 16942                                  ; (MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS, SYSINIT:0147h)
 16943                                  
 16944                                  do_int_stacks:
 16945 00000147 50                      	push	ax
 16946 00000148 55                      	push	bp
 16947 00000149 06                      	push	es
 16948 0000014A 2E8E06[0A00]            	mov	es,[cs:stacks+2]	; Get segment of stacks
 16949 0000014F 2E8B2E[1000]            	mov	bp,[cs:nextentry]	; get most likely candidate
 16950 00000154 B001                    	mov	al,allocated ; 1
 16951                                  	; 21/10/2022
 16952                                  	;xchg	[es:bp+allocbyte],al 
 16953                                  	; 11/12/2022
 16954 00000156 26864600                	xchg	[es:bp],al		; grab the entry
 16955 0000015A 3C00                    	cmp	al,free ; 0		; still avail?
 16956 0000015C 7551                    	jne	short notfree02
 16957                                  
 16958 0000015E 2E832E[1000]08          	sub	word [cs:nextentry],entrysize ; set for next interrupt
 16959                                  found02:
 16960 00000164 26896602                	mov	[es:bp+savedsp],sp	; save sp value
 16961 00000168 268C5604                	mov	[es:bp+savedss],ss	; save ss also
 16962                                  
 16963 0000016C 89E8                    	mov	ax,bp			; temp save of table offset
 16964                                  
 16965 0000016E 268B6E06                	mov	bp,[es:bp+newsp]	; get new SP value
 16966                                  	; 21/10/2022
 16967                                  	;mov	bp,[es:bp+6]
 16968                                  	; 11/12/2022
 16969                                  	;cmp	[es:bp+0],ax	
 16970 00000172 26394600                	cmp	[es:bp],ax		; check for offset into table
 16971 00000176 7544                    	jne	short foundbad02
 16972                                  
 16973                                  	; 02/07/2023 (MSDOS 6.21 SYSINIT code)
 16974 00000178 8CC0                    	mov	ax,es			; point ss,sp to the new stack
 16975 0000017A 8EC5                    	mov	es,bp
 16976 0000017C 89E5                    	mov	bp,sp
 16977 0000017E 8B6E06                  	mov	bp,[bp+6]
 16978 00000181 8ED0                    	mov	ss,ax
 16979 00000183 8CC4                    	mov	sp,es
 16980 00000185 8EC0                    	mov	es,ax
 16981 00000187 2E8B6E00                	mov	bp,[cs:bp]
 16982                                  
 16983                                  	; 21/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 SYSINIT code)
 16984                                  	;push    bp
 16985                                  	;mov     bp,sp
 16986                                  	;mov     ax,[bp+8]
 16987                                  	;pop     bp
 16988                                  	;push    es
 16989                                  	;pop     ss
 16990                                  	;mov     sp,bp
 16991                                  	;mov     bp,ax
 16992                                  	; 11/12/2022
 16993                                  	;;mov	bp,[cs:bp+0]	
 16994                                  	;mov	bp,[cs:bp]	
 16995                                  
 16996 0000018B 9C                      	pushf				; go execute the real interrupt handler
 16997                                  	; 11/12/2022
 16998 0000018C 2EFF5E00                	call	far [cs:bp]		; which will iret back to here
 16999                                  	; 21/10/2022
 17000                                  	;call	far [cs:bp+0]
 17001                                  
 17002 00000190 89E5                    	mov	bp,sp			; retrieve the table offset for us
 17003                                  	; 11/12/2022
 17004 00000192 268B6E00                	mov	bp,[es:bp]		; but leave it on the stack
 17005                                  	; 21/10/2022
 17006                                  	;mov	bp,[es:bp+0]
 17007 00000196 268E5604                	mov	ss,[es:bp+savedss]	; get old stack back
 17008 0000019A 268B6602                	mov	sp,[es:bp+savedsp]
 17009                                  
 17010                                  	; 11/12/2022
 17011                                  	;mov	byte [es:bp+allocbyte],free ; free the entry

 18383                                  ; Now, if this is not romdos, we decide what to do with the DOS code.
 18384                                  ; It will either be relocated to low memory, above the DOS data structures,
 18385                                  ; or else it will be located in HiMem, in which case a stub with the DOS
 18386                                  ; code entry points will be located in low memory. Dos_segreinit is used
 18387                                  ; to tell the DOS data where the code has been placed, and to install the
 18388                                  ; low memory stub if necessary. If the DOS is going to go into HiMem, we
 18389                                  ; must first initialize it in its present location and load the installable
 18390                                  ; device drivers. Then, if a HiMem driver has been located, we can actually
 18391                                  ; relocate the DOS code into HiMem.
 18392                                  ;
 18393                                  ; For ROMDOS, if DOS=HIGH is indicated, then we need to call dos_segreinit
 18394                                  ; to install the low memory stub (this must be done before allowing any
 18395                                  ; device drivers to hook interrupt vectors). Otherwise, we don't need to 
 18396                                  ; call dos_segreinit at all, since the interrupt vector table has already 
 18397                                  ; been patched.

 18713                                  ;   Once we get to this point, the above code, which is below "retry"

 18717                                  retry:
 18718 0000077E BA[B545]                	mov	dx,commnd	; now pointing to file description
 18719                                  
 18720                                  ; we are going to open the command interpreter and size it as is done in
 18721                                  ; ldfil. the reason we must do this is that sysinit is in free memory. if
 18722                                  ; there is not enough room for the command interpreter,exec will probably
 18723                                  ; overlay our stack and code so when it returns with an error sysinit won't be
 18724                                  ; here to catch it. this code is not perfect (for instance .exe command
 18725                                  ; interpreters are possible) because it does its sizing based on the
 18726                                  ; assumption that the file being loaded is a .com file. it is close enough to
 18727                                  ; correctness to be usable.
 18728                                  
 18729                                  ; first, find out where the command interpreter is going to go.
 18730                                  
 18731 00000781 52                      	push	dx		; save pointer to name
 18732 00000782 BBFFFF                  	mov	bx,0FFFFh
 18733 00000785 B448                    	mov	ah,48h	; ALLOC
 18734 00000787 CD21                            int     21h             ; get biggest piece
 18735 00000789 B448                    	mov	ah,48h	; ALLOC
 18736 0000078B CD21                    	int	21h		; second time gets it
 18737 0000078D 726B                    	jc	short memerrjx	; oooops
 18738                                  
 18739 0000078F 8EC0                    	mov	es,ax
 18740 00000791 B449                    	mov	ah,49h	; DEALLOC
 18741 00000793 CD21                    	int	21h		; give it right back
 18742 00000795 89DD                    	mov	bp,bx
 18743                                  
 18744                                  ; es:0 points to block,and bp is the size of the block in para.
 18745                                  
 18746                                  ; we will now adjust the size in bp down by the size of sysinit.
 18747                                  ; we need to do this because exec might get upset if some of the exec
 18748                                  ; data in sysinit is overlayed during the exec.
 18749                                  
 18750                                  	; 22/10/2022
 18751                                  	; (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT:083Bh)

 18753 0000079B 8CC8                    	mov	ax,cs		 ; get location of beginning of sysinit
 18754                                  
 18755                                  ; Note that the "config_wrkseg" environment data is a segment in
 18756                                  ; unallocated memory (as of the Dealloc of [area], above). This is ideal
 18757                                  ; in one sense, because Exec is going to make a copy of it for COMMAND.COM
 18758                                  ; anyway, and no one has responsibility for freeing "config_wrkseg". But
 18759                                  ; we need to make sure that there's no way Exec will stomp on that data
 18760                                  ; before it can copy it, and one way to do that is to make the available
 18761                                  ; memory calculation even more "paranoid", by subtracting "config_wrkseg"
 18762                                  ; from the "memory_size" segment value (which is typically A000h) instead
 18763                                  ; of the current sysinit CS....
 18764                                  ;
 18765                                  ; The reason I use the term "paranoid" is because this code should have
 18766                                  ; slid the data required by Exec up to the very top of memory, because as
 18767                                  ; it stands, you have to have sizeof(COMMAND.COM) PLUS 64K to load just
 18768                                  ; COMMAND.COM (64k is about what sysinit, and all the goop above sysinit,
 18769                                  ; consumes). Now it's just a little worse (65K or more, depending on
 18770                                  ; the size of your CONFIG.SYS, since the size of the environment workspace
 18771                                  ; is determined by the size of CONFIG.SYS.... -JTP
 18772                                  
 18773                                  	; 30/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21, IO.SYS)
 18774                                  	; (SYSINIT:0858h)

 19232                                  ; procedure : MovDOSHi
 19233                                  ;
 19234                                  ;		Tries to allocate HMA and Move DOS/BIOS code into HMA
 19235                                  ;		For ROMDOS, the code is not actually moved, but the
 19236                                  ;		HMA is allocated and prepared for sub-allocation.
 19237                                  ;
 19238                                  ;		Returns : CY if it failed

 19240                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 19241

 19264                                  	; 24/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 19265                                  	;xor	di,di
 19266

 19272 00000995 E81100                  	call	MovDOS				; and move it
 19273                                  
 19274                                  	; ES:DI points to free HMA after DOS
 19275                                  ;else
 19276                                  ;	; allocate space at beginning of HMA to allow for CPMHack
 19277                                  ;

 19594 000009FE CD21                    	int	21h

 19599                                  						;  BIOS code

 19602                                  	;mov	word [es:20h+ARENA.NAME],'SC'	;  code area
 19603                                  	; 14/05/2019

 19611                                  
 19612                                  ; BUGBUG -- 5 Aug 92 -- chuckst -- Allocating space for DOS
 19613                                  ;	  using DOS itself causes an arena to be generated.
 19614                                  ;	  Unfortunately, certain programs (like PROTMAN$)
 19615                                  ;	  assume that the device drivers are loaded into
 19616                                  ;	  the first arena. For this reason, MagicDrv's
 19617                                  ;	  main device driver header arena is manually
 19618                                  ;	  truncated from the arena chain, and the space
 19619                                  ;	  for DOS is allocated using the following
 19620                                  ;	  simple code, which also assumes that the
 19621                                  ;	  first arena is the free one where DOS's low
 19622                                  ;	  stub will go.
 19623                                  ;
 19624                                  ; M012 : BEGIN
 19625                                  
 19626                                  	; 23/10/2022
 19627                                  update_arena:
 19628 00000A16 1E                      	push	ds ; ds = cs
 19629 00000A17 57                      	push	di
 19630 00000A18 51                      	push	cx
 19631 00000A19 52                      	push	dx
 19632                                  	; 23/10/2022
 19633                                  	;lds	di,[cs:DOSINFO]			; get ptr to DOS var
 19634                                  	; 11/12/2022
 19635                                  	; ds = cs 
 19636 00000A1A C53E[6B02]              	lds	di,[DOSINFO] ; 27/03/2019	
 19637 00000A1E 4F                      	dec	di
 19638 00000A1F 4F                      	dec	di				; Arena head is immediately
 19639                                  						;  before sysvar
 19640 00000A20 8E05                    	mov	es,[di]				; es = arena head
 19641                                  	;mov	cx,[es:ARENA.SIZE]		; cx = total low mem size
 19642 00000A22 268B0E0300              	mov	cx,[es:3]
 19643 00000A27 39D9                    	cmp	cx,bx				; is it sufficient ?
 19644 00000A29 7227                    	jb	short FatalErr			; no, fatal error
 19645                                  
 19646                                  	;mov	dl,[es:ARENA.SIGNATURE]
 19647 00000A2B 268A160000              	mov	dl,[es:0]
 19648 00000A30 8CC0                    	mov	ax,es
 19649 00000A32 01D8                    	add	ax,bx				; ax = new arena head
 19650 00000A34 8905                    	mov	[di],ax				; store it in DOS data area
 19651 00000A36 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax
 19652                                  	;mov	[ARENA.SIGNATURE],dl		; type of arena
 19653 00000A38 88160000                	mov	[0],dl
 19654                                  	;mov	word [ARENA.OWNER],0		; free
 19655 00000A3C C70601000000            	mov	word [1],0
 19656 00000A42 29D9                    	sub	cx,bx				; size of the new block
 19657                                  	;mov	[ARENA.SIZE],cx			; store it in the arena
 19658 00000A44 890E0300                	mov	[3],cx
 19659 00000A48 8CC0                    	mov	ax,es				; return seg to the caller
 19660                                  	; 23/10/2022
 19661                                  	;; 24/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0 (ORG 0)	; Take care ORG 30h of
 19662 00000A4A 83E803                  	sub	ax,3				;  BIOS code
 19663 00000A4D 5A                      	pop	dx
 19664 00000A4E 59                      	pop	cx
 19665 00000A4F 5F                      	pop	di
 19666 00000A50 1F                      	pop	ds ; ds = cs
 19667 00000A51 C3                      	retn
 19668                                  ;
 19669                                  ; M012 : END
 19670                                  ;
 19671                                  FatalErr:

 19674 00000A54 BA[1E09]                	mov	dx,FEmsg
 19675 00000A57 B409                    	mov	ah,9

 19677                                  				; DS:DX -> string terminated by "$"
 19678                                  	; 30/12/2022 (MSDOS 6.21 SYSINIT)
 19679 00000A5B E92C07                  	jmp	stall

 19681                                  	;cli
 19682                                  	;hlt

 19689                                  ;
 19690                                  ; procedure : AllocHMA
 19691                                  ;
 19692                                  ;	grab_the_hma tries to enable a20 and make sure there is memory
 19693                                  ;	  up there. If it gets any sort of error, it will return with
 19694                                  ;	  carry set so that we can resort to running low.
 19695                                  ;
 19696                                  ;	It also returns ES: -> 0ffffh if it returns success
 19697                                  ;
 19698                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 19699                                  
 19700                                  AllocHMA:
 19701                                  ;	cas note:  The pre-286 check is no longer needed here since the
 19702                                  ;		   presence of XMS is sufficient. However, this code hasn't
 19703                                  ;		   been deleted because it can be recycled for skipping the
 19704                                  ;		   extra pass of CONFIG.SYS and assuming we're running low
 19705                                  ;		   in the case of a pre-286.
 19706                                  
 19707                                  ;;	see if we're running on a pre-286. If not, force low.
 19708                                  ;
 19709                                  ;	xor	ax,ax
 19710                                  ;	pushf			; save flags (like int)
 19711                                  ;	push	ax
 19712                                  ;	popf
 19713                                  ;	pushf
 19714                                  ;	pop	ax
 19715                                  ;	popf			; restore original flags (like int)
 19716                                  ;	and	ax,0F000h
 19717                                  ;	cmp	ax,0F000h	; 8088/8086?
 19718                                  ;	jz	short grab_hma_error
 19719                                  
 19720                                  	; 23/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 19721                                  	; (SYSINIT:0A26h)
 19722                                  
 19723 00000A5E 1E                      	push	ds
 19724                                  	;;mov	ax,Bios_Data
 19725                                  	;mov	ax,KERNEL_SEGMENT
 19726                                  	; 21/10/2022
 19727 00000A5F B87000                  	mov	ax,DOSBIODATASEG
 19728 00000A62 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax
 19729                                  
 19730 00000A64 E84A00                  	call	IsXMSLoaded
 19731 00000A67 7545                    	jnz	short grabhma_error
 19732                                  
 19733 00000A69 B81043                  	mov	ax,4310h
 19734 00000A6C CD2F                    	int	2Fh		; get the vector into es:bx
 19735                                  		; - Multiplex - XMS - GET DRIVER ADDRESS
 19736                                  		; Return: ES:BX -> driver entry point
 19737                                  
 19738 00000A6E 891E[0E00]              	mov	[xms],bx
 19739                                  	;mov	[0Eh],bx
 19740 00000A72 8C06[1000]              	mov	[xms+2],es
 19741                                  	;mov	[10h],es
 19742                                  
 19743 00000A76 B401                    	mov	ah,1		; request HMA
 19744 00000A78 BAFFFF                  	mov	dx,0FFFFh
 19745                                  	;call	dword ptr ds:0Eh
 19746 00000A7B FF1E[0E00]              	call	far [xms]
 19747 00000A7F 48                      	dec	ax
 19748 00000A80 7409                    	jz	short allocHMA_1 ; error if not able to allocate HMA
 19749                                  
 19750                                  ;------ Himem may be lying because it has allocated mem for int 15
 19751                                  
 19752 00000A82 B488                    	mov	ah,88h
 19753 00000A84 CD15                    	int	15h
 19754                                  		; Get Extended Memory Size
 19755                                  		; Return: CF clear on success
 19756                                  		; AX = size of memory above 1M in K
 19757 00000A86 83F840                  	cmp	ax,64		; less than 64 K of hma ?
 19758                                  	;jb	short grabhma_error
 19759                                  	; 11/12/2022
 19760 00000A89 7224                    	jb	short grabhma_err ; cf=1
 19761                                  allocHMA_1:
 19762 00000A8B B405                    	mov	ah,5		; localenableA20
 19763                                  	;call	dword ptr ds:0Eh
 19764 00000A8D FF1E[0E00]              	call	far [xms]
 19765 00000A91 48                      	dec	ax
 19766 00000A92 751A                    	jnz	short grabhma_error ; error if couldn't enable A20
 19767                                  
 19768 00000A94 E88501                  	call	IsVDiskInstalled
 19769 00000A97 7415                    	jz	short grabhma_error ; yes, we cant use HMA
 19770                                  
 19771 00000A99 B8FFFF                  	mov	ax,0FFFFh
 19772 00000A9C 8EC0                    	mov	es,ax
 19773 00000A9E 26C70610003412          	mov	word [es:10h],1234h ; see if we can really read/write there
 19774 00000AA5 26813E10003412          	cmp	word [es:10h],1234h
 19775                                  	;jne	short grabhma_error ; don't try to load there if XMS lied
 19776                                  	; 11/12/2022
 19777 00000AAC 7401                    	je	short allocHMA_ok	
 19778                                  
 19779                                  ; 11/12/2022
 19780                                  ;	; 11/12/2022
 19781                                  ;	; cf=0
 19782                                  ;	;clc
 19783                                  ;	pop	ds
 19784                                  ;	retn
 19785                                  
 19786                                  grabhma_error:
 19787 00000AAE F9                      	stc
 19788                                  	; 11/12/022
 19789                                  grabhma_err:	; cf=1
 19790                                  allocHMA_ok:	; cf=0
 19791 00000AAF 1F                      	pop	ds
 19792 00000AB0 C3                      	retn

 19794                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 19795                                  ;
 19796                                  ; procedure : IsXMSLoaded
 19797                                  ;
 19798                                  ;             Checks whether a XMS driver is loaded
 19799                                  ;
 19800                                  ; Returns : Z flag set if XMS driver loaded
 19801                                  ;           Z flag reset if no XMS drivers are present
 19802                                  ;
 19803                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 19804                                  
 19805                                  IsXMSLoaded:
 19806 00000AB1 B80043                  	mov	ax,4300h
 19807 00000AB4 CD2F                    	int	2Fh		; - Multiplex - XMS - INSTALLATION CHECK
 19808                                  				; Return: AL = 80h XMS driver installed
 19809                                  				; AL <> 80h no driver
 19810 00000AB6 3C80                    	cmp	al,80h		; XMS installed?
 19811 00000AB8 C3                      	retn

 19813                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 19814                                  ; procedure : FTryToMovDOSHi
 19815                                  ;
 19816                                  ;		Called from HMA suballoc calls
 19817                                  ;	
 19818                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 19819                                  
 19820                                  	; 23/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 19821                                  	; (SYSINIT:0A84h)
 19822                                  
 19823                                  FTryToMovDOSHi:	; proc	far
 19824                                  
 19825 00000AB9 50                      	push	ax

 19858                                  
 19859                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 19860                                  ;
 19861                                  ; following piece of code will be moved into a para boundary. And the para
 19862                                  ; address posted in seg of int 19h vector. Offset of int 19h will point to
 19863                                  ; VDint19. This is to protect HMA from apps which use VDISK header method
 19864                                  ; to determine free extended memory.
 19865                                  ;
 19866                                  ; For more details read "power programming" column by Ray Duncan in the
 19867                                  ; May 30 1989 issue of PC Magazine (pp 377-388) [USING EXTENDED MEMORY,PART 1]
 19868                                  ;
 19869                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 19870                                  
 19871                                  StartVDHead:
 19872                                  ;-------------- what follows is a dummy device driver header (not used by DOS)
 19873                                  
 19874 00000AD6 00000000                	dd	0		; link to next device driver
 19875 00000ADA 0080                    	dw	8000h		; device attribute
 19876 00000ADC 0000                    	dw	0		; strategy routine offset
 19877 00000ADE 0000                    	dw	0		; interrupt routine offset
 19878 00000AE0 01                      	db	1		; number of units
 19879                                  	;db	7 dup(0) 
 19880 00000AE1 00<rep 7h>              	times	7 db 0 		; reserved area
 19881                                  VDiskSig1:
 19882 00000AE8 564449534B              	db	'VDISK'
 19883                                  
 19884                                  VLEN1	equ	($-VDiskSig1)
 19885                                  
 19886 00000AED 202056332E33            	db	'  V3.3'	; vdisk label
 19887                                  	;db	15 dup (0)	; pad
 19888 00000AF3 00<rep Fh>              	times	15 db 0
 19889 00000B02 0000                    	dw	0		; bits 0-15 of free HMA
 19890 00000B04 11                      	db	11h		; bits 16-23 of free HMA (1M + 64K)
 19891                                  VDInt19:
 19892 00000B05 EA                      	db	0EAh		; jmp to old vector
 19893                                  OldVDInt19:
 19894 00000B06 00000000                	dd	0		; Saved int 19 vector
 19895                                  
 19896                                  EndVDHead: ; label byte
 19897                                  
 19898                                  VDiskHMAHead:	
 19899 00000B0A 000000                  	db	0,0,0		; non-bootable disk
 19900                                  VDiskSig2:
 19901 00000B0D 564449534B              	db	'VDISK'
 19902                                  
 19903                                  VLEN2	equ	($-VDiskSig2)
 19904                                  
 19905 00000B12 332E33                  	db	'3.3'		; OEM - signature
 19906 00000B15 8000                    	dw	128		; number of bytes/sector
 19907 00000B17 01                      	db	1		; sectors/cluster
 19908 00000B18 0100                    	dw	1		; reserved sectors
 19909 00000B1A 01                      	db	1		; number of FAT copies
 19910 00000B1B 4000                    	dw	64		; number of root dir entries
 19911 00000B1D 0002                    	dw	512		; number of sectors
 19912 00000B1F FE                      	db	0FEh		; media descriptor
 19913 00000B20 0600                    	dw	6		; number of sectors/FAT
 19914 00000B22 0800                    	dw	8		; sectors per track
 19915 00000B24 0100                    	dw	1		; number of heads
 19916 00000B26 0000                    	dw	0		; number of hidden sectors
 19917 00000B28 4004                    	dw	440h		; Start of free HMA in K (1M+64K)
 19918                                  
 19919                                  EndVDiskHMAHead: ; label byte
 19920                                  
 19921                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 19922                                  ;
 19923                                  ; procedure : InstVDiskHeader
 19924                                  ;
 19925                                  ;             Installs the VDISK header to reserve the 64k of HMA
 19926                                  ;	      It puts a 32 byte header at 10000:0 and
 19927                                  ;	      another header at (seg of int19):0
 19928                                  ;
 19929                                  ; Inputs : None
 19930                                  ;
 19931                                  ; Outputs : None
 19932                                  ;
 19933                                  ; USES : DS,SI,AX,CX,DX
 19934                                  ;
 19935                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 19936                                  
 19937                                  	; 23/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 19938                                  
 19939                                  InstVDiskHeader:
 19940 00000B2A 31C0                    	xor	ax,ax
 19941 00000B2C 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax			; seg of int vect table
 19942                                  
 19943                                  ;-------------- save old int 19 vector
 19944                                  
 19945                                  	; 23/10/2022
 19946 00000B2E A16400                  	mov	ax,[19h*4]
 19947                                  	;mov	[OldVDInt19],ax
 19948 00000B31 2EA3[060B]              	mov	[cs:OldVDInt19],ax
 19949 00000B35 A16600                  	mov	ax,[19h*4+2]
 19950                                  	;mov	[OldVDInt19+2],ax
 19951 00000B38 2EA3[080B]              	mov	[cs:OldVDInt19+2],ax
 19952                                  
 19953                                  ;-------------- calculate seg of new int 19 handler
 19954                                  
 19955 00000B3C B448                    	mov	ah,48h			; allocate memory
 19956                                  	;mov	bx,(EndVDHead-StartVDHead+15)>>4
 19957                                  	; 23/10/2022
 19958 00000B3E BB0400                  	mov	bx,4
 19959 00000B41 CD21                    	int	21h
 19960                                  
 19961                                  ;	if carry, fatal hanging error!!!!!
 19962                                  
 19963 00000B43 48                      	dec	ax			; point to arena
 19964 00000B44 8EC0                    	mov	es,ax
 19965                                  	;mov	word [es:ARENA.OWNER],8	; owner = System
 19966 00000B46 26C70601000800          	mov	word [es:1],8
 19967                                  	;mov	word [es:ARENA.NAME],'SC' ; System Code
 19968 00000B4D 26C70608005343          	mov	word [es:8],'SC'
 19969 00000B54 40                      	inc	ax
 19970 00000B55 8EC0                    	mov	es,ax			; get back to allocated memory
 19971                                  
 19972                                  ;-------------- install new int 19 vector
 19973                                  
 19974 00000B57 FA                      	cli				; no reboots at this time
 19975                                  	;mov	word [19h*4],(VDInt19-StartVDHead)
 19976 00000B58 C70664002F00            	mov	word [19h*4],47
 19977 00000B5E A36600                  	mov	[19h*4+2],ax
 19978                                  
 19979                                  ;-------------- move the code into proper place
 19980                                  
 19981                                  	;mov	cx,(EndVDHead-StartVDHead)
 19982 00000B61 B93400                  	mov	cx,52
 19983 00000B64 BE[D60A]                	mov	si,StartVDHead
 19984 00000B67 31FF                    	xor	di,di
 19985 00000B69 0E                      	push	cs
 19986 00000B6A 1F                      	pop	ds
 19987 00000B6B FC                      	cld
 19988 00000B6C F3A4                    	rep	movsb
 19989 00000B6E FB                      	sti				; BUGBUG is sti OK now?
 19990                                  
 19991                                  ;-------------- mov the HMA VDisk head into HMA
 19992                                  
 19993                                  	; 23/10/2022
 19994 00000B6F 57                      	push	di
 19995 00000B70 06                      	push	es
 19996                                  
 19997                                  	;mov	ax,0FFFFh
 19998                                  	;mov	es,ax
 19999                                  	; 03/09/2023
 20000 00000B71 49                      	dec	cx
 20001                                  	; cx = 0FFFFh
 20002 00000B72 8EC1                    	mov	es,cx
 20003                                  
 20004 00000B74 BF1000                  	mov	di,10h
 20005                                  	;mov	cx,(EndVDiskHMAHead-VDiskHMAHead)
 20006 00000B77 B92000                  	mov	cx,32
 20007 00000B7A BE[0A0B]                	mov	si,VDiskHMAHead
 20008 00000B7D F3A4                    	rep	movsb			; ds already set to cs
 20009                                  
 20010 00000B7F 5F                      	pop	di
 20011 00000B80 07                      	pop	es
 20012                                  
 20013 00000B81 C3                      	retn

 20065                                  
 20066                                  ;; 04/07/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 IO.SYS (optimized)
 20067                                  ;;-----------------------------------------------------------	     ;I070
 20068                                  ;; The following workaround get around a problem with the	     ;I070
 20069                                  ;; Tortugas and PS/2 30-286 BIOS when password server mode	     ;I070
 20070                                  ;; is set. On those machines the INT 15h block move code	     ;I070
 20071                                  ;; goes through the 8042 to twiddle A20 instead of port 92h.	     ;I070
 20072                                  ;; In password server mode the 8042 is disabled so the block	     ;I070
 20073                                  ;; move crashes the system. We can do this because these	     ;I070
 20074                                  ;; systems clear all of memory on a cold boot.			     ;I070
 20075                                  ;								     ;I070

 20077                                  ;	test    al,10h			; Is keyboard inhibited?     ;I070

 20081                                  ;	;cmp	word [sys_model_byte],19F8h  ; ds = cs       
 20082                                  ;	mov	ax,[sys_model_byte]

 20084                                  ;	je      short ClrVDISKno                            	     ;I070
 20085                                  ;					; Check for mod 30-286	     ;I070

 20087                                  ;	;cmp	word [sys_model_byte],09FCh	
 20088                                  ;	cmp	ax,09FCh
 20089                                  ;	jne     short ClrVDISKok			      	     ;I070
 20090                                  ;ClrVDISKno:							     ;I070	
 20091                                  ;	retn	               		; Return w/o block move.     ;I070
 20092                                  ;ClrVDISKok:							     ;I070
 20093                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------	     ;I070
 20094                                  
 20095                                  	; 12/12/2022
 20096                                  	; ds = cs
 20097

 20141                                  ;		the offset.

 20155 00000C02 B8FFFF                  	mov	ax,0FFFFh	   ; HMA segment

 20158                                  	;

 20160 00000C0A 83C70F                  	add	di,15		   ; para round
 20161 00000C0D 83E7F0                  	and	di,0FFF0h

 20163 00000C12 D3E0                    	shl	ax,cl
 20164 00000C14 29C7                    	sub	di,ax
 20165                                  	;
 20166                                  	; 03/09/2023

 21144                                  
 21145                                  ;global rearm command for shared interrupt devices attached in the system;
 21146                                  ;shared interrupt attachment has some problem when it issues interrupt
 21147                                  ;during a warm reboot. once the interrupt is presented by the attachment,
 21148                                  ;no further interrupts on that level will be presented until a global rearm
 21149                                  ;is issued. by the request of the system architecture group, msbio will
 21150                                  ;issue a global rearm after every device driver is loaded.
 21151                                  ;to issue a global rearm:	;for pc1,xt,palace
 21152                                  ;
 21153                                  ;			  out 02f2h,xx  ; interrupt level 2
 21154                                  ;			  out 02f3h,xx  ; interrupt level 3
 21155                                  ;			  out 02f4h,xx  ; interrupt level 4
 21156                                  ;			  out 02f5h,xx  ; interrupt level 5
 21157                                  ;			  out 02f6h,xx  ; interrupt level 6
 21158                                  ;			  out 02f7h,xx  ; interrupt level 7
 21159                                  ;
 21160                                  ;	for pc at,in addition to the above commands,
 21161                                  ;	need to handle the secondary interrupt handler
 21162                                  ;
 21163                                  ;			  out 06f2h,xx  ; interrupt level 10
 21164                                  ;			  out 06f3h,xx  ; interrupt level 11
 21165                                  ;			  out 06f4h,xx  ; interrupt level 12
 21166                                  ;			  out 06f6h,xx  ; interrupt level 14
 21167                                  ;			  out 06f7h,xx  ; interrupt level 15
 21168                                  ;
 21169                                  ;	for round-up machine
 21170                                  ;
 21171                                  ;			  none.
 21172                                  
 21173                                  ; where xx stands for any value.
 21174                                  ;
 21175                                  ; for your information,after naples level machine,the system service bios
 21176                                  ; call (int 15h),function ah=0c0h returns the system configuration parameters
 21177                                  
 21178                                  	; 24/10/2022
 21179                                  
 21180 00000FEB 50                      	push	ax
 21181 00000FEC 53                      	push	bx
 21182 00000FED 52                      	push	dx
 21183 00000FEE 06                      	push	es

 21385                                  ; Do_Install_Exec
 21386                                  ;
 21387                                  ; This procedure is used to EXEC a program being loaded via the 
 21388                                  ; "install=" mechanism in config.sys. It does this by setting up
 21389                                  ; the parameters, and then jumping to sysinit_base, which has been
 21390                                  ; setup in low memory. When complete, sysinit_base will jump back
 21391                                  ; up to this procedure (if sysinit remains uncorrupted by the installed
 21392                                  ; program).

 21403                                  ; after the filename. so parameter starts after that. if next

 21405                                  ; we already encountered used to be a carrage return. in this
 21406                                  ; case,let's set the length to 0 which will be followed by
 21407                                  ; carridge return.

 21410                                  ;character after =.

 21416 000010D8 89F2                    	mov	dx,si			; ds:dx->file name,0 in config.sys image.

 21553                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 21554                                  
 21555                                  ;**	ParaRound - Round Up length to paragraph multiple
 21556                                  ;
 21557                                  ;	ParaRound rounds a byte count up to a multiple of 16, then divides
 21558                                  ;	by 16 yielding a "length in paragraphs" value.
 21559                                  ;
 21560                                  ;	ENTRY	(ax) = byte length
 21561                                  ;	EXIT	(ax) = rounded up length in paragraphs
 21562                                  ;	USES	ax, flags
 21563                                  
 21564                                  ParaRound:
 21565 00001151 83C00F                  	add	ax,15
 21566 00001154 D1D8                    	rcr	ax,1
 21567 00001156 D1E8                    	shr	ax,1
 21568 00001158 D1E8                    	shr	ax,1
 21569 0000115A D1E8                    	shr	ax,1
 21570 0000115C C3                      	retn
 21571                                  
 21572                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 21573                                  ; sysinit_base module.
 21574                                  ;
 21575                                  ; This module is relocated by the routine EndFile to a location in low
 21576                                  ; memory. It is then called by SYSINIT to perform the EXEC of programs
 21577                                  ; that are being loaded by the "install=" command. After the EXEC call
 21578                                  ; completes, this module performs a checksum on the SYSINIT code (at the
 21579                                  ; top of memory) to be sure that the EXECed program did not damage it.
 21580                                  ; If it did, then this module will print an error message and stop the
 21581                                  ; system. Otherwise, it returns control to SYSINIT.
 21582                                  ;
 21583                                  ;in: after relocation,
 21584                                  ;    ax = 4b00h - load and execute the program dos function.
 21585                                  ;    ds = confbot. segment of config.sys file image
 21586                                  ;    es = sysinitseg. segment of sysinit module itself.
 21587                                  ;    ds:dx = pointer to asciiz string of the path,filename to be executed.
 21588                                  ;    es:bx = pointer to a parameter block for load.
 21589                                  ;    SI_end (byte) - offset value of end of sysinit module label
 21590                                  ;    bigsize (word) - # of word from confbot to SI_end.
 21591                                  ;    chksum (word) - sum of every byte from confbot to SI_end in a
 21592                                  ;			word boundary moduler form.
 21593                                  ;    sysinit_ptr (dword ptr) - return address to sysinit module.
 21594                                  ;
 21595                                  ;note: sysinit should save necessary registers and when the control is back
 21596                                  
 21597                                  	; 24/10/2022
 21598                                  	; (SYSINIT:115Ch for MSDOS 5.0 SYSINIT)
 21599                                  sysinit_base:				
 21600 0000115D 2E8C166200              	mov	[cs:sysinit_base_ss],ss	; save stack
 21601 00001162 2E89266400              	mov	[cs:sysinit_base_sp],sp	
 21602 00001167 CD21                    	int	21h			; load/exec dos call.
 21603 00001169 2E8E166200              	mov	ss,[cs:sysinit_base_ss]	; restore stack
 21604 0000116E 2E8B266400              	mov	sp,[cs:sysinit_base_sp]
 21605 00001173 1F                      	pop	ds			; restore confbot seg
 21606 00001174 07                      	pop	es			; restore sysinitseg
 21607 00001175 7216                    	jc	short sysinit_base_end	; load/exec function failed.
 21608                                  					; at this time,i don't have to worry about
 21609                                  					; that sysinit module has been broken or not.
 21610 00001177 E81800                  	call	sum_up			; otherwise,check if it is good.
 21611 0000117A 263906[D802]            	cmp	[es:checksum],ax
 21612 0000117F 740C                    	je	short sysinit_base_end
 21613                                  
 21614                                  ;	memory broken. show "memory allocation error" message and stall.
 21615                                  
 21616 00001181 B409                    	mov	ah,9
 21617 00001183 0E                      	push	cs
 21618 00001184 1F                      	pop	ds
 21619                                  	; 30/12/2022

 21793                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 21794                                  ; procedure : GetBufferAddr
 21795                                  ;
 21796                                  ;	      Gets the buffer address either in HMA or in Lo Mem
 21797                                  ;
 21798                                  ; returns in es:di the buffer adress
 21799                                  ; returns NZ if allocated in HMA

 21803                                  GetBufferAddr:
 21804 00001238 53                      	push	bx
 21805 00001239 52                      	push	dx
 21806 0000123A 2EA1[9B02]              	mov	ax, [cs:singlebuffersize]
 21807 0000123E 2EF726[9702]            	mul	word [cs:buffers]
 21808                                  	;add	ax,0Fh
 21809 00001243 83C00F                  	add	ax,15 
 21810                                  	; 02/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 21811                                  	;and	ax,~15	; 0FFF0h	; para round
 21812                                  	; 12/12/2022
 21813 00001246 24F0                    	and	al,~15	; 0F0h
 21814 00001248 89C3                    	mov	bx,ax
 21815 0000124A B8024A                  	mov	ax,4A02h
 21816                                  	;mov	ax,((multMULT<<8)+multMULTALLOCHMA)
 21817 0000124D CD2F                    	int	2Fh
 21818 0000124F 83FFFF                  	cmp	di,0FFFFh
 21819 00001252 7506                    	jne	short got_hma
 21820                                  
 21821                                  	;mov	di,0			; dont xor di,di Z flag needed
 21822                                  	; 05/09/2023
 21823                                  	; zf=1
 21824 00001254 47                      	inc	di ; 0FFFFh -> 0
 21825                                  	; zf=1
 21826                                  	
 21827                                  	;zf=1
 21828                                  	;xor	di,di	; 25/10/2022
 21829                                  	;zf=1
 21830 00001255 2E8E06[6203]            	mov	es,[cs:memhi]
 21831                                  got_hma:
 21832 0000125A 5A                      	pop	dx
 21833 0000125B 5B                      	pop	bx
 21834 0000125C C3                      	retn

 21864                                  ; ======================================================================
 21865                                  ; MSSTACK initialization routine - MSDOS 6.0 - SYSDINIT1.ASM - 1991
 21866                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 21867                                  ; 27/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 21868                                  
 21869                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 21870                                  ; ibmstack initialization routine.
 21871                                  ;
 21872                                  ;	to follow the standard interrupt sharing scheme, msstack.asm
 21873                                  ;	has been modified. this initialization routine also has to
 21874                                  ;	be modified because for the interrupt level 7 and 15, firstflag
 21875                                  ;	should be set to signal that this interrupt handler is the
 21876                                  ;	first handler hooked to this interrupt vector.
 21877                                  ;	we determine this by looking at the instruction pointed by
 21878                                  ;	this vector. if it is iret, then this handler should be the
 21879                                  ;	first one. in our case, only the interrupt vector 77h is the
 21880                                  ;	interrupt level 15. (we don't hook interrupt level 7.)
 21881                                  ;
 21882                                  ;	the followings are mainly due to m.r.t; ptm fix of p886 12/3/86
 21883                                  ;	some design changes are needed to the above interrupt sharing
 21884                                  ;	method. the above sharing scheme assumes that 1). interrupt
 21885                                  ;	sharing is never done on levels that have bios support. 2). "phantom"
 21886                                  ;	interrupts would only be generated on levels 7 and 15.
 21887                                  ;	these assumptions are not true any more. we have to use the firstflag
 21888                                  ;	for every level of interrupt. we will set the firstflag on the following
 21889                                  ;	conditions:
 21890                                  ;
 21891                                  ;	 a.	 if the cs portion of the vector is 0000, then "first"
 21892                                  ;	 b. else if cs:ip points to valid shared header, then not "first"
 21893                                  ;	 c. else if cs:ip points to an iret, then "first"
 21894                                  ;	 d. else if cs:ip points to dummy, then "first"
 21895                                  ;
 21896                                  ;	where dummy is - the cs portion must be f000, and the ip portion must
 21897                                  ;	be equal to the value at f000:ff01. this location is the initial value
 21898                                  ;	from vector_table for interrupt 7, one of the preserved addresses in all
 21899                                  ;	the bioses for all of the machines.
 21900                                  ;
 21901                                  ;	system design group requests bios to handle the phantom interrupts.
 21902                                  ;
 21903                                  ;	the "phantom" interrupt is an illegal interrupt such as an interrupt
 21904                                  ;	produced by the bogus adapter card even without interrupt request is
 21905                                  ;	set.  more specifically, 1). the 8259 has a feature when running in
 21906                                  ;	edge triggered mode to latch a pulse and present the interrupt when
 21907                                  ;	the processor indicates interrupt acknowledge (inta). the interrupt
 21908                                  ;	pulse was exist at the time of inta to get a "phantom" interrupt.
 21909                                  ;	2). or, this is caused by adapter cards placing a glitch on the
 21910                                  ;	interrupt line.
 21911                                  ;
 21912                                  ;	to handle those "phantom" interrupts, the main stack code will check
 21913                                  ;	the own firstflag, and if it is not "first" (which means the forward
 21914                                  ;	pointer points to the legal shared interrupt handler), then pass the
 21915                                  ;	control. if it is the first, then the following action should be
 21916                                  ;	taken. we don't have to implement stack logic in this case.
 21917                                  ;
 21918                                  ;	to implement this logic, we rather choose a simple method.
 21919                                  ;	if ont of the above "firstflag" conditions is met, we are not
 21920                                  ;	going to hook this interrupt vector. the reason is if the original
 21921                                  ;	vector points to "iret" and do nothing, we don't need
 21922                                  ;	to implement the stack logic for it. this will simplify implementation
 21923                                  ;	while maintaining compatibility with the old version of dos.
 21924                                  ;	this implies that in the main stack code, there might be a stack code
 21925                                  ;	that will never be used, a dead code.
 21926                                  ;
 21927                                  ;in - cs, ds -> sysinitseg, es -> relocated stack code & data.
 21928                                  
 21929                                  	; 25/10/2022 - Retro DOS 4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)
 21930                                  	; (SYSINIT:1287h)
 21931                                  
 21932                                  	; 14/12/2022
 21933                                  stackinit:
 21934 00001285 50                      	push	ax
 21935 00001286 1E                      	push	ds
 21936 00001287 06                      	push	es
 21937 00001288 53                      	push	bx
 21938 00001289 51                      	push	cx
 21939 0000128A 52                      	push	dx
 21940 0000128B 57                      	push	di
 21941 0000128C 56                      	push	si
 21942 0000128D 55                      	push	bp
 21943                                  
 21944                                  ;currently es -> stack code area
 21945                                  
 21946                                  	; 12/12/2022
 21947                                  	; ds = cs
 21948 0000128E A1[8A02]                	mov	ax,[stack_count]
 21949 00001291 89C1                    	mov	cx,ax  ; *!*!*  
 21950                                  	; 02/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 21951                                  	; (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:1290h)
 21952                                  	;mov	ax,[cs:stack_count] ; !!	;defined in cs
 21953 00001293 26A3[0200]              	mov	[es:stackcount],ax		;defined in stack code area
 21954                                  	; (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:1298h)
 21955 00001297 A1[8C02]                	mov	ax,[stack_size]	 ; !!		;in cs
 21956 0000129A 26A3[0600]              	mov	[es:stacksize],ax
 21957                                  	; 12/12/2022
 21958 0000129E A1[8E02]                	mov	ax,[stack_addr]			; offset
 21959                                  	; 02/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 21960                                  	; (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:129Fh)
 21961                                  	;mov	ax,[cs:stack_addr]  ; !!
 21962 000012A1 26A3[0800]              	mov	[es:stacks],ax
 21963                                  	; 12/12/2022
 21964 000012A5 89C5                    	mov	bp,ax ; *!*
 21965 000012A7 A1[9002]                	mov	ax,[stack_addr+2]
 21966                                  	; 02/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 21967                                  	; (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:129Fh)
 21968                                  	;mov	ax,[cs:stack_addr+2] ; !!	; segment
 21969 000012AA 26A3[0A00]              	mov	[es:stacks+2],ax
 21970                                  
 21971                                  ; initialize the data fields with the parameters
 21972                                  
 21973                                  ; "firstentry" will always be at stacks
 21974                                  
 21975                                  	;mov	bp,[es:stacks]			; get offset of stack
 21976                                  	; 12/12/2022
 21977                                  	; bp = [es:stacks] ; *!*
 21978 000012AE 26892E[0C00]            	mov	[es:firstentry],bp
 21979                                  
 21980                                  ; the stacks will always immediately follow the table entries
 21981                                  
 21982 000012B3 B80800                  	mov	ax,entrysize ; 8
 21983                                  	;mov	cx,[es:stackcount]
 21984                                  	; 12/12/2022
 21985                                  	; cx = [es:stackcount] ; *!*!*
 21986 000012B6 F7E1                    	mul	cx
 21987 000012B8 01E8                    	add	ax,bp
 21988 000012BA 26A3[0400]              	mov	[es:stackat],ax
 21989 000012BE 89C3                    	mov	bx,ax
 21990 000012C0 83EB02                  	sub	bx,2
 21991                                  
 21992                                  ; zero the entire stack area to start with
 21993                                  
 21994 000012C3 268B3E[0400]            	mov	di,[es:stackat]
 21995 000012C8 26A1[0600]              	mov	ax,[es:stacksize]
 21996 000012CC F7E1                    	mul	cx
 21997 000012CE 89C1                    	mov	cx,ax
 21998 000012D0 31C0                    	xor	ax,ax
 21999 000012D2 06                      	push	es
 22000 000012D3 1F                      	pop	ds				;ds = relocated stack code seg.
 22001                                  
 22002                                  ;now, ds -> stack code area
 22003                                  
 22004 000012D4 8E06[0A00]              	mov	es,[stacks+2]			; get segment of stack area.
 22005 000012D8 FC                      	cld
 22006 000012D9 F3AA                    	rep	stosb
 22007                                  
 22008 000012DB 8B0E[0200]              	mov	cx,[stackcount]
 22009                                  
 22010                                  ; loop for "count" times, building a table entry
 22011                                  ;  cs = sysinitseg, ds = relocated stack code seg, es = segment of stack space
 22012                                  ;  cx = number of entries
 22013                                  ;  es:bp => base of stacks - 2
 22014                                  ;  es:bx => first table entry
 22015                                  
 22016                                  buildloop:
 22017                                  	; 11/12/2022
 22018                                  	;mov	byte [es:bp+allocbyte],free	; mov [es:bp+0],0
 22019                                  	; 25/10/2022
 22020                                  	;mov	byte [es:bp],free
 22021                                  	; 06/07/2023
 22022 000012DF 26884600                	mov	[es:bp],al ; 0 ; free
 22023 000012E3 26884601                	mov	[es:bp+intlevel],al	; ax = 0
 22024                                  	;mov	[es:bp+1],al
 22025 000012E7 26894602                	mov	[es:bp+savedsp],ax
 22026                                  	;mov	[es:bp2],ax
 22027 000012EB 26894604                	mov	[es:bp+savedss],ax
 22028                                  	;mov	[es:bp+4],ax
 22029 000012EF 031E[0600]              	add	bx,[stacksize]
 22030 000012F3 26895E06                	mov	[es:bp+newsp],bx		; mov [es:bp+6],bx
 22031                                  	;mov	[es:bp+6],bx
 22032 000012F7 26892F                  	mov	[es:bx],bp
 22033 000012FA 83C508                  	add	bp,entrysize ; 8
 22034                                  
 22035 000012FD E2E0                    	loop	buildloop
 22036                                  
 22037 000012FF 83ED08                  	sub	bp,entrysize ; 8
 22038 00001302 892E[0E00]              	mov	[lastentry],bp
 22039 00001306 892E[1000]              	mov	[nextentry],bp
 22040                                  
 22041 0000130A 1E                      	push	ds
 22042                                  	;mov	ax,0F000h		;look at the model byte
 22043                                  	; 05/09/2023
 22044 0000130B B4F0                    	mov	ah,0F0h ; ax = 0F000h
 22045 0000130D 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax
 22046 0000130F 803EFEFFF9              	cmp	byte [0FFFEh],0F9h ; mdl_convert ; convertible?
 22047 00001314 1F                      	pop	ds
 22048 00001315 7504                    	jne	short skip_disablenmis
 22049                                  
 22050 00001317 B007                    	mov	al,07h			; disable convertible nmis
 22051 00001319 E672                    	out	72h,al
 22052                                  
 22053                                  skip_disablenmis:
 22054 0000131B 31C0                    	xor	ax,ax
 22055 0000131D 8EC0                    	mov	es,ax			;es - segid of vector table at 0
 22056                                  					;ds - relocated stack code segment
 22057 0000131F FA                      	cli
 22058                                  
 22059                                  	;irp	aa,<02,08,09,70>
 22060                                  	;
 22061                                  	;mov	si,aa&h*4		;pass where vector is to be adjusted
 22062                                  	;mov	di,offset int19old&aa	;we have to set old&aa for int19 handler too.
 22063                                  	;mov	bx,offset old&aa	;pass where to save original owner pointer

 22647                                  	lds	bx,[es:si]
 22648                                  	push	ds
 22649                                  	pop	dx
 22650                                  		
 22651                                  	cmp	dx,0
 22652                                  	je	short int_77_first
 22653                                  
 22654                                  	cmp	byte [bx],0CFh
 22655                                  	je	short int_77_first
 22656                                  	
 22657                                  	cmp	word [bx+6],424Bh
 22658                                  	je	short int_77_not_first
 22659                                  	
 22660                                  	cmp	dx,0F000h
 22661                                  	jne	short int_77_not_first
 22662                                  
 22663                                  	push	es
 22664                                  	push	dx
 22665                                  	mov	dx,0F000h
 22666                                  	mov	es,dx
 22667                                  	cmp	bx,[es:0FF01h]
 22668                                  	pop	dx
 22669                                  	pop	es
 22670                                  	je	short int_77_first
 22671                                  %endif
 22672                                  	
 22673                                  int_77_not_first:
 22674                                  	; 14/12/2022
 22675                                  	; 25/10/2022
 22676                                  	;pop	ds
 22677 0000141A BF[7B06]                	mov	di,INT19OLD77
 22678 0000141D BB[3101]                	mov	bx,old77
 22679 00001420 BA[2F01]                	mov	dx,int77
 22680 00001423 E85100                  	call	new_init_loop
 22681                                  
 22682                                  	; 14/12/2022
 22683                                  	;jmp	short int_77_end
 22684                                  ;int_77_first:
 22685                                  	; 25/10/2022
 22686                                  	;pop	ds
 22687                                  
 22688                                  int_77_end:
 22689 00001426 1E                      	push	ds
 22690 00001427 B800F0                  	mov	ax,0F000h		; look at the model byte
 22691 0000142A 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax
 22692 0000142C 803EFEFFF9              	cmp	byte [0FFFEh],0F9h ; mdl_convert ; pc convertible?
 22693 00001431 1F                      	pop	ds
 22694 00001432 7504                    	jne	short skip_enablenmis
 22695                                  
 22696 00001434 B027                    	mov	al,27h			; enable convertible nmis
 22697 00001436 E672                    	out	72h,al
 22698                                  
 22699                                  ; 25/10/2022
 22700                                  ; (MSDOS 5.0 SYSINIT:15FBh)
 22701                                  
 22702                                  skip_enablenmis:

 22704                                  	;;mov	ax,Bios_Data ; 70h
 22705                                  	;mov	ax,KERNEL_SEGMENT ; 70h
 22706                                  	; 21/10/2022

 22708 0000143C 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax
 22709

 22711

 22713                                  					; initialization is complete

 22771                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 22772                                  ; 27/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 22773                                  
 22774                                  ; 25/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)
 22775                                  ; (SYSINIT:1610h)
 22776                                  
 22777                                  new_init_loop:
 22778                                  
 22779                                  ;input: si=ofset into vector table of the particular int vector being adjusted
 22780                                  ;	bx=ds:offset of oldxx, where will be saved the pointer to original owner
 22781                                  ;	dx=ds:offset of intxx, the new interrupt handler
 22782                                  ;	di=offset value of int19old&aa variable in bios.
 22783                                  ;	es=zero, segid of vector table
 22784                                  ;	ds=relocated stack code segment
 22785                                  
 22786 00001477 268B04                  	mov	ax,[es:si]		;remember offset in vector
 22787 0000147A 8907                    	mov	[bx],ax			; to original owner in ds
 22788 0000147C 268B4402                	mov	ax,[es:si+2]		;remember segid in vector
 22789 00001480 894702                  	mov	[bx+2],ax		; to original owner in ds
 22790                                  
 22791 00001483 1E                      	push	ds
 22792                                  	;;mov	ax,Bios_Data ; 70h
 22793                                  	;mov	ax,KERNEL_SEGMENT ; 70h
 22794                                  	; 21/10/2022
 22795 00001484 B87000                  	mov	ax,DOSBIODATASEG ; 0070h
 22796 00001487 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax			;set int19oldxx value in bios for
 22797 00001489 268B04                  	mov	ax,[es:si]		;int 19 handler
 22798 0000148C 8905                    	mov	[di],ax
 22799 0000148E 268B4402                	mov	ax,[es:si+2]
 22800 00001492 894502                  	mov	[di+2],ax
 22801 00001495 1F                      	pop	ds
 22802                                  
 22803 00001496 268914                  	mov	[es:si],dx  	;set vector to point to new int handler
 22804 00001499 268C5C02                	mov	[es:si+2],ds
 22805 0000149D C3                      	retn
 22806                                  
 22807                                  ; End of STACK initialization routine

 23052                                  ;		DW	PARMSX
 23053                                  ;		DB	2		; NUMBER OF STRINGS (0, 1, 2)
 23054                                  ;		DB	length		; LENGTH OF THE NEXT LIST, 0 IF NONE
 23055                                  ;		DB	" .. "          ; EXTRA DELIMITER LIST,
 23056                                  ;					; TYPICAL ARE ";", "="

 23063                                  struc _$P_PARMS_Blk
 23064 00000000 ????                     .PARMSX_Address:  resw 1		;AN000; Address of PARMSX
 23065 00000002 ??                       .Num_Extra:	   resb 1		;AN000; Number of extra stuff
 23066 00000003 ??                       .Len_Extra_Delim: resb 1		;AN000; Length of extra delimiter
 23067                                  endstruc

 23076                                  ;		DB	minp,maxp	; MIN, MAX POSITIONAL OPERANDS ALLOWED
