 23087                                  ;-------------------------------- PARMSX block structure
 23088                                  struc _$P_PARMSX_Blk		;AN000;
 23089 00000000 ??                       .MinP: resb 1			;AN000; Minimum positional number
 23090 00000001 ??                       .MaxP:	resb 1			;AN000; Maximum positional number
 23091 00000002 ????                     .1st_Control: resw 1		;AN000; Address of the 1st CONTROL block
 23092                                  endstruc
 23093                                  
 23094                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 23095                                  ; << Control field definition  >>
 23096                                  ;
 23097                                  ;
 23098                                  ;CONTROL   LABEL   BYTE
 23099                                  ;	   DW	   MATCH_FLAGS	   ; CONTROLS TYPE MATCHED
 23100                                  ;				   ; 8000H=NUMERIC VALUE, (VALUE LIST WILL BE CHECKED)
 23101                                  ;				   ; 4000H=SIGNED NUMERIC VALUE (VALUE LIST WILL BE CHECKED)
 23102                                  ;				   ; 2000H=SIMPLE STRING(VALUE LIST WILL BE CHECKED)
 23103                                  ;				   ; 1000H=DATE STRING (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 23104                                  ;				   ; 0800H=TIME STRING (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 23105                                  ;				   ; 0400H=COMPLEX LIST (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 23106                                  ;				   ; 0200H=FILE SPEC (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 23107                                  ;				   ; 0100H=DRIVE ONLY (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 23108                                  ;				   ; 0080H=QUOTED STRING (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 23109                                  ;				   ; 0010H=IGNORE ":" AT END IN MATCH
 23110                                  ;				   ; 0002H=REPEATS ALLOWED
 23111                                  ;				   ; 0001H=OPTIONAL
 23112                                  ;	   DW	   FUNCTION_FLAGS
 23113                                  ;				   ; 0001H=CAP RESULT BY FILE TABLE
 23114                                  ;				   ; 0002H=CAP RESULT BY CHAR TABLE
 23115                                  ;				   ; 0010H=REMOVE ":" AT END
 23116                                  ; (tm10)			   ; 0020H=colon is not necessary for switch
 23117                                  ;	   DW	   RESULT	   ; RESULT BUFFER
 23118                                  ;	   DW	   VALUES	   ; VALUE LISTS
 23119                                  ;	   DB	   nid		   ; NUMBER OF KEYWORD/SWITCH SYNONYMS IN FOLLOWING LIST
 23120                                  ;	   DB	   "...",0         ; IF n >0, KEYWORD 1
 23121                                  ;	   :
 23122                                  ;
 23123                                  ;Note:
 23124                                  ;    - The MATCH_FLAG is bit significant. You can set, for example, TIME bit and
 23125                                  ;      DATE bit simalteniously.
 23126                                  ;
 23127                                  ;      The parser examins each bit along with the following priority.
 23128                                  ;
 23129                                  ;      COMPLEX -> DATE -> TIME -> NUMERIC VAL -> SIGNED NUMERIC VAL -> DRIVE ->
 23130                                  ;      FILE SPEC -> SIMPLE STRING.
 23131                                  ;
 23132                                  ;    - When the FUNCTION_FLAG is 0001 or 0002, the STRING pointed to by a pointer
 23133                                  ;      in the result buffer is capitalized.
 23134                                  ;
 23135                                  ;    - Match_Flags 0001H and 0002H have meaning only for the positional.
 23136                                  ;
 23137                                  ;    - The "...",0 (bottom most line) does require '=' or '/'. When you need a
 23138                                  ;      switch, for example, '/A', then STRING points to;
 23139                                  ;
 23140                                  ;			DB    1 	; number of following synonyms
 23141                                  ;			DB   '/A',0
 23142                                  ;
 23143                                  ;      When you need a keyword, for example, 'CODEPAGE=', then "...",0 will be;
 23144                                  ;
 23145                                  ;			DB    1 	; number of following synonyms
 23146                                  ;			DB   'CODEPAGE=',0
 23147                                  ;
 23148                                  ;    - "..." must consist of upper case characters only because the parser
 23149                                  ;      performs pattern matching after converting input to upper case (by
 23150                                  ;      using the current country upper case table)
 23151                                  ;
 23152                                  ;    - One "..." can contain only one switch or keyword. If you need, for
 23153                                  ;      example /A and /B, the format will be;
 23154                                  ;
 23155                                  ;			DB    2 	; number of following synonyms
 23156                                  ;			DB    '/A',0
 23157                                  ;			DB    '/B',0
 23158                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 23159                                  
 23160                                  ;**** Match_Flags
 23161                                  
 23162                                  _$P_Num_Val	   equ	8000h		;AN000; Numeric Value
 23163                                  _$P_SNum_Val	   equ	4000h		;AN000; Signed numeric value
 23164                                  _$P_Simple_S	   equ	2000h		;AN000; Simple string
 23165                                  _$P_Date_S	   equ	1000h		;AN000; Date string
 23166                                  _$P_Time_S	   equ	0800h		;AN000; Time string
 23167                                  _$P_Cmpx_S	   equ	0400h		;AN000; Complex string
 23168                                  _$P_File_Spc	   equ	0200h		;AN000; File Spec
 23169                                  _$P_Drv_Only	   equ	0100h		;AN000; Drive Only
 23170                                  _$P_Qu_String	   equ	0080h		;AN000; Quoted string
 23171                                  _$P_Ig_Colon	   equ	0010h		;AN000; Ignore colon at end in match
 23172                                  _$P_Repeat	   equ	0002h		;AN000; Repeat allowed
 23173                                  _$P_Optional	   equ	0001h		;AN000; Optional
 23174                                  
 23175                                  ;**** Function flags
 23176                                  
 23177                                  _$P_CAP_File	   equ	0001h		;AN000; CAP result by file table
 23178                                  _$P_CAP_Char	   equ	0002h		;AN000; CAP result by character table
 23179                                  _$P_Rm_Colon	   equ	0010h		;AN000; Remove ":" at the end
 23180                                  _$P_colon_is_not_necessary equ 0020h	;AN000;(tm10) /+10 and /+:10
 23181                                  
 23182                                  ;-------------------------------- Control block structure
 23183                                  struc _$P_Control_Blk
 23184 00000000 ????                     .Match_Flag:	 resw 1		;AN000; Controls type matched
 23185 00000002 ????                     .Function_Flag: resw 1		;AN000; Function should be taken
 23186 00000004 ????                     .Result_Buf:	 resw 1		; Result buffer address
 23187 00000006 ????                     .Value_List:	 resw 1		;AN000; Value list address
 23188 00000008 ??                       .nid:		 resb 1		;AN000; # of keyword/SW synonyms
 23189 00000009 ??                       .KEYorSW:	 resb 1		;AN000; keyword or sw
 23190                                  endstruc
 23191                                  
 23192                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 23193                                  ; << Value List Definition >>
 23194                                  ;
 23195                                  ;VALUES 	LABEL	BYTE
 23196                                  ;		DB	nval			; NUMBER OF VALUE DEFINITIONS (0 - 3)
 23197                                  ;	     +-
 23198                                  ;	     |	DB	nrng			; NUMBER OF RANGES
 23199                                  ;	     | +DB	ITEM_TAG		; RETURN VALUE IF RANGE MATCHED
 23200                                  ;	     | +DD	X,Y			; RANGE OF VALUES
 23201                                  ;	     |	:
 23202                                  ;	     |	DB	nnval			; NUMBER OF CHOICES
 23203                                  ;	     | +DB	ITEM_TAG		; RETURN VALUE IF NUMBER CHOICE MATCHED
 23204                                  ;	     | +DD	VALUE			; SPECIFIC CHOICE IF NUMBER
 23205                                  ;	     |	:
 23206                                  ;	     |	DB	nstrval 		; NUMBER OF CHOICES
 23207                                  ;	     | +DB	ITEM_TAG		; RETURN VALUE IF STRING CHOICE MATCHED
 23208                                  ;	     | +DW	STRING			; SPECIFIC CHOICE IF STING
 23209                                  ;	     +-	:
 23210                                  ;
 23211                                  ;STRING 	DB	"...",0                 ; ASCIIZ STRING IMAGE
 23212                                  ;
 23213                                  ;Note:
 23214                                  ;    - ITEM_TAG must not be 0FFH, which will be used in the result buffer
 23215                                  ;      when no choice lists are provided.
 23216                                  ;
 23217                                  ;    - STRING must consist of upper case characters only because the parser
 23218                                  ;      performs pattern matching after converting input to upper case (by
 23219                                  ;      using the current country upper case table)
 23220                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 23221                                  
 23222                                  _$P_nval_None	   equ	0		;AN000; no value list ID
 23223                                  _$P_nval_Range	   equ	1		;AN000; range list ID
 23224                                  _$P_nval_Value	   equ	2		;AN000; value list ID
 23225                                  _$P_nval_String	   equ	3		;AN000; string list ID
 23226                                  _$P_Len_Range	   equ	9		;AN000; Length of a range choice(two DD plus one DB)
 23227                                  _$P_Len_Value	   equ	5		;AN000; Length of a value choice(one DD plus one DB)
 23228                                  _$P_Len_String	   equ	3		;AN000; Length of a string choice(one DW plus one DB)
 23229                                  _$P_No_nrng	   equ	0		;AN000; (tm07) no nrng. nnval must not be 0.
 23230                                  
 23231                                  struc _$P_Val_List
 23232 00000000 ??                       .NumofList: resb 1			;AN000; number of following choice
 23233 00000001 ????                     .Val_XL:    resw 1			;AN000; lower word of value
 23234 00000003 ????                     .Val_XH:    resw 1			;AN000; higher word of value
 23235 00000005 ????                     .Val_YL:    resw 1			;AN000; lower word of another value
 23236 00000007 ????                     .Val_YH:    resw 1			;AN000; higher word of another value
 23237                                  endstruc
 23238                                  
 23239                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 23240                                  ; << Result Buffer Definition  >>
 23241                                  ;
 23242                                  ;RESULT 	LABEL	BYTE			; BELOW FILLED IN FOR DEFAULTS
 23243                                  ;		DB	type			; TYPE RETURNED: 0=RESERVED,
 23244                                  ;						;	1=NUMBER, 2=LIST INDEX,
 23245                                  ;						;	3=STRING, 4=COMPLEX,
 23246                                  ;						;	5=FILESPEC, 6=DRIVE
 23247                                  ;						;	7=DATE, 8=TIME
 23248                                  ;						;	9=QUOTED STRING
 23249                                  ;		DB	ITEM_TAG		; MATCHED ITEM TAG
 23250                                  ;
 23251                                  ;		dw	synonym@		; es:@ points to found SYNONYM if provided.
 23252                                  ;
 23253                                  ;            +-
 23254                                  ;	    | DD	n			; VALUE IF NUMBER
 23255                                  ;	    | or
 23256                                  ;	    |	DW	i			; INDEX (OFFSET) INTO VALUE LIST
 23257                                  ;	    |					; (ES presents Segment address)
 23258                                  ;	    | or
 23259                                  ;	    |	DD	STRING			; OFFSET OF STRING VALUE
 23260                                  ;	    | or
 23261                                  ;	    |	DB	drv			; DRIVE NUMBER (1-A, 2-B,..., 26-Z)
 23262                                  ;	    | or
 23263                                  ;	    |	DW	YEAR	   ;(1980-2099)  IN CASE OF DATE
 23264                                  ;	    |	DB	MONTH	   ;(1-12)	 Note: Range check is not performed.
 23265                                  ;	    |	DB	DATE	   ;(1-31)	       0 is filled when the corresponding field was not specified.
 23266                                  ;	    | or
 23267                                  ;	    |	DB	HOUR	   ;(0-23)	  IN CASE OF TIME
 23268                                  ;	    |	DB	MINUTES    ;(0-59)	  Note: Range check is not performed .
 23269                                  ;	    |	DB	SECONDS    ;(0-59)		0 is filled when the corresponding field was not specified .
 23270                                  ;	    |	DB	HUNDREDTHS ;(0-99)
 23271                                  ;	    +-
 23272                                  ;
 23273                                  ;
 23274                                  ;Note: ITEM_TAG is 0FFH when the caller does not specify the choice
 23275                                  ;      list.
 23276                                  ;
 23277                                  ;      YEAR: If the input value for the year is less than 100, parser
 23278                                  ;	     adds 1900 to it.  For example, when 87 is input to parser for
 23279                                  ;	     the year value, he returns 1987.
 23280                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 23281

 23286 00000002 ????                     .SYNONYM_Ptr: resw 1		;AN000; pointer to Synonym list returned
 23287 00000004 ????????                 .Picked_Val:  resb 4		;AN000; value
 23288                                  endstruc

 23401                                  ; PARSE.ASM - MSDOS 6.0 - 1991
 23402                                  ; ======================================================================
 23403                                  ; 27/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 23404                                  
 23405                                  ;***********************************************************************
 23406                                  ; SysParse;
 23407                                  ;
 23408                                  ;  Function : Parser Entry
 23409                                  ;
 23410                                  ;  Input: DS:SI -> command line
 23411                                  ;	  ES:DI -> parameter block
 23412                                  ;	  cs -> psdata.inc
 23413                                  ;	  CX = operand ordinal
 23414                                  ;
 23415                                  ;	  Note:  ES is the segment containing all the control blocks defined
 23416                                  ;		 by the caller, except for the DOS COMMAND line parms, which
 23417                                  ;		 is in DS.
 23418                                  ;
 23419                                  ;  Output: CY = 1   error of caller, means invalid parameter block or
 23420                                  ;		    invalid value list. But this parser does NOT implement
 23421                                  ;		    this feature. Therefore CY always zero.
 23422                                  ;
 23423                                  ;	   CY = 0   AX = return code
 23424                                  ;		    BL = terminated delimiter code
 23425                                  ;		    CX = new operand ordinal
 23426                                  ;		    SI = set past scaned operand
 23427                                  ;		    DX = selected result buffer
 23428                                  ;
 23429                                  ; Use:	_$P_Skip_Delim, _$P_Chk_EOL, _$P_Chk_Delim, _$P_Chk_DBCS
 23430                                  ;	_$P_Chk_Swtch, _$P_Chk_Pos_Control, _$P_Chk_Key_Control
 23431                                  ;	_$P_Chk_Sw_Control, _$P_Fill_Result
 23432                                  ;
 23433                                  ; Vars: _$P_Ordinal(RW), _$P_RC(RW), _$P_SI_Save(RW), _$P_DX(R), _$P_Terminator(R)
 23434                                  ;	_$P_SaveSI_Cmpx(W), _$P_Flags(RW), _$P_Found_SYNONYM(R), _$P_Save_EOB(W)
 23435                                  ;
 23436                                  ;-------- Modification History -----------------------------------------
 23437                                  ;
 23438                                  ;  4/04/87 : Created by K. K,
 23439                                  ;  4/28/87 : _$P_Val_YH assemble error (tm01)
 23440                                  ;	   : JMP SHORT assemble error (tm02)
 23441                                  ;  5/14/87 : Someone doesn't want to include psdata (tm03)
 23442                                  ;  6/12/87 : _$P_Bridge is missing when TimeSw equ 0 and (CmpxSw equ 1 or
 23443                                  ;	     DateSW equ 1)	      (tm04)
 23444                                  ;  6/12/87 : _$P_SorD_Quote is missing when QusSw equ 0 and CmpxSW equ 1
 23445                                  ;				      (tm05) in PSDATA.INC
 23446                                  ;  6/12/87 : _$P_FileSp_Char and _$P_FileSP_Len are missing
 23447                                  ;	     when FileSW equ 0 and DrvSW equ 1 (tm06) in PSDATA.INC
 23448                                  ;  6/18/87 : $VAL1 and $VAL3, $VAL2 and $VAL3 can be used in the same
 23449                                  ;	     value-list block	      (tm07)
 23450                                  ;  6/20/87 : Add _$P_SW to check if there's an omiting parameter after
 23451                                  ;	     switch (keyword) or not. If there is, backup si for next call
 23452                                  ;	     (tm08)
 23453                                  ;  6/24/87 : Complex Item checking does not work correctly when CmpSW equ 1
 23454                                  ;	     and DateSW equ 0 and TimeSW equ 0 (tm09)
 23455                                  ;  6/24/87 : New function flag _$P_colon_is_not_necessary for switch
 23456                                  ;	     /+15 and /+:15 are allowed for user (tm10)
 23457                                  ;  6/29/87 : ECS call changes DS register but it causes the address problem
 23458                                  ;	     in user's routines. _$P_Chk_DBCS (tm11)
 23459                                  ;  7/10/87 : Switch with no_match flag (0x0000H) does not work correctly
 23460                                  ;					  (tm12)
 23461                                  ;  7/10/87 : Invalid switch/keyword does not work correctly
 23462                                  ;					  (tm13)
 23463                                  ;  7/10/87 : Drive_only breaks 3 bytes after the result buffer
 23464                                  ;					  (tm14)
 23465                                  ;  7/12/87 : Too_Many_Operands sets DX=0 as the PARSE result
 23466                                  ;					  (tm15)
 23467                                  ;  7/24/87 : Negative lower bound on numeric ranges cause trouble
 23468                                  
 23469                                  ;  7/24/87 : Quoted strings being returned with quotes.
 23470                                  
 23471                                  ;  7/28/87 : Kerry S (;AN018;)
 23472                                  ;	     Non optional value on switch (match flags<>0 and <>1) not flagged
 23473                                  ;	     as an error when missing.	Solution: return error 2.  Modules
 23474                                  ;	     affected: _$P_Chk_SW_Control.
 23475                                  
 23476                                  ;  7/29/87 : Kerry S (;AN019;)
 23477                                  ;	     Now allow the optional bit in match flags for switches.  This
 23478                                  ;	     allows the switch to be encountered with a value or without a
 23479                                  ;	     value and no error is returned.
 23480                                  ;
 23481                                  
 23482                                  ;  8/28/87 : Ed K, Kerry S (;AN020;)
 23483                                  ;  9/14/87   In PROC _$P_Get_DecNum, when checking for field separators
 23484                                  ;	     within a date response, instead of checking just for the one
 23485                                  ;	     character defined by the COUNTRY DEPENDENT INFO, check for
 23486                                  ;	     all three chars, "-", "/", and ".". Change _$P_Chk_Switch to allow
 23487                                  ;	     slashes in date strings when DateSw (assembler switch) is set.
 23488                                  
 23489                                  ;  9/1/87  : Kerry S (;AN021)
 23490                                  ;	     In PROC _$P_String_Comp, when comparing the switch or keyword on
 23491                                  ;	     the command line with the string in the control block the
 23492                                  ;	     comparing was stopping at a colon (switch) or equal (keyword)
 23493                                  ;	     on the command line and assuming a match.	This allowed a shorter
 23494                                  ;	     string on the command line than in the synonym list in the control
 23495                                  ;	     block.  I put in a test for a null in the control block so the
 23496                                  ;	     string in the control block must be the same length as the string
 23497                                  ;	     preceeding the colon or equal on the command line.
 23498                                  
 23499                                  ;  8/28/87 : Kerry S (;AN022;)
 23500                                  ;	     All references to data in PSDATA.INC had CS overrides.  This caused
 23501                                  ;	     problems for people who included it themselves in a segment other
 23502                                  ;	     than CS.  Added switch to allow including PSDATA.INC in any
 23503                                  ;	     segment.
 23504                                  
 23505                                  ;  9/16/87 : Ed K (;AN023;) PTM1040
 23506                                  ;	     in _$P_set_cdi PROC, it assumes CS points to psdata. Change Push CS
 23507                                  ;	     into PUSH cs.  In _$P_Get_DecNum PROC, fix AN020
 23508                                  ;	     forced both TIME and DATE to use the delims, "-","/",".".
 23509                                  ;	     Created FLag, in _$P_time_Format PROC, to request the delim in
 23510                                  ;	     BL be used if TIME is being parsed.
 23511                                  
 23512                                  ;  9/24/87 : Ed K
 23513                                  ;	     Removed the include to STRUC.INC.	Replaced the STRUC macro
 23514                                  ;	     invocations with their normally expanded code; made comments
 23515                                  ;	     out of the STRUC macro invocation statements to maintain readability.
 23516                                  
 23517                                  ;  9/24/87 : Ed K (;AN024;) PTM1222
 23518                                  ;	     When no CONTROL for a keyword found, tried to fill in RESULT
 23519                                  ;	     pointed to by non-existant CONTROL.
 23520                                  
 23521                                  ; 10/15/87 : Ed K (;AN025;) PTM1672
 23522                                  ;	     A quoted text string can be framed only by double quote.  Remove
 23523                                  ;	     support to frame quoted text string with single quote.
 23524                                  ;	     (apostrophe) _$P_SorD_Quote is removed from PSDATA.INC.
 23525                                  ;	     _$P_SQuote EQU also removed from PSDATA.INC.  Any references to
 23526                                  ;	     single quote in PROC prologues are left as is for history reasons.
 23527                                  
 23528                                  ;	     This fixes another bug, not mentioned in p1672, in that two
 23529                                  ;	     quote chars within a quoted string is supposed to be reported as
 23530                                  ;	     one quote character, but is reported as two quotes.  This changed
 23531                                  ;	     two instructions in PROC _$P_Quoted_Str.
 23532                                  
 23533                                  ;	     Also fixed are several JMP that caused a NOP, these changed to
 23534                                  ;	     have the SHORT operator to avoid the unneeded NOP.
 23535                                  
 23536                                  ;	     The code and PSDATA.INC have been aligned for ease of reading.
 23537                                  
 23538                                  ; 10/26/87 : Ed K (;AN026;) PTM2041, DATE within SWITCH, BX reference to
 23539                                  ;	     psdata buffer should have cs.
 23540                                  
 23541                                  ; 10/27/87 : Ed K (;AN027;) PTM2042 comma between keywords implies
 23542                                  ;	     positional missing.
 23543                                  
 23544                                  ; 11/06/87 : Ed K (;AN028;) PTM 2315 Parser should not use line feed
 23545                                  ;	     as a line delimiter, should use carriage return.

 23876                                  ; _$P_Chk_Pos_Control
 23877                                  ;
 23878                                  ; Function: Parse CONTROL block for a positional
 23879                                  ;
 23880                                  ; Input:     ES:BX -> CONTROL block

 23882                                  ;
 23883                                  ; Output:    None
 23884                                  ;
 23885                                  ; Use:	 _$P_Fill_Result, _$P_Check_Match_Flags
 23886                                  ;

 23888                                  ;***********************************************************************

 24102                                  ;***********************************************************************
 24103                                  ; _$P_Fill_Result
 24104                                  ;
 24105                                  ; Function: Fill the result buffer
 24106                                  ;
 24107                                  ; Input:    AH = Item tag
 24108                                  ;	    AL = type
 24109                                  ;		  AL = 1: CX,DX has 32bit number (CX = high)
 24110                                  ;		  AL = 2: DX has index(offset) into value list
 24111                                  ;		  AL = 6: DL has driver # (1-A, 2-B, ... , 26 - Z)
 24112                                  ;		  AL = 7: DX has year, CL has month and CH has date
 24113                                  ;		  AL = 8: DL has hours, DH has minutes, CL has seconds,
 24114                                  ;			  amd CH has hundredths
 24115                                  ;		  AL = else: cs:SI points to returned string buffer
 24116                                  ;	    ES:BX -> CONTROL block
 24117                                  ;
 24118                                  ; Output:   None
 24119                                  ;
 24120                                  ; Use:	_$P_Do_CAPS_String, _$P_Remove_Colon, _$P_Found_SYNONYM
 24121                                  ;
 24122                                  ; Vars: _$P_DX(W)
 24123                                  ;***********************************************************************
 24124                                  
 24125                                  _$P_Fill_Result:
 24126 00001781 57                      	push	di			;AN000;

 24135

 24139                                  					;AN000;   then set it to the result

 24517                                  ;***********************************************************************
 24518                                  ; _$P_Value / _$P_SValue
 24519                                  ;
 24520                                  ; Function:  Make 32bit value from cs:SI and see value list
 24521                                  ;	     and make result buffer.
 24522                                  ;	     _$P_SValue is an entry point for the signed value
 24523                                  ;	     and this will simply call _$P_Value after the handling
 24524                                  ;	     of the sign character, "+" or "-"
 24525                                  ;
 24526                                  ; Input:     cs:SI -> _$P_STRING_BUF
 24527                                  ;	     ES:BX -> CONTROL block
 24528                                  ;
 24529                                  ; Output:    None
 24530                                  ;
 24531                                  ; Use:	_$P_Fill_Result, _$P_Check_OVF
 24532                                  ;
 24533                                  ; Vars: _$P_RC(W), _$P_Flags(RW)
 24534                                  ;***********************************************************************
 24535                                  
 24536                                  	; 26/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0
 24537                                  	; (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:1B0Bh)
 24538                                  
 24539                                  	; 07/07/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 IO.SYS (optimization)
 24540                                  	; (MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:1C46h)  	
 24541                                  _$P_SValue:				;AN000; when signed value here
 24542 00001930 50                      	push	ax			;AN000;
 24543 00001931 2E800E[D714]80          	or	byte [cs:_$P_Flags2],_$P_Signed ;AC034; indicate a signed numeric
 24544 00001937 2E8026[D714]FD          	and	byte [cs:_$P_Flags2],0FFh-_$P_Neg ;AC034; assume positive value
 24545                                  	;and	byte [cs:_$P_Flags2],~_$P_Neg ; 07/07/2023 
 24546 0000193D 2E8A04                  	mov	al,[cs:si]		;AN000; get sign
 24547 00001940 3C2B                    	cmp	al,_$P_Plus		;AN000; "+" ?
 24548 00001942 740A                    	je	short _$P_SVal00	;AN000;
 24549                                  
 24550 00001944 3C2D                    	cmp	al,_$P_Minus		;AN000; "-" ?
 24551 00001946 7507                    	jne	short _$P_Sval01	;AN000; else
 24552                                  
 24553 00001948 2E800E[D714]02          	or	byte [cs:_$P_Flags2],_$P_Neg ;AC034; set this is negative value
 24554                                  _$P_SVal00:				;AN000;
 24555 0000194E 46                      	inc	si			;AN000; skip sign char
 24556                                  _$P_Sval01:				;AN000;
 24557 0000194F E80200                  	call	_$P_Value		;AN000; and process value
 24558 00001952 58                      	pop	ax			;AN000;
 24559 00001953 C3                      	retn
 24560                                  
 24561                                  ;***********************************************************************
 24562                                  
 24563                                  	; 07/07/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 IO.SYS (optimization)
 24564                                  	; (MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:1C6Ah)
 24565                                  
 24566                                  	; 26/10/2022
 24567                                  _$P_Value:				;AN000;
 24568 00001954 50                      	push	ax			;AN000;
 24569 00001955 51                      	push	cx			;AN000;
 24570 00001956 52                      	push	dx			;AN000;
 24571 00001957 56                      	push	si			;AN000;
 24572 00001958 31C9                    	xor	cx,cx			;AN000; cx = higher 16 bits
 24573 0000195A 31D2                    	xor	dx,dx			;AN000; dx = lower 16 bits
 24574 0000195C 53                      	push	bx			;AN000; save control pointer
 24575                                  _$P_Value_Loop:				;AN000;
 24576 0000195D 2E8A04                  	mov	al,[cs:si]		;AN000; get character
 24577 00001960 08C0                    	or	al,al			;AN000; end of line ?

 24579

 24581 00001967 7233                    	jc	short _$P_Value_Err0	;AN000;
 24582                                  
 24583 00001969 30E4                    	xor	ah,ah			;AN000;
 24584 0000196B 89C5                    	mov	bp,ax			;AN000; save binary number
 24585                                  
 24586                                  ; 08/07/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 IO.SYS (optimization)
 24587                                  ; Ref: Disassembled PCDOS 7.1 IBMBIO.COM SYSINIT code
 24588                                  ;				Erdogan Tan - July 2023 
 24589                                  %if 0
 24590                                  	shl	dx,1			;AN000; to have 2*x
 24591                                  	rcl	cx,1			;AN000; shift left w/ carry
 24592                                  	call	_$P_Check_OVF		;AN000; Overflow occurred ?
 24593                                  	jc	short _$P_Value_Err0	;AN000; then error, exit
 24594                                  
 24595                                  	mov	bx,dx			;AN000; save low(2*x)
 24596                                  	mov	ax,cx			;AN000; save high(2*x)
 24597                                  	shl	dx,1			;AN000; to have 4*x
 24598                                  	rcl	cx,1			;AN000; shift left w/ carry
 24599                                  	call	_$P_Check_OVF		;AN000; Overflow occurred ?
 24600                                  	jc	short _$P_Value_Err0	;AN000; then error, exit
 24601                                  
 24602                                  	shl	dx,1			;AN000; to have 8*x
 24603                                  	rcl	cx,1			;AN000; shift left w/ carry
 24604                                  	call	_$P_Check_OVF		;AN000; Overflow occurred ?
 24605                                  	jc	short _$P_Value_Err0	;AN000; then error, exit
 24606                                  
 24607                                  	add	dx,bx			;AN000; now have 10*x
 24608                                  	adc	cx,ax			;AN000; 32bit ADD
 24609                                  	call	_$P_Check_OVF		;AN000; Overflow occurred ?
 24610                                  	jc	short _$P_Value_Err0	;AN000; then error, exit
 24611                                  
 24612                                  	add	dx,bp			;AN000; Add the current one degree decimal
 24613                                  	adc	cx,0			;AN000; if carry, add 1 to high 16bit
 24614                                  	call	_$P_Check_OVF		;AN000; Overflow occurred ?
 24615                                  	jc	short _$P_Value_Err0	;AN000; then error, exit
 24616                                  
 24617                                  	inc	si			;AN000; update pointer
 24618                                  	jmp	short _$P_Value_Loop	;AN000; loop until NULL encountered
 24619                                  ;_$P_Value_Err0:
 24620                                  %endif
 24621                                  ;****
 24622                                  %if 1
 24623                                  ; 08/07/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 IO.SYS (optimization)
 24624                                  	; (PCDOS 7.1 IBMBIO.COM - SYSINIT:2130h)
 24625                                  
 24626 0000196D 30E4                    	xor	ah,ah
 24627 0000196F 89C5                    	mov	bp,ax			; save binary number
 24628 00001971 E81C00                  	call	_$P_Value_2x_OVF 	; multiply cx:dx by 2 and then check overflow

 24630 00001976 89C8                    	mov	ax,cx
 24631 00001978 E81500                  	call	_$P_Value_2x_OVF 	; multiply cx:dx by 2 and then check overflow
 24632 0000197B E81200                  	call	_$P_Value_2x_OVF 	; multiply cx:dx by 2 and then check overflow
 24633 0000197E 01DA                    	add	dx,bx			; 8*(cx:dx)+2*(cx:dx) = 10*(cx:dx)
 24634 00001980 11C1                    	adc	cx,ax
 24635 00001982 E80F00                  	call	_$P_Value_Chk_Add_OVF
 24636 00001985 01EA                    	add	dx,bp			; Add the current one degree decimal
 24637                                  					; if carry, add 1 to high 16bit
 24638 00001987 83D100                  	adc	cx,0
 24639 0000198A E80700                  	call	_$P_Value_Chk_Add_OVF	; Overflow occurred ?
 24640                                  					; then error, exit (without return here)

 24642 0000198E EBCD                    	jmp	short _$P_Value_Loop
 24643                                  
 24644                                  _$P_Value_2x_OVF:

 24647                                  _$P_Value_Chk_Add_OVF:
 24648 00001994 E89E00                  	call	_$P_Check_OVF		; check overflow (for the last shift or add)
 24649 00001997 7201                    	jc	short _$P_Value_OVF

 24838

 24840 00001A3F C3                      	retn				;AN000;
 24841

 24871

 24879                                  	retn				;AN000;
 24880

 25471                                  ;***********************************************************************
 25472                                  ; _$P_Chk_Delim;
 25473                                  ;
 25474                                  ; Function: Check if AL is one of delimiter characters.
 25475                                  ;	    if AL+[si] is DBCS blank, it is replaced with two SBCS
 25476                                  ;	    blanks.
 25477                                  ;
 25478                                  ; Input:    AL = character code
 25479                                  ;	    DS:SI -> Next Character
 25480                                  ;	    ES:DI -> Parameter List
 25481                                  ;
 25482                                  ; Output:   ZF = 1 if one of delimiter characters
 25483                                  ;	    SI points to the next character
 25484                                  ; Vars:  _$P_Terminator(W), _$P_Flags(W)
 25485                                  ;***********************************************************************
 25486                                   
 25487                                  	; 08/07/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 IO.SYS (optimization)
 25488                                  	; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:1FAEh
 25489                                  	; (PCDOS 7.1 IBMBIO.COM - SYSINIT:2451h) ; (Retro DOS v5.0)
 25490                                  
 25491                                  _$P_Chk_Delim:
 25492 00001C76 53                      	push	bx			;AN000;
 25493 00001C77 51                      	push	cx			;AN000;
 25494 00001C78 2EC606[D114]20          	mov	byte [cs:_$P_Terminator],_$P_Space 
 25495                                  					;AC034; Assume terminated by space
 25496                                  	;and	byte [cs:_$P_Flags20,0DFh
 25497 00001C7E 2E8026[D714]DF          	and	byte [cs:_$P_Flags2],0FFh-_$P_Extra ;AC034;
 25498 00001C84 3C20                    	cmp	al,_$P_Space ; 20h	;AN000; Space ?
 25499 00001C86 7423                    	je	short _$P_Chk_Delim_Exit ;AN000;
 25500                                  
 25501 00001C88 3C09                    	cmp	al,_$P_TAB		;AN000; TAB ?
 25502 00001C8A 741F                    	je	short _$P_Chk_Delim_Exit ;AN000;
 25503                                  
 25504 00001C8C 3C2C                    	cmp	al,_$P_Comma		;AN000; Comma ?
 25505 00001C8E 741E                    	je	short _$P_Chk_Delim_Exit0 ;AN000;
 25506                                  
 25507                                  ; Note: _$P_Chk_Delim00 part of code is nonsense here
 25508                                  ;        because _$P_Space = _$P_DBSP1 = 20h
 25509                                  ;        Erdogan Tan - 08/07/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 IO.SYS (optimization)
 25510                                  ;_$P_Chk_Delim00:
 25511                                  	; (PCDOS 7.1 IBMBIO.COM - SYSINIT:246Bh)
 25512                                  	; (MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:1FC8h)
 25513                                  %if 0
 25514                                  	; 26/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 25515                                  _$P_Chk_Delim00: 			;AN000;
 25516                                  	cmp	al,_$P_DBSP1	; 20h	;AN000; 1st byte of DBCS Space ?
 25517                                  	jne	short _$P_Chk_Delim01	;AN000;
 25518                                  
 25519                                  	cmp	byte [si],_$P_DBSP2 ; 20h ;AN000; 2nd byte of DBCS Space ?
 25520                                  	jne	short _$P_Chk_Delim01	;AN000;
 25521                                  
 25522                                  	mov	al,_$P_Space		;AN000;
 25523                                  	inc	si			;AN000; make si point to next character
 25524                                  	cmp	al,al			;AN000; Set ZF
 25525                                  	jmp	short _$P_Chk_Delim_Exit ;AN000;
 25526                                  %endif
 25527                                  
 25528                                  _$P_Chk_Delim01: 			;AN000;
 25529 00001C90 26807DFE01              	cmp	byte [es:di-_$P_PARMS_Blk.Num_Extra],_$P_I_Have_Delim 
 25530                                  					;AN000; delimiter character specified ?
 25531 00001C95 7214                    	jb	short _$P_Chk_Delim_Exit ;AN000;
 25532                                  
 25533                                  	;xor	cx,cx			;AN000;
 25534 00001C97 30ED                    	xor	ch,ch
 25535                                  	;mov	cl,[es:di+3]
 25536 00001C99 268A4D03                	mov	cl,[es:di+_$P_PARMS_Blk.Len_Extra_Delim] 
 25537                                  					;AN000; get length of delimiter list
 25538                                  	;or	cx,cx			;AN000; No extra Delim character ?
 25539                                  	;jz	short _$P_Chk_Delim_NZ 	;AN000;
 25540                                  	; 08/07/2023
 25541 00001C9D E30B                    	jcxz	_$P_Chk_Delim_NZ
 25542                                  
 25543 00001C9F BB0300                  	mov	bx,_$P_Len_PARMS-1 ; 3	;AN000; set bx to 1st extra delimiter
 25544                                  _$P_Chk_Delim_Loop:			;AN000;
 25545 00001CA2 43                      	inc	bx			;AN000;
 25546 00001CA3 263A01                  	cmp	al,[es:bx+di]		;AN000; Check extra Delim character
 25547 00001CA6 7406                    	je	short _$P_Chk_Delim_Exit0 ;AN000;
 25548                                  
 25549 00001CA8 E2F8                    	loop	_$P_Chk_Delim_Loop	;AN000; examine all extra delimiter
 25550                                  
 25551                                  _$P_Chk_Delim_NZ:			;AN000;
 25552                                  	;cmp	al,_$P_Space		;AN000; reset ZF
 25553                                  	; 08/07/2023
 25554                                  	; cx=0 here
 25555 00001CAA 41                      	inc	cx ; cx=1, zf=0
 25556                                  _$P_Chk_Delim_Exit:			;AN000;
 25557                                  _$P_ChkDfin:				;AN000;
 25558 00001CAB 59                      	pop	cx			;AN000;
 25559 00001CAC 5B                      	pop	bx			;AN000;
 25560 00001CAD C3                      	retn				;AN000;
 25561                                  
 25562                                  _$P_Chk_Delim_Exit0:			;AN000;
 25563 00001CAE 2EA2[D114]              	mov	[cs:_$P_Terminator],al ;AC034; keep terminated delimiter
 25564 00001CB2 2EF606[D714]01          	test	byte [cs:_$P_Flags2],_$P_equ ;AN027;AC034;; if terminating a key=
 25565 00001CB8 7506                    	jnz	short _$P_No_Set_Extra 	;AN027; then do not set the EXTRA bit
 25566                                  
 25567 00001CBA 2E800E[D714]20          	or	byte [cs:_$P_Flags2],_$P_Extra 
 25568                                  					;AC034; flag terminated extra delimiter or comma
 25569                                  _$P_No_Set_Extra:			;AN027;
 25570 00001CC0 38C0                    	cmp	al,al			;AN000; set ZF
 25571 00001CC2 EBE7                    	jmp	short _$P_Chk_Delim_Exit ;AN000;

 25573                                  ;***********************************************************************
 25574                                  ; _$P_Chk_Switch;
 25575                                  ;
 25576                                  ; Function: Check if AL is the switch character not in first position of
 25577                                  ;	    _$P_STRING_BUF
 25578                                  ;
 25579                                  ; Input:    AL = character code
 25580                                  ;	    BX = current pointer within _$P_String_Buf
 25581                                  ;	    SI =>next char on command line (following the one in AL)
 25582                                  ;
 25583                                  ; Output:   CF = 1 (set) if AL is switch character, and not in first
 25584                                  ;		 position, and has no chance of being part of a date string,
 25585                                  ;		 i.e. should be treated as a delimiter.
 25586                                  
 25587                                  ;	    CF = 0 (reset, cleared) if AL is not a switch char, is in the first
 25588                                  ;		 position, or is a slash but may be part of a date string, i.e.
 25589                                  ;		 should not be treated as a delimiter.
 25590                                  ;
 25591                                  ; Vars:  _$P_Terminator(W)
 25592                                  
 25593                                  ; Use:	 _$P_0099
 25594                                  ;***********************************************************************
 25595                                  
 25596                                  _$P_Chk_Switch:
 25597                                  	;;lea	bp,[cs:_$P_STRING_BUF]	;AN020;AC034
 25598                                  	;lea	bp,[_$P_STRING_BUF]	;BP=OFFSET of _$P_String_Buf even in group addressing
 25599                                  	; 08/07/2023
 25600 00001CC4 BD[E014]                	mov	bp,_$P_STRING_BUF
 25601                                  
 25602                                  ;	.IF <BX NE BP> THEN		;AN020;IF not first char THEN
 25603 00001CC7 39EB                    	cmp	bx,bp			;AN000;
 25604 00001CC9 7406                    	je	short _$P_STRUC_L2	;AN000;
 25605                                  
 25606                                  ;	.IF <AL EQ _$P_Switch> THEN	;AN020;otherwise see if a slash
 25607 00001CCB 3C2F                    	cmp	al,_$P_Switch		;AN000;
 25608 00001CCD 750C                    	jne	short _$P_STRUC_L5 	;AN000;
 25609                                  
 25610 00001CCF F9                      	stc				;AN020;not in first position and is slash
 25611                                  	;jmp     short _$P_STRUC_L1	;AN000;
 25612                                  	; 12/12/2022
 25613 00001CD0 C3                      	retn
 25614                                  
 25615                                  ; 12/12/2022
 25616                                  ;_$P_STRUC_L5:				;AN000;
 25617                                  ;	CLC				;AN020;not a slash
 25618                                  ;;	    .ENDIF			;AN020;
 25619                                  ;;	.ELSE				;AN020;is first char in the buffer, ZF=0
 25620                                  ;	jmp	short _$P_STRUC_L1	;AN000;
 25621                                  
 25622                                  _$P_STRUC_L2:				;AN000;
 25623                                  ;	.IF <AL EQ _$P_Switch> THEN	;AN020;
 25624 00001CD1 3C2F                    	cmp     al,_$P_Switch		;AN000;
 25625 00001CD3 7506                    	jne	short _$P_STRUC_L12	;AN000;
 25626                                  
 25627 00001CD5 2E800E[D714]40          	or	byte [cs:_$P_Flags2],_$P_SW ;AN020 ;AC034;;could be valid switch, first char and is slash
 25628                                  ;	.ENDIF				;AN020;
 25629                                  
 25630                                  	; 12/12/2022
 25631                                  	; cf=0
 25632                                  	;retn
 25633                                  
 25634                                  _$P_STRUC_L5:
 25635                                  	; 12/12/2022
 25636                                  _$P_STRUC_L12:				;AN000;
 25637 00001CDB F8                      	clc				;AN020;CF=0 indicating first char
 25638                                  ;	.ENDIF				;AN020;
 25639                                  _$P_STRUC_L1:				;AN000;
 25640 00001CDC C3                      	retn				;AN000;

 25681 00001CF7 8CDB                    	mov	bx,ds			;AN000; (tm11)

 26282                                  ;****************************************************************** RICHID ****
 26283                                  
 26284                                  ;include	highvar.inc	; devicehigh variables (used by loadhigh also)
 26285                                  
 26286                                  ; 30/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 26287                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 26288                                  
 26289                                  ;   Module:   HIGHVAR.INC - Data common to LOADHIGH and DEVICEHIGH, res seg
 26290                                  ;
 26291                                  ;   Date:     May 14, 1992
 26292                                  ;
 26293                                  ;******************************************************************************
 26294                                  ;
 26295                                  ;   Modification log:
 26296                                  ;
 26297                                  ;     DATE    WHO      DESCRIPTION
 26298                                  ;   --------  -------  --------------------------------------------------------
 26299                                  ;   05/14/92  t-richj  Original
 26300                                  ;   06/21/92  t-richj  Final revisions before check-in
 26301                                  ;
 26302                                  ;******************************************************************************
 26303                                  ;
 26304                                  ; There are two primary definitions which need to be made, selectively, before
 26305                                  ; this include file should be used.  These are:
 26306                                  ;    HV_Extern - If this has been defined, variables for this module will be
 26307                                  ;                declared as external.  Otherwise, variables will be declared
 26308                                  ;                public, as well as defined, here.  LoadHigh declares HV_Extern
 26309                                  ;                in stub.asm and loadhi.asm, and does not declare it in
 26310                                  ;                rdata.asm... DeviceHigh does not declare HV_Extern anywhere
 26311                                  ;                (as only one module, sysconf.asm, includes this file).
 26312                                  ;    HV_LoadHigh - This should be defined when this module is going into
 26313                                  ;                  command.com, for LoadHigh.  All of loadhi.asm, stub.asm and
 26314                                  ;                  rdata.asm define this, while io.sys' sysconf.asm does not.
 26315                                  ;
 26316                                  ;******************************************************************************
 26317                                  
 26318                                  ; To keep track of which UMBs were specified on the DH/LH command lines, and
 26319                                  ; to keep track of the minimum sizes given for each, there're two arrays kept
 26320                                  ; in { IO.SYS: sysinitseg / COMMAND.COM: DATARES }... each is MAXUMB elements
 26321                                  ; big.  16 should be around 14 too many for most users, so there's no expected
 26322                                  ; space problem (it's just such a nice round number, eh?).
 26323                                  
 26324                                  MAXUMB	equ	16
 26325                                  
 26326                                  ; Memory elements owned by the system are marked as PSP address 8 in both the
 26327                                  ; USA and Japan; Japanese systems also use 9 under more bizzarre conditions.
 26328                                  
 26329                                  FreePSPOwner	equ	0	; Free MCBs all have an owner PSP address of 0
 26330                                  SystemPSPOwner	equ	8
 26331                                  ;JapanPSPOwner	equ	9
 26332                                  
 26333                                  ; for LoadHigh and DeviceHigh:
 26334                                  ;
 26335                                  ;	fInHigh - Is set to 1 during HideUMBs(), and back to zero in
 26336                                  ;	          UnHideUMBs().
 26337                                  ;	fUmbTiny - Is set to 1 if the user has specified /S on the command-
 26338                                  ;	           line.
 26339                                  ;	SegLoad - Segment address for first UMB specified; set automatically.
 26340                                  ;	UmbLoad - The load UMB number; for example, this is 3 if the user has
 26341                                  ;	          given a command-line like "/L:3,500;4"
 26342                                  ;	UmbUsed - An array of characters, each of which is 1 iff the UMB
 26343                                  ;	          matching its index number was specified on the command-line;
 26344                                  ;	          for example, after "/L:3,500;4;7", UmbUsed[3], [4] and [7]
 26345                                  ;	          will be set to 1. All others will be set to 0.
 26346                                  ;	UmbSize - An array of words, each of which is interpereted as a size
 26347                                  ;	          specified by the user for a UMB (in the above example, all
 26348                                  ;	          elements would be zero save UmbSize[3], which would be 500.
 26349                                  ;	fm_umb - Set to the old UMB link-state (0x80 or 0x00)
 26350                                  ;	fm_strat - Set to the old memory-allocation strategy (0$00000???)
 26351                                  ;	fm_argc  - Number of arguments received by ParseVar() (see ParseVar()
 26352                                  ;	           for details).
 26353                                  
 26354 00001F2B 00                      fInHigh:  db	0
 26355 00001F2C 00                      fUmbTiny: db	0
 26356 00001F2D 0000                    SegLoad:  dw	0
 26357 00001F2F 00                      UmbLoad:  db	0
 26358 00001F30 00<rep 10h>             UmbUsed:  times MAXUMB db 0 ; times 16 db 0  ; db 16 dup(?)
 26359 00001F40 0000<rep 10h>           UmbSize:  times MAXUMB dw 0 ; times 16 dw 0  ; dw 16 dup(?)
 26360 00001F60 00                      fm_umb:   db	0
 26361 00001F61 00                      fm_strat: db	0
 26362 00001F62 00                      fm_argc:  db	0	
 26363                                  
 26364                                  ; UmbLoad is set to UNSPECIFED, below, until /L:umb is read; at which point
 26365                                  ; UmbLoad is set to the UMB number given.
 26366                                  
 26367                                  UNSPECIFIED	equ	-1
 26368                                  
 26369                                  ;%endif ; 27/10/2022

 26497                                  ;ifdef	MULTI_CONFIG
 26498                                  ;
 26499                                  ;  The size of the CONFIG.SYS workspace (for recreating the in-memory
 26500                                  ;  CONFIG.SYS image, and later for building the initial environment) need
 26501                                  ;  not be any larger than CONFIG.SYS itself, EXCEPT for the fact that
 26502                                  ;  we (may) add a variable to the environment that does not explicity appear
 26503                                  ;  in CONFIG.SYS, and that variable is CONFIG (as in CONFIG=COMMON).
 26504                                  ;  The default setting for CONFIG cannot result in more than 1 paragraph

 26559                                  
 26560                                  puteol:

 26569                                  	; 11/12/2022

 26571 00002016 0E                      	push	cs
 26572 00002017 1F                      	pop	ds

 26575

 26577 0000201D 5F                      	pop	di
 26578 0000201E 58                      	pop	ax
 26579                                  
 26580                                  	; 11/12/2022

 26582                                  	;push	cs

 26589 00002024 58                      	pop	ax
 26590 00002025 9D                      	popf
 26591 00002026 7204                    	jc	short conferr 		;we've got a problem

 26594                                  conferr:

 26600                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 26601                                  ;
 26602                                  ; entry : multi_pass

 26609                                  multi_pass:

 26614                                  ;jae_endconv:
 26615 0000203A 731C                    	jae	short endconv 		; do nothing. just return.
 26616                                  
 26617                                  	; 31/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)
 26618 0000203C FF36[A102]              	push	word [CONFBOT]

 26620                                  	;push	word [top_of_cdss]
 26621 00002040 07                      	pop	es			; es = [confbot] (CONFIG.SYS image seg)
 26622                                  
 26623 00002041 8B36[5603]              	mov	si,[org_count]

 26625 00002049 31F6                    	xor	si,si ; 0

 26627 0000204F 8936[AD02]                      mov     [linecount],si		; reset linecount

 26630 00002056 EB07                    	jmp	short conflp
 26631

 26635                                  
 26636                                  getcom:
 26637                                  	; 03/01/2023

 26640 0000205C E8D721                  	call	getchr
 26641                                  conflp: 
 26642 0000205F 72F7                    	jc	short endconv
 26643                                  
 26644 00002061 FF06[AD02]                      inc     word [linecount]	; increase linecount
 26645                                  	
 26646                                  	; 08/09/2023
 26647 00002065 30E4                    	xor	ah,ah ; 0
 26648                                  	;mov	byte [multdeviceflag],0	; reset multdeviceflag.
 26649                                  	;mov	byte [setdevmarkflag],0	; reset setdevmarkflag.
 26650 00002067 8826[C014]              	mov	[multdeviceflag],ah ; 0
 26651 0000206B 8826[C314]              	mov	[setdevmarkflag],ah ; 0
 26652                                  
 26653 0000206F 3C0A                    	cmp	al,lf			; linefeed?
 26654 00002071 7448                    	je	short blank_line	; then ignore this line.
 26655                                  
 26656                                  ; 31/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)
 26657                                  ; (SYSINIT:23CCh)
 26658                                  ; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 26659                                  ;%if 0
 26660                                  
 26661                                  ;ifdef	MULTI_CONFIG
 26662                                  
 26663                                  ;   If this is a genuine CONFIG.SYS command, then there should be a line
 26664                                  ;   number immediately following it....
 26665                                  
 26666 00002073 A2[BE14]                        mov     [config_cmd],al         ; save original command code
 26667                                  	;and	al,NOT CONFIG_OPTION_QUERY
 26668 00002076 247F                    	and	al,~CONFIG_OPTION_QUERY ; and al,7Fh
 26669                                  	
 26670                                  	; 08/09/2023
 26671 00002078 3826[BF14]              	cmp	[config_multi],ah ; 0
 26672                                  	;cmp	byte [config_multi],0	; is this a multi-config config.sys?
 26673 0000207C 7427                            je      short not_final		; no, line number is not embedded
 26674                                  
 26675 0000207E 50                              push    ax                      ;
 26676 0000207F E8B421                          call    getchr                  ; ignore end-of-image errors,
 26677 00002082 88C4                            mov     ah,al                   ; because if there's an error
 26678 00002084 E8AF21                          call    getchr                  ; fetching the line number that's
 26679 00002087 86C4                            xchg    al,ah                   ; supposed to be there, the next
 26680 00002089 A3[AD02]                        mov     [linecount],ax          ; getchr call will get the same error
 26681 0000208C 58                              pop     ax
 26682                                  ;
 26683                                  ;   HACK: when 4DOS.COM is the shell and it doesn't have an environment from
 26684                                  ;   which to obtain its original program name, it grovels through all of
 26685                                  ;   memory to find the filename that was used to exec it; it wants to find
 26686                                  ;   the SHELL= line in the in-memory copy of CONFIG.SYS, and it knows that
 26687                                  ;   sysinit converts the SHELL= keyword to an 'S', so it expects to find an 'S'
 26688                                  ;   immediately before the filename, but since we are now storing line # info
 26689                                  ;   in the config.sys memory image, 4DOS fails to find the 'S' in the right
 26690                                  ;   spot.
 26691                                  ;
 26692                                  ;   So, on the final pass of CONFIG.SYS, copy the command code (eg, 'S')
 26693                                  ;   over the line number info, since we no longer need that info anyway. This
 26694                                  ;   relies on the fact that getchr leaves ES:SI pointing to the last byte
 26695                                  ;   retrieved.
 26696                                  ;
 26697 0000208D 803E[CB02]02                    cmp	byte [multi_pass_id],2	; final pass?
 26698 00002092 7211                            jb	short not_final		; no
 26699                                          ;test	word [install_flag],have_install_cmd
 26700 00002094 F606[CC02]01            	test	byte [install_flag],have_install_cmd ; 1
 26701 00002099 7407                            jz	short final		; no install cmds, so yes it is
 26702 0000209B 803E[CB02]03                    cmp	byte [multi_pass_id],3	; final pass?
 26703 000020A0 7203                            jb	short not_final		; no
 26704                                  final:                                  ;
 26705 000020A2 268804                  	mov	[es:si],al		; save backward-compatible command code
 26706                                  not_final:                              ;
 26707                                  ;endif
 26708                                  
 26709                                  ; 31/12/2022
 26710                                  ;%endif ; 27/10/2022
 26711                                  
 26712 000020A5 88C4                    	mov	ah,al
 26713 000020A7 E88C21                  	call	getchr
 26714 000020AA 7314                    	jnc	short tryi
 26715                                  
 26716 000020AC 803E[CB02]02            	cmp	byte [multi_pass_id],2
 26717                                  	;jae	short jae_endconv	; do not show badop again for multi_pass.
 26718                                  	; 27/10/2022
 26719 000020B1 73A5                    	jnb	short endconv	
 26720 000020B3 E95508                  	jmp	badop
 26721                                  	
 26722                                  coff:	
 26723                                  	; 11/12/2022
 26724                                  	; ds = cs
 26725                                  	;push	cs
 26726                                  	;pop	ds
 26727 000020B6 E87421                  	call	newline
 26728 000020B9 EBA4                    	jmp	short conflp	; 13/05/2019
 26729                                  
 26730                                  blank_line:
 26731 000020BB E87821                  	call	getchr
 26732 000020BE EB9F                    	jmp	short conflp
 26733                                  
 26734                                  	; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 26735                                  ; 11/12/2022
 26736                                  ; (there is not a jump or call to here from anywhere!)
 26737                                  ;coff_p:
 26738                                  	;push	cs
 26739                                  	;pop	ds
 26740                                  
 26741                                  ;to handle install= commands,we are going to use multi-pass.
 26742                                  ;the first pass handles the other commands and only set install_flag when
 26743                                  ;it finds any install command. the second pass will only handle the
 26744                                  ;install= command.
 26745                                  
 26746                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 26747                                  ;install command
 26748                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 26749                                  
 26750                                  	; 27/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 26751                                  	; (SYSINIT:2250h)
 26752                                  tryi:
 26753 000020C0 803E[CB02]00            	cmp	byte [multi_pass_id],0	; the initial pass for DOS=HI
 26754 000020C5 7503                    	jne	short not_init_pass
 26755 000020C7 E97F01                  	jmp	multi_try_doshi
 26756                                  not_init_pass:
 26757 000020CA 803E[CB02]02            	cmp	byte [multi_pass_id],2	; the second pass was for ifs=
 26758                                          ; 11/12/2022
 26759                                  	;je	short multi_pass_coff2	; now it is NOPs
 26760 000020CF 74E5                    	je	short coff
 26761                                  	; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 26762                                  	;je	short multi_pass_coff	
 26763                                  					; This pass can be made use of if
 26764                                  					; we want do some config.sys process
 26765                                  					; after device drivers are loaded
 26766                                  					; and before install= commands
 26767                                  					; are processed
 26768                                  
 26769 000020D1 803E[CB02]03            	cmp	byte [multi_pass_id],3	; the third pass for install= ?
 26770 000020D6 741D                    	je	short multi_try_i
 26771 000020D8 80FC48                          cmp     ah, CONFIG_DOS  ; 'H'
 26772                                  	; 11/12/2022
 26773                                  	;je	short multi_pass_coff2
 26774 000020DB 74D9                    	je	short coff
 26775                                  	; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 26776                                  	;je	short multi_pass_coff	
 26777                                  
 26778                                  ;       make note of any INSTALL= or INSTALLHIGH= commands we find,
 26779                                  ;       but don't process them now.        
 26780                                          
 26781 000020DD 80FC49                          cmp     ah,CONFIG_INSTALL ; 'I'	; install= command?
 26782                                  	; 31/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)
 26783 000020E0 7507                    	jne	short precheck_installhigh ; the first pass is for normal operation.
 26784                                  	; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 26785                                  	;jne	short tryb	
 26786                                  	
 26787                                  	;or	word [install_flag],have_install_cmd ; set the flag
 26788 000020E2 800E[CC02]01            	or	byte [install_flag],have_install_cmd ; 1
 26789                                  multi_pass_coff2:
 26790 000020E7 EBCD                    	jmp	short coff ; 13/05/2019	; and handles the next command
 26791                                  
 26792                                  ; 31/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)
 26793                                  ; (SYSINIT:2448h)
 26794                                  ; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 26795                                  ;%if 0

 26896                                  ;******************************************************************************
 26897                                  ;									      *
 26898                                  ; function: parse the parameters of buffers= command.			      *
 26899                                  ;									      *
 26900                                  ; input :								      *
 26901                                  ;	es:si -> parameters in command line.				      *
 26902                                  ; output:								      *
 26903                                  ;	buffers set							      *
 26904                                  ;	buffer_slash_x	flag set if /x option chosen.			      *
 26905                                  ;	h_buffers set if secondary buffer cache specified.		      *

 26908                                  ;	sysinit_parse							      *

 26922                                  ;	  else	{show error message;error exit} 			      *
 26923                                  ;	};								      *
 26924                                  ;	if (buffer_slash_x is off & buffers > 99) then show_error;	      *
 26925                                  ; };									      *
 26926                                  ;									      *

 27022                                  ;****************************************************************************

 27690                                  skip_pass_limit:
 27691                                  ;	Note: sysi_numio (in DOS DATA) currently reflects the REAL
 27692                                  ;	number of installed devices (including DblSpace drives) where
 27693                                  ;	"drivenumber" is the number that the next block device will
 27694                                  ;	be assigned to. Because some naughty device drivers (like
 27695                                  ;	interlnk) look at the internal DOS variable instead of the
 27696                                  ;	value we pass it, we'll temporarily stick our value into
 27697                                  ;	DOS DATA while we're initializing the device drivers.
 27698                                  ;
 27699                                  ;	Note that this will make it impossible for this device
 27700                                  ;	driver to access the DblSpace drive letters, whether
 27701                                  ;	they are swapped-hosts or unswapped compressed drives,
 27702                                  ;	during its initialization phase.
 27703                                  
 27704                                  ; 31/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)
 27705                                  ; (SYSINIT:2752h)

 27710                                  	
 27711                                  	;lds	bx,[cs:DOSINFO]		; ds:bx -> sys_var
 27712                                  	; 31/12/2022
 27713                                  	; ds = cs
 27714                                  	; 08/09/2023
 27715                                  	;lds	bx,[DOSINFO]		; ds:bx -> sys_var
 27716                                  
 27717                                  	;mov	al,[cs:drivenumber]	; temporarily use this next drv value
 27718                                  	;mov	[cs:devdrivenum],al	; pass drive number in packet to driver
 27719                                  	;mov	ah,al
 27720                                  
 27721                                  	; 08/09/2023
 27722                                  	; ds = cs

 27724 000023A5 A2[7E03]                	mov	[devdrivenum],al	; pass drive number in packet to driver
 27725 000023A8 88C4                    	mov	ah,al
 27726 000023AA C51E[6B02]              	lds	bx,[DOSINFO]		; ds:bx -> sys_var
