 28631                                  
 28632                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28633                                  ; setting internal stack parameters
 28634                                  ; stacks=m,n where
 28635                                  ;	m is the number of stacks (range 8 to 64,default 9)
 28636                                  ;	n is the stack size (range 32 to 512 bytes,default 128)
 28637                                  ; j.k. 5/5/86: stacks=0,0 implies no stack installation.
 28638                                  ;	any combinations that are not within the specified limits will
 28639                                  ;	result in "unrecognized command" error.
 28640                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28641                                  
 28642                                  ;**************************************************************************
 28643                                  ;									  *
 28644                                  ; function: parse the parameters of stacks= command.			  *
 28645                                  ;	    the minimum value for "number of stacks" and "stack size" is  *
 28646                                  ;	    8 and 32 each.  in the definition of sysparse value list,they *
 28647                                  ;	    are set to 0.  this is for accepting the exceptional case of  *
 28648                                  ;	    stacks=0,0 case (,which means do not install the stack.)	  *
 28649                                  ;	    so,after sysparse is done,we have to check if the entered	  *
 28650                                  ;	    values (stack_count,stack_size) are within the actual range,  *
 28651                                  ;	    (or if "0,0" pair has been entered.)			  *
 28652                                  ; input :								  *
 28653                                  ;	es:si -> parameters in command line.				  *
 28654                                  ; output:								  *
 28655                                  ;	set the variables stack_count,stack_size.			  *
 28656                                  ;									  *
 28657                                  ; subroutines to be called:						  *
 28658                                  ;	sysinit_parse							  *
 28659                                  ; logic:								  *
 28660                                  ; {									  *
 28661                                  ;	set di points to stks_parms;					  *
 28662                                  ;	set dx,cx to 0; 						  *
 28663                                  ;	while (end of command line)					  *
 28664                                  ;	{ sysinit_parse;						  *
 28665                                  ;	  if (no error) then						  *
 28666                                  ;	     { if (cx == 1) then /* first positional = stack count */	  *
 28667                                  ;		   p_stack_count = result_val._$P_picked_val;		  *
 28668                                  ;	       if (cx == 2) then /* second positional = stack size */	  *
 28669                                  ;		   p_stack_size = result_val._$P_picked_val;		  *
 28670                                  ;	     }								  *
 28671                                  ;	  else	/*error exit*/						  *
 28672                                  ;	     error exit;						  *
 28673                                  ;	};								  *
 28674                                  ;	here check p_stack_count,p_stack_size if it meets the condition;  *
 28675                                  ;	if o.k.,then set stack_count,stack_size;			  *
 28676                                  ;	 else error_exit;						  *
 28677                                  ; };									  *
 28678                                  ;**************************************************************************
 28679                                  
 28680                                  tryk:
 28681                                          ;if      stacksw
 28682                                  
 28683 000026EC 80FC4B                          cmp     ah,CONFIG_STACKS ; 'K'
 28684 000026EF 7402                    	je	short do_tryk
 28685                                  skip_it4:

 29150                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------------
 29151                                  ; switches command
 29152                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------------
 29153                                  
 29154                                  ;***********************************************************************
 29155                                  ;								       *
 29156                                  ; function: parse the option switches specified.		       *
 29157                                  ; note - this command is intended for the future use also.	       *
 29158                                  ; when we need to set system data flag,use this command.	       *
 29159                                  ;								       *
 29160                                  ; input :							       *
 29161                                  ;	es:si -> parameters in command line.			       *
 29162                                  ; output:							       *
 29163                                  ;	p_swit_k set if /k option chosen.			       *
 29164                                  ;								       *
 29165                                  ; subroutines to be called:					       *
 29166                                  ;	sysinit_parse						       *
 29167                                  ; logic:							       *
 29168                                  ; {								       *
 29169                                  ;	set di points to swit_parms;  /*parse control definition*/     *
 29170                                  ;	set dx,cx to 0; 					       *
 29171                                  ;	while (end of command line)				       *
 29172                                  ;	{ sysinit_parse;					       *
 29173                                  ;	  if (no error) then					       *
 29174                                  ;	       if (result_val._$P_synonym_ptr == swit_k) then	       *
 29175                                  ;		    p_swit_k = 1				       *
 29176                                  ;	       endif						       *
 29177                                  ;	  else {show error message;error exit}			       *
 29178                                  ;	};							       *
 29179                                  ; };								       *
 29180                                  ;								       *
 29181                                  ;***********************************************************************
 29182                                  
 29183                                  SUPPRESS_WINA20	EQU 00000010b	; M025 ; (DOSSYM.INC, MSDOS 6.0)

 29424                                  
 29425                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29426                                  ;set up registers for sysparse

 29428                                  ;	di -> offset of the parse control definition.
 29429                                  ;
 29430                                  ;out)	calls sysparse.
 29431                                  ;	carry will set if parse error.
 29432                                  ;	*** the caller should check the eol condition by looking at ax
 29433                                  ;	*** after each call.
 29434                                  ;	*** if no parameters are found,then ax will contain a error code.
 29435                                  ;	*** if the caller needs to look at the synomym@ of the result,
 29436                                  ;	***  the caller should use cs:@ instead of es:@.
 29437                                  ;	cx register should be set to 0 at the first time the caller calls this
 29438                                  ;	 procedure.
 29439                                  ;	ax - exit code
 29440                                  ;	bl - terminated delimeter code
 29441                                  ;	cx - new positional ordinal
 29442                                  ;	si - set to pase scanned operand

 29444                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------

 29676                                  ;
 29677                                  ; procedure : showlinenum
 29678                                  ;
 29679                                  ; convert the binary linecount to decimal ascii string in showcount
 29680                                  ; and display showcount at the current curser position.
 29681                                  ; in.) linecount
 29682                                  ;
 29683                                  ; out) the number is printed.
 29684                                  ;
 29685                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29686                                  
 29687                                  	; 11/12/2022
 29688                                  	; ds = cs
 29689                                  	; 24/10/2022
 29690                                  showlinenum:
 29691 00002945 06                      	push	es
 29692                                  	; 11/12/2022
 29693                                  	;push	ds
 29694 00002946 57                      	push	di
 29695                                  
 29696 00002947 0E                      	push	cs
 29697 00002948 07                      	pop	es		; es=cs
 29698                                  
 29699                                  	; 11/12/2022
 29700                                  	;push	cs
 29701                                  	;pop	ds
 29702                                  
 29703 00002949 BF[B302]                	mov	di,showcount+4	; di -> the least significant decimal field.
 29704 0000294C B90A00                  	mov	cx,10		; decimal divide factor
 29705                                  	;mov	ax,[cs:linecount]
 29706                                  	; 11/12/2022
 29707 0000294F A1[AD02]                	mov	ax,[linecount]
 29708                                  sln_loop:
 29709                                  	; 11/12/2022
 29710 00002952 39C8                    	cmp	ax,cx ; < 10 ?
 29711                                  	;cmp	ax,10		; < 10?
 29712 00002954 720C                    	jb	short sln_last  ; yes
 29713                                  
 29714 00002956 31D2                    	xor	dx,dx
 29715 00002958 F7F1                    	div	cx	; cx = 10
 29716 0000295A 80CA30                  	or	dl,30h		; add "0" (= 30h) to make it an ascii.
 29717                                  				; convert to ascii numeric char ("0" to "9")
 29718 0000295D 8815                    	mov	[di],dl
 29719 0000295F 4F                      	dec	di
 29720 00002960 EBF0                    	jmp	short sln_loop
 29721                                  
 29722                                  sln_last:
 29723 00002962 0C30                    	or	al,30h	; "0"   ; convert to ascii numeric char ("0" to "9")
 29724 00002964 8805                    	mov	[di],al
 29725 00002966 89FA                    	mov	dx,di
 29726 00002968 E8701B                  	call	print		; show it.
 29727 0000296B 5F                      	pop	di
 29728                                  	; 11/12/2022
 29729                                  	;pop	ds
 29730 0000296C 07                      	pop	es
 29731 0000296D C3                      	retn

 29789                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29790                                  ;
 29791                                  ; procedure : LieInt12Mem
 29792                                  ;
 29793                                  ;	Input : DevEntry points to Device Start address (offset == 0)
 29794                                  ;		alloclim set to the limit of low memory.
 29795                                  ;
 29796                                  ;	Output : none
 29797                                  ;
 29798                                  ;	Changes the ROM BIOS variable which stores the total low memory
 29799                                  ;	If a 3com device driver (any character device with name 'PROTMAN$')
 29800                                  ;	is being loaded alloclim is converted into Ks and stored in 40:13h
 29801                                  ;	Else if a device driver being loaded into UMB the DevLoadEnd is
 29802                                  ;	converted into Ks and stored in 40:13h
 29803                                  ;
 29804                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29805                                  
 29806                                  LieInt12Mem:
 29807                                  	; 11/12/2022
 29808                                  	; ds = cs
 29809 00002991 A1[A302]                	mov	ax,[ALLOCLIM]
 29810                                  	;mov	ax,[cs:ALLOCLIM]	; lie INT 12h as alloclim
 29811                                  					; assuming that it is 3Com
 29812 00002994 E84400                  	call	IsIt3Com		; Is it 3Com driver?
 29813 00002997 740A                    	jz	short lim_set		; yes, lie to him differently
 29814                                  	; 13/05/2019
 29815                                  	;cmp	byte [cs:DeviceHi],0	; Is the DD being loaded in UMB
 29816                                  	;je	short limx		; no, don't lie
 29817                                  	;mov	ax,[cs:DevLoadEnd]	; lie INT 12h as end of UMB
 29818                                  	; 11/12/2022
 29819                                  	; ds = cs

 29821 0000299E 74F0                    	je	short limx
 29822 000029A0 A1[671F]                	mov	ax,[DevLoadEnd]
 29823                                  lim_set:
 29824                                  	; 01/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 29825                                  	; 11/12/2022
 29826                                  	;call	SetInt12Mem
 29827                                  ;limx:
 29828                                  	;retn
 29829                                  	
 29830                                  	;jmp	short SetInt12Mem 
 29831                                  
 29832                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29833                                  ;
 29834                                  ; procedure : SetInt12Mem
 29835                                  ;
 29836                                  ;	Input : AX = Memory size to be set (in paras)
 29837                                  ;	Output : none
 29838                                  ;
 29839                                  ;	Sets the variable 40:13 to the memory size passed in AX
 29840                                  ;	It saves the old value in 40:13 in OldInt12Mem,
 29841                                  ;	It also sets a flag Int12Lied to 0ffh, which is checked before
 29842                                  ;	restoring the value of 40:13
 29843                                  ;
 29844                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29845                                  
 29846                                  	; 01/11/2022
 29847                                  SetInt12Mem:
 29848 000029A3 1E                      	push	ds
 29849 000029A4 BB4000                  	mov	bx,40h
 29850 000029A7 8EDB                    	mov	ds,bx			; ROM BIOS Data Segment
 29851 000029A9 8B1E1300                	mov	bx,[13h]		; INT 12 memory variable
 29852 000029AD 2E891E[851F]            	mov	[cs:OldInt12Mem],bx	; save it
 29853 000029B2 B106                    	mov	cl,6
 29854 000029B4 D3E8                    	shr	ax,cl			; convert paras into Ks
 29855 000029B6 A31300                  	mov	[13h],ax		; Lie
 29856 000029B9 2EC606[841F]FF          	mov	byte [cs:Int12Lied],0FFh ; mark that we are lying
 29857 000029BF 1F                      	pop	ds
 29858                                  ;limx:
 29859 000029C0 C3                      	retn
 29860                                  
 29861                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29862                                  ;
 29863                                  ; procedure : TrueInt12Mem
 29864                                  ;
 29865                                  ;	Input : Int12Lied = 0 if we are not lying currently
 29866                                  ;			  = 0ffh if we are lying
 29867                                  ;		OldInt12Mem = Saved value of 40:13h
 29868                                  ;
 29869                                  ;	Output : none
 29870                                  ;
 29871                                  ;	Resets the INT 12 Memory variable if we were lying about int 12
 29872                                  ;	and resets the flag which indicates that we were lying
 29873                                  ;
 29874                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29875                                  
 29876                                  TrueInt12Mem:
 29877                                  	; 11/12/2022
 29878                                  	; ds = cs
 29879 000029C1 803E[841F]00            	cmp	byte [Int12Lied],0
 29880                                  	;cmp	byte [cs:Int12Lied],0	; were we lying so far?
 29881                                  	; 01/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYS.INIT:2B1Dh)
 29882                                  	;mov	byte [cs:Int12Lied],0	; reset it anyway
 29883 000029C6 7412                    	je	short timx		; no, we weren't
 29884                                  	; 18/12/2022
 29885 000029C8 B84000                  	mov	ax,40h
 29886 000029CB 8826[841F]              	mov	[Int12Lied],ah ; 0
 29887                                  	;mov	byte [Int12Lied],0
 29888                                  	;mov	byte [cs:Int12Lied],0
 29889 000029CF 1E                      	push	ds
 29890                                  	;mov	ax,40h
 29891 000029D0 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax
 29892 000029D2 2EA1[851F]              	mov	ax,[cs:OldInt12Mem]
 29893 000029D6 A31300                  	mov	[13h],ax		; restore INT 12h memory
 29894 000029D9 1F                      	pop	ds
 29895                                  timx:
 29896 000029DA C3                      	retn
 29897

 29949                                  ; 31/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)

 29951                                  
 29952                                  ;include highload.inc	; Routines for devicehigh parsing, control of HIDDEN
 29953                                  ;include highexit.inc	; umb's, etc
 29954                                  
 29955                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 29956                                  ; HIGHLOAD.INC (MSDOS 6.0 - 1991) 	
 29957                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 29958                                  ; 07/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 29959                                  
 29960                                  ;******************************************************************************
 29961                                  ;
 29962                                  ; This file contains routines needed to parse and implement user-given
 29963                                  ; command-line options of the form "/S/L:3,0x500;2;7,127;0x0BE4". InitVar()
 29964                                  ; and Parsevar() are used to parse this data and place it in encoded form into
 29965                                  ; the variables in highvar.inc, for use by the rest of the routines.
 29966                                  ;
 29967                                  ; DeviceHigh accepts this command-line (handled in sysconf.asm, not here):
 29968                                  ;    DEVICEHIGH SIZE=hhhhhh module opts
 29969                                  ; Or, DeviceHigh and LoadHigh accept any of the following:
 29970                                  ;    DH/LH module opts
 29971                                  ;    DH/LH [/S][/L:umb[,size][;umb[,size]]*] module opts
 29972                                  ;    DH/LH [/L:umb[,size][;umb[,size]]*][/S] module opts
 29973                                  ; The initial UMB,SIZE pair designates the module's load address; the remainder
 29974                                  ; of the UMB and SIZE pairs are used to indicate specific UMBs to be left
 29975                                  ; available during the load.
 29976                                  ;
 29977                                  ; When an actual load is ready to be performed, a call to HideUMBs() will
 29978                                  ; temporarily allocate (as owner 8+"HIDDEN  ") all free elements in any
 29979                                  ; upper-memory block which was not specified by the user... in addition, if
 29980                                  ; UMBs were marked to shrink (/S option) to a certain size ("umb,size"), any
 29981                                  ; elements in that umb SAVE the lower-half of the newly-shrunken one are also
 29982                                  ; allocated. After the load, the function UnHideUMBs() (in highexit.inc) will
 29983                                  ; free any UMBs so allocated.
 29984                                  ;
 29985                                  ; When a device driver loads, there is the additional problem of allocating its
 29986                                  ; initial load site; this should be restricted to the first UMB specified on
 29987                                  ; the command-line. The function FreezeUM temporarily allocates all remaining
 29988                                  ; free upper-memory elements (as owner 8+"FROZEN  "), except those in the load
 29989                                  ; UMB. Then the initial allocation may be made, and a call to UnFreeze will
 29990                                  ; return any so-allocated memory elements to FREE, for the true load. Note
 29991                                  ; that UnFreeze leaves HIDDEN elements allocated; it only frees FROZEN ones.
 29992                                  ;
 29993                                  ;******************************************************************************
 29994                                  
 29995                                  SWTCH	equ	'/'		; Switch character
 29996                                  
 29997                                  DOS_CHECK_STRATEGY  equ	5800h	; Int 21h, Func 58h, Svc 0 = check alloc strat
 29998                                  DOS_SET_STRATEGY    equ	5801h	; Int 21h, Func 58h, Svc 1 = set alloc strategy
 29999                                  DOS_CHECK_UMBLINK   equ	5802h	; Int 21h, Func 58h, Svc 2 = check link state
 30000                                  DOS_GET_UMBLINK	    equ 5802h ; 20/04/2019
 30001                                  DOS_SET_UMBLINK     equ	5803h	; Int 21h, Func 58h, Svc 3 = set link state
 30002                                  DOS_GET_DOS_LISTS   equ	  52h	; Int 21h, Func 52h = return list of lists
 30003                                  DOS_UMB_HEAD        equ	  8Ch	; Offset from ES (after func52h) to get UMBHead
 30004                                  
 30005                                  CR	equ	0Dh		; Carriage Return
 30006                                  LF	equ	0Ah		; Line Feed
 30007                                  TAB	equ	09h		; Tab character (^I)
 30008                                  
 30009                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30010                                  ;*** InitVar - initializes all the variables used in ParseVar and HideUMBs
 30011                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30012                                  ; ENTRY:       None
 30013                                  ; EXIT:        Variables listed in highvar.inc are initialized
 30014                                  ; ERROR EXIT:  None
 30015                                  ; USES:        Flags, variables in highvar.inc
 30016                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30017                                  ; Note that element 0 references UMB 0 (conventional), not UMB 1. Its contents
 30018                                  ; are largely ignored, but it is initialized nonetheless.
 30019                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30020                                  
 30021                                  ; 01/01/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)
 30022                                  ; (SYSINIT:2EEEh)
 30023                                  
 30024                                  InitVar:
 30025                                  	; 01/01/2023
 30026                                  	; ds = cs
 30027                                  
 30028                                  	;pushreg <ax, cx, di, es>
 30029                                  	; 03/01/2023
 30030                                  	;push	ax
 30031                                  	;push	cx
 30032                                  	;push	di
 30033 00002A05 06                      	push	es
 30034                                  
 30035                                  	;dataseg es			;Point ES into appropriate data segment
 30036 00002A06 0E                      	push	cs
 30037 00002A07 07                      	pop	es
 30038                                  
 30039 00002A08 31C0                    	xor	ax,ax
 30040                                  	;mov	[es:fUmbTiny],al	;Shrink UMBs? (made 1 if /S given)
 30041                                  	;mov	[es:fInHigh],al		;Set to 1 when DH/LH has been called
 30042                                  	;mov	[es:SegLoad],ax		;Load Address (seg), used for DH only
 30043                                  	;mov	byte [es:UmbLoad],UNSPECIFIED ; 0FFh
 30044                                  	;				;Later is the # of the 1st spec'd UMB
 30045                                  	;mov	[es:fm_argc], al	;Start with zero args having been read
 30046                                  
 30047                                  	; 01/01/2023
 30048                                  	; ds = cs
 30049 00002A0A A2[2C1F]                	mov	[fUmbTiny],al		;Shrink UMBs? (made 1 if /S given)
 30050 00002A0D A2[2B1F]                	mov	[fInHigh],al		;Set to 1 when DH/LH has been called
 30051 00002A10 A3[2D1F]                	mov	[SegLoad],ax		;Load Address (seg), used for DH only
 30052 00002A13 C606[2F1F]FF            	mov	byte [UmbLoad],UNSPECIFIED ; 0FFh
 30053                                  					;Later is the # of the 1st spec'd UMB
 30054 00002A18 A2[621F]                	mov	[fm_argc], al		;Start with zero args having been read
 30055                                  
 30056 00002A1B FC                      	cld
 30057                                  
 30058 00002A1C B91000                  	mov	cx,MAXUMB ; 16		;For each entry
 30059 00002A1F BF[301F]                	mov	di,UmbUsed		;on the UmbUsed array,
 30060 00002A22 F3AA                    	rep	stosb			;	Store 0
 30061                                  
 30062                                  	;mov	cx,MAXUMB ; 16		;Okay... for each entry
 30063                                  	; 01/01/2033
 30064 00002A24 B110                    	mov	cl,MAXUMB ; 16
 30065 00002A26 BF[401F]                	mov	di,UmbSize		;on the UmbSize array,
 30066 00002A29 F3AB                    	rep	stosw			;	Store 0
 30067                                  
 30068                                  	;normseg es			; Return ES
 30069                                  
 30070                                  	;popreg	<es, di, cx, ax>
 30071 00002A2B 07                      	pop	es
 30072                                  	; 03/01/2023
 30073                                  	;pop	di
 30074                                  	;pop	cx
 30075                                  	;pop	ax	 	
 30076                                  
 30077 00002A2C C3                      	retn
 30078                                  
 30079                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30080                                  ;*** FixMem - scans the upper memory chain and concatenates adjacent free MCBs
 30081                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30082                                  ; ENTRY   : None
 30083                                  ; EXIT    : None
 30084                                  ; ERROR   : None
 30085                                  ; USES    : Flags, fm_umb, fm_strat
 30086                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30087                                  
 30088                                  	; 01/01/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)
 30089                                  	; (SYSINIT:2F22h)
 30090                                  FixMem:
 30091                                  	; 01/01/2023
 30092                                  	;push	ax
 30093                                  	;push	bx
 30094                                  	;push	cx
 30095                                  	;push	dx
 30096 00002A2D 06                      	push	es
 30097                                  
 30098 00002A2E E84900                  	call	fm_link		; Link in UMBs
 30099                                  
 30100 00002A31 E80002                  	call	UmbHead		; Get first upper-memory MCB address (0x9FFF)
 30101 00002A34 723F                    	jc	short fmX	; (if couldn't get it, leave now).
 30102                                  
 30103 00002A36 8EC0                    	mov	es,ax		; It returns in AX, so move it to ES.
 30104                                  
 30105                                  ; - Walk MCB Chain ------------------------------------------------------------
 30106                                  
 30107 00002A38 31D2                    	xor	dx,dx		; We're keeping the address of the last MCB
 30108 00002A3A 89D1                    	mov 	cx,dx		; in CX... and the last owner
 30109 00002A3C 42                      	inc	dx		; in dx as we go through the loop:
 30110                                  
 30111                                  ; ------------------------------------------
 30112                                  ; FM10--DX  = last MCB's owner's PSP address
 30113                                  ;       CX  = last MCB's address (segment)
 30114                                  ; ------------------------------------------
 30115                                  
 30116 00002A3D 26A00000                fm10:	mov	al,[es:ARENA.SIGNATURE] ; if 'Z', don't repeat loop
 30117 00002A41 268B1E0100              	mov	bx,[es:ARENA.OWNER]	; if not zero, do nothing
 30118 00002A46 09D3                    	or	bx,dx			; dx was owner of previous MCB
 30119 00002A48 7516                    	jnz	short fm30		; If not both zero, don't cat.
 30120                                  
 30121                                  	; - Coalesce memory blocks at ES:00 and CX:00 -------------------------
 30122                                  
 30123 00002A4A 268B1E0300              fm20:	mov	bx,[es:ARENA.SIZE]	; Grab this block's Size,
 30124 00002A4F 8EC1                    	mov	es,cx			; Go back to prev MCB's address
 30125 00002A51 26A20000                	mov	[es:ARENA.SIGNATURE],al ; & move the SECOND sig here
 30126                                  
 30127 00002A55 26031E0300              	add	bx,[es:ARENA.SIZE]	; Size += first MCB's size
 30128                                  	;add	bx,1			; And add one for the header
 30129                                  	; 11/07/2023
 30130 00002A5A 43                      	inc	bx
 30131 00002A5B 26891E0300              	mov	[es:ARENA.SIZE],bx	; Write the size
 30132                                  
 30133                                  	; ---------------------------------------------------------------------
 30134                                  
 30135 00002A60 8CC1                    fm30:	mov	cx,es			; Save MCB address
 30136 00002A62 268B160100              	mov	dx,[es:ARENA.OWNER]	; And remember its owner
 30137                                  
 30138 00002A67 8CC3                    	mov	bx,es			; Move to the next MCB
 30139                                  	;add	bx,[es:3]
 30140 00002A69 26031E0300              	add	bx,[es:ARENA.SIZE]
 30141 00002A6E 43                      	inc	bx
 30142 00002A6F 8EC3                    	mov	es,bx
 30143                                  
 30144                                  	;cmp	al,'Z'
 30145 00002A71 3C5A                    	cmp	al,arena_signature_end
 30146 00002A73 75C8                    	jne	short fm10		; If signature != 'Z', there are more.
 30147                                  fmX:	
 30148 00002A75 E81300                  	call	fm_unlink		; Unlink UMBs
 30149                                  
 30150 00002A78 07                      	pop	es
 30151                                  	; 01/01/2023
 30152                                  	;pop	dx
 30153                                  	;pop	cx
 30154                                  	;pop	bx
 30155                                  	;pop	ax
 30156                                  
 30157 00002A79 C3                      	retn
 30158                                  
 30159                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30160                                  ;*** fm_link - links UMBs not already linked in
 30161                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30162                                  ; ENTRY:    None
 30163                                  ; EXIT:     fm_umb == 0 if not linked in previously, 1 if already linked in
 30164                                  ; ERROR:    None
 30165                                  ; USES:     AX, BX, fm_umb
 30166                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30167                                  
 30168                                  	; 01/01/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2
 30169                                  fm_link:
 30170 00002A7A B80258                  	mov	ax,DOS_CHECK_UMBLINK ; 5802h
 30171 00002A7D CD21                    	int	21h			; Current link-state is now in al
 30172                                  
 30173                                  	;putdata fm_umb,al		; So store it in fm_umb for later
 30174                                  	;
 30175                                  	;push	es
 30176                                  	;push	cs
 30177                                  	;pop	es
 30178                                  	;mov	[es:fm_umb],al
 30179                                  	;pop	es
 30180                                  	
 30181                                  	; 01/01/2023
 30182                                  	; ds = cs
 30183                                  	;mov	[cs:fm_umb],al
 30184 00002A7F A2[601F]                	mov	[fm_umb],al
 30185                                  
 30186 00002A82 B80358                  	mov	ax,DOS_SET_UMBLINK ; 5803h
 30187 00002A85 BB0100                  	mov	bx,1
 30188 00002A88 CD21                    	int	21h
 30189 00002A8A C3                      	retn
 30190                                  
 30191                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30192                                  ;*** fm_unlink - unlinks UMBs if fm_umb is set to 0
 30193                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30194                                  ; ENTRY:    fm_umb == 1 : leave linked, else unlink
 30195                                  ; EXIT:     None
 30196                                  ; ERROR:    None
 30197                                  ; USES:     AX, BX
 30198                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30199                                  
 30200                                  	; 01/01/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2
 30201                                  fm_unlink:
 30202 00002A8B 31DB                    	xor	bx,bx
 30203                                  	
 30204                                  	;getdata bl,fm_umb		; fm_umb already has the old link-state
 30205                                  	;

 30221                                  ; 08/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 30222                                  
 30223                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30224                                  ;*** ParseVar - parses [/S][/L:umb[,size][;umb[,size]]*] and builds the table
 30225                                  ; laid out in highvar.inc
 30226                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30227                                  ; ENTRY:    ES:SI points to command tail of LoadHigh/DeviceHigh (whitespace ok)
 30228                                  ; EXIT:     ES:SI points to first character in child program name
 30229                                  ; ERROR:    ES:SI points to character which caused error, carry set, AX == code
 30230                                  ; USES:     ES:SI, AX, flags, variables in highvar.inc
 30231                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30232                                  ; Error codes (in AX if carry set on return):
 30233                                  ;
 30234                                  PV_InvArg	equ	1	; Invalid argument passed
 30235                                  PV_BadUMB	equ	2	; Bad UMB number passed (duplicate?)
 30236                                  PV_InvSwt	equ	3	; Unrecognized switch passed
 30237                                  ;
 30238                                  ; This routine exects ES:SI to point to a string much like the following:
 30239                                  ;    "/S/L:1,200;2 module options"
 30240                                  ; Optionally, the string can begin with whitespace; neither /S nor /L is
 30241                                  ; required, though that's what this routine is supposed to parse.
 30242                                  ;
 30243                                  optS		equ	'S'	; /S
 30244                                  optL		equ	'L'	; /L:...
 30245                                  ;
 30246                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30247                                  ; LoadHigh has a list of arguments, returned by cparse, which is used to create
 30248                                  ; a command-line for spawning a child process. For a typical LH command, say,
 30249                                  ;     lh /l:1,1000;2 print/d:lpt2
 30250                                  ; the arguments would look like (one per line):
 30251                                  ;     lh
 30252                                  ;     /l
 30253                                  ;     1
 30254                                  ;     1000
 30255                                  ;     2
 30256                                  ;     print
 30257                                  ;     /d
 30258                                  ;     :lpt2
 30259                                  ; In short, if "print" were, say, "43", there'd be no way to determine which
 30260                                  ; arg was the filename. So, inside this routine, we keep a running counter
 30261                                  ; of the number of arguments LH will need to skip in order to get to the
 30262                                  ; program name. The "lh" is implicit--it'll always have to skip that. So if
 30263                                  ; there's no "/l" or "/s", fm_argc will be 0 ... other than that, 1 is added
 30264                                  ; for:
 30265                                  ;    Each /L
 30266                                  ;    Each /S (there should be only one)
 30267                                  ;    Each UMB number (they follow ":" or ";")
 30268                                  ;    Each UMB size   (they follow ",")
 30269                                  ; So, in the above example, fm_argc would be 4-- and LH would skip right to
 30270                                  ; "print".  Note that InitVar initializes fm_argc to zero.
 30271                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30272                                  
 30273                                  	; 01/01/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)
 30274                                  	; (SYSINIT:2F9Fh)
 30275                                  
 30276                                  ParseVar:
 30277                                  	;pushreg <di, ds, es>
 30278                                  	; 01/01/2023
 30279                                  	;push	di ; * ; (not required) ; 01/01/2023
 30280 00002A97 1E                      	push	ds
 30281 00002A98 06                      	push	es
 30282                                  
 30283 00002A99 06                      	push	es		; Make DS:SI point to it, as well as ES:SI
 30284 00002A9A 1F                      	pop	ds		; (regardless if we're in devhigh or loadhigh)
 30285 00002A9B FC                      	cld
 30286                                  
 30287                                  ; ------------------------------------------------
 30288                                  ; PV10--ES:SI = any whitespace on the command-line
 30289                                  ; ------------------------------------------------
 30290                                  
 30291 00002A9C AC                      pv10:	lodsb			; here, ES:SI=="  /L..."--must eat whitespace
 30292 00002A9D E8A200                  	call	isWhite
 30293 00002AA0 74FA                    	jz	short pv10	;       ES:SI==" /L..."--keep eating.
 30294                                  	;cmp	al,'/'
 30295 00002AA2 3C2F                    	cmp	al,SWTCH
 30296 00002AA4 7404                    	je	short pv20	;       ES:SI=="/L..."--go process a switch
 30297                                  
 30298 00002AA6 4E                      	dec	si		; Backup--it's now "odule options", and we need
 30299 00002AA7 F8                      	clc			; that "m" we just read (or whatever it is).
 30300 00002AA8 EB2B                    	jmp	short pvX	; Then return with carry clear == we're done.
 30301                                  pv20:	
 30302 00002AAA AC                      	lodsb			; Just read 'S' or 'L', hopefully
 30303                                  	;toUpper al		; So we make it upper-case, and...
 30304 00002AAB 24DF                    	and	al,0DFh
 30305                                  	;cmp	al,'S'
 30306 00002AAD 3C53                    	cmp	al,optS		; just read 'S'?
 30307 00002AAF 750D                    	jne	short pv30
 30308                                  
 30309                                  	;call	incArgc		; If it's /S, it's another arg for LH to skip.
 30310 00002AB1 2EFE06[621F]            	inc	byte [cs:fm_argc] ; 19/04/2019
 30311                                  
 30312                                  	;putdata fUmbTiny,1	; /S, so ES:SI=="  /L..." or " module opts", or
 30313                                  	;
 30314                                  	;push	es
 30315                                  	;push	cs
 30316                                  	;pop	es
 30317                                  	;mov	[es:fUmbTiny],1	
 30318                                  	;pop	es
 30319                                  
 30320 00002AB6 2EC606[2C1F]01          	mov	byte [cs:fUmbTiny],1
 30321                                  
 30322 00002ABC EBDE                    	jmp	short pv10	; possibly even "/L...".
 30323                                  
 30324                                  pv30:	;cmp	al,'L'
 30325 00002ABE 3C4C                    	cmp	al,optL		; If it's not 'L' either, then it's a bad
 30326 00002AC0 750D                    	jne	short pvE1	; switch!
 30327                                  
 30328                                  	;call	incArgc		; If it's /L, it's another arg for LH to skip.
 30329 00002AC2 2EFE06[621F]            	inc	byte [cs:fm_argc] ; 19/04/2019
 30330                                  
 30331 00002AC7 E80E00                  	call	parseL
 30332 00002ACA 73D0                    	jnc	short pv10	; If no carry, go back and look for more
 30333                                  
 30334 00002ACC 4E                      	dec	si		; Else, back up and exit.
 30335 00002ACD EB03                    	jmp	short pvErr	; AX has already been set by parseL
 30336                                  
 30337                                  pvE1:	;mov	ax,3
 30338 00002ACF B80300                  	mov	ax,PV_InvSwt	; Unrecognized switch passed
 30339 00002AD2 4E                      pvErr:	dec	si
 30340 00002AD3 4E                      	dec	si
 30341 00002AD4 F9                      	stc
 30342                                  pvX:	;popreg	<es, ds, di>
 30343 00002AD5 07                      	pop	es
 30344 00002AD6 1F                      	pop	ds
 30345                                  	; 01/01/2023
 30346                                  	;pop	di ; * ; (not required) ; 01/01/2023
 30347 00002AD7 C3                      	retn
 30348                                  
 30349                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30350                                  ;*** parseL - parses ":nnnn[,nnnn][;nnnn[,nnnn]]*" for ParseVar
 30351                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30352                                  ; ENTRY:    ES:SI points to colon
 30353                                  ; EXIT:     ES:SI points to first character not parsed
 30354                                  ; ERROR:    Carry set; rewind three characters and return (see ParseVar)
 30355                                  ; USES:     ES:SI, flags, AX, CX, DX, variables in highvar.inc
 30356                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30357                                  ; If the string here is terminated with anything other than whitespace or a
 30358                                  ; switchchar (perhaps it's /S or another /L:... ), then we return with carry
 30359                                  ; set, indicating that they've screwed up the syntax. The 3-character rewind
 30360                                  ; makes sure the app /L: is reported as being the culprit.
 30361                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30362                                  
 30363                                  parseL:
 30364 00002AD8 AC                      	lodsb
 30365 00002AD9 3C3A                    	cmp	al,':'		; Make sure they did /L:
 30366 00002ADB 754E                    	jne	short plE1	; If they didn't, return with carry set.
 30367                                  
 30368                                  ; ------------------------------------------
 30369                                  ; PL10--ES:SI = a UMB number, after /L: or ;
 30370                                  ; ------------------------------------------
 30371                                  
 30372 00002ADD E8DB00                  pl10:	call	GetXNum		; After this, it's ",size" or ";umb" or " mod"
 30373 00002AE0 724F                    	jc	short plE2	; And error if it's a bad number.
 30374 00002AE2 E89D01                  	call	convUMB		; Convert any address to a UMB number
 30375                                  
 30376 00002AE5 88C1                    	mov	cl,al		; Remember the UMB number
 30377 00002AE7 E87600                  	call	stowUMB		; Mark this UMB # as used;
 30378 00002AEA 7245                    	jc	short plE2	; If it was already marked, it'll error
 30379                                  
 30380                                  	;call	incArgc		; Each UMB number is another arg for LH to skip
 30381 00002AEC 2EFE06[621F]            	inc	byte [cs:fm_argc] ; 08/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 30382                                  
 30383 00002AF1 AC                      	lodsb
 30384 00002AF2 3C3B                    	cmp	al,';'		; Did "umb;" ?
 30385 00002AF4 74E7                    	je	short pl10	; Yep: go back and get another UMB.
 30386                                  
 30387 00002AF6 E84900                  	call	isWhite		; Did "umb " ?
 30388 00002AF9 743B                    	jz	short plX	; Yep: return (it'll go back to whitespace)
 30389                                  
 30390 00002AFB E83900                  	call	isEOL		; Did "umb" ?
 30391 00002AFE 7435                    	jz	short plSwX	; If so, backup and exit like everything's ok
 30392                                  
 30393                                  	;cmp	al,'/'
 30394 00002B00 3C2F                    	cmp	al,SWTCH 	; Did "umb/" ? (as in, "/L:1,100;2/S")
 30395 00002B02 7431                    	je	short plSwX	; If so, back up ES:SI one character and return
 30396                                  
 30397 00002B04 3C2C                    	cmp	al,','		; Did "umb," ?
 30398 00002B06 7523                    	jne	short plE1	; Just what the heck DID they do? Return error.
 30399                                  
 30400                                  ; --- Read a size -------------------------------------------------------------
 30401                                  
 30402 00002B08 E8B000                  	call	GetXNum		; Stop on "size;" or "size " or anything else
 30403 00002B0B 721E                    	jc	short plE1	; And error if it's a bad size.
 30404                                  
 30405 00002B0D E81601                  	call	toPara		; Convert from bytes to paragraphs
 30406                                  
 30407 00002B10 E8CE01                  	call	stowSiz		; CL still has the UMB number for this routine
 30408                                  
 30409                                  	;call	incArgc		; Each UMB size is another arg for LH to skip
 30410 00002B13 2EFE06[621F]            	inc	byte [cs:fm_argc] ; 08/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 30411                                  
 30412 00002B18 AC                      	lodsb
 30413 00002B19 3C3B                    	cmp	al,';'		; They did "umb,size;", so get another UMB.
 30414 00002B1B 74C0                    	je	short pl10	;
 30415                                  
 30416 00002B1D E82200                  	call	isWhite		; Did it end with whitespace?
 30417 00002B20 7414                    	jz	short plX	; If so, we're done here--go back.
 30418                                  
 30419 00002B22 E81200                  	call	isEOL		; Did they do "umb,size" and end??? (stupid)
 30420 00002B25 740E                    	jz	short plSwX	; If so, backup and exit like everything's ok
 30421                                  
 30422                                  	;cmp	al,'/'
 30423 00002B27 3C2F                    	cmp	al,SWTCH	; Did they do "umb,size/" ?
 30424 00002B29 740A                    	je	short plSwX	; If so, again, we're done here.
 30425                                  plE1:	
 30426                                  	;mov	ax,1
 30427 00002B2B B80100                  	mov	ax,PV_InvArg	; If not, we don't know WHAT they did...
 30428 00002B2E 4E                      	dec	si
 30429 00002B2F F9                      	stc
 30430 00002B30 C3                      	retn
 30431

 30436                                  	;stc

 30438                                  plSwX:

 30440                                  				; so the whitespace checker will see it too.

 30444 00002B36 C3                      	retn			; ParseVar will go about its business.

 30559                                  ;*** stowUMB - marks a given UMB as used, if it hasn't been so marked before
 30560                                  ;            -- accepts a UMB # in AL, and makes sure it hasn't yet been

 30671                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30672                                  ;*** toDigit - converts a character-digit to its binary counterpart
 30673                                  ;            -- verifies that CL contains a valid character-digit; if so, it
 30674                                  ; changes CL to its counterpart binary digit ((CL-'0') or (CL-'A'+10)).
 30675                                  ; A-F are considered valid if gnradix is 16.
 30676                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30677                                  ; ENTRY:    CL contains a digit ('0' to '9' or, if gnradix==16, 'A' to 'F')
 30678                                  ; EXIT:     CL contains digit in binary (0 to 9 or, if gnradix==16, 0 to 15)
 30679                                  ; ERROR:    Carry set indicates invalid digit; carry clear indicates good digit
 30680                                  ; USES:     CL, Flags
 30681                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30682                                  ; If the string is preceeded with "0x", the value is read as hexadecimal; else,
 30683                                  ; as decimal. After a read, you may check the radix by examining gnradix--it
 30684                                  ; will be 10 or 16.
 30685                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30686                                  
 30687                                  gnradix:
 30688 00002B85 0000                    	dw	0		; Must be a word--16x16 multiplication
 30689                                  
 30690                                  toDigit:
 30691 00002B87 2E833E[852B]10          	cmp	word [cs:gnradix],16
 30692 00002B8D 751C                    	jne	short td20	; Don't check hex digits if radix isn't 16
 30693                                  
 30694                                  toDigit_hex:
 30695 00002B8F 80F961                  	cmp	cl,'a'	; 61h
 30696 00002B92 7209                    	jb	short td10
 30697 00002B94 80F966                  	cmp	cl,'f'	; 66h
 30698 00002B97 7720                    	ja	short tdE	; Nothing valid above 'f' at all...
 30699 00002B99 80E957                  	sub	cl,'a'-10 ; 57h	; Make 'a'==10 and return.
 30700                                  	;clc			; <- CLC is implicit from last SUB
 30701 00002B9C C3                      	retn
 30702                                  td10:	
 30703 00002B9D 80F941                  	cmp	cl,'A'  ; 41h
 30704 00002BA0 7209                    	jb	short td20	; Below 'A'? Not a letter...
 30705 00002BA2 80F946                  	cmp	cl,'F'	; 46h
 30706 00002BA5 7712                    	ja	short tdE	; Above 'F'? Not a digit.
 30707 00002BA7 80E937                  	sub	cl,'A'-10 ; 37h	; Make 'A'==10 and return.
 30708                                  	;clc			; <- CLC is implicit from last SUB
 30709 00002BAA C3                      	retn
 30710                                  toDigit_dec:
 30711                                  td20:	
 30712 00002BAB 80F930                  	cmp	cl,'0'		; If less than zero,
 30713                                  	;jb	short tdE	; Done.
 30714 00002BAE 720A                    	jb	short tdEr ; 08/04/2019
 30715 00002BB0 80F939                  	cmp	cl,'9'		; Or, if greater than nine,
 30716 00002BB3 7704                    	ja	short tdE	; Done.
 30717 00002BB5 80E930                  	sub	cl,'0'	; 30h	; Okay--make '0'==0 and return.
 30718                                  	;clc			; <- CLC is implicit from last SUB
 30719 00002BB8 C3                      	retn
 30720                                  tdE:	
 30721 00002BB9 F9                      	stc
 30722                                  tdEr:		; 08/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0	
 30723 00002BBA C3                      	retn
 30724                                  
 30725                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30726                                  ;*** GetXNum - reads a 32-bit ASCII number at ES:SI and returns it in DX:AX
 30727                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30728                                  ; ENTRY:    ES:SI points to an ascii string to scan
 30729                                  ; EXIT:     ES:SI moved to first invalid digit, DX:AX contains value read
 30730                                  ; ERROR:    Carry set if # is too big, or has no digits (EOL possibly)
 30731                                  ; USES:     ES:SI, DX, AX, Flags, gnradix
 30732                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30733                                  ; If the string is preceeded with "0x", the value is read as hexadecimal; else,
 30734                                  ; as decimal. After a read, you may check the radix by examining gnradix--it
 30735                                  ; will be 10 or 16.
 30736                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30737                                  
 30738                                  ; 08/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 30739                                  
 30740                                  ; 01/01/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)
 30741                                  ; (SYSINIT:3109h)
 30742                                  
 30743                                  GetXNum:
 30744                                  	;pushreg <bx, cx, ds>
 30745                                  	; 01/01/2023
 30746                                  	;push	bx
 30747 00002BBB 51                      	push	cx ; *
 30748                                  	;push	ds
 30749                                  
 30750 00002BBC FC                      	cld
 30751 00002BBD 31C0                    	xor	ax,ax
 30752 00002BBF 31DB                    	xor	bx,bx
 30753 00002BC1 31C9                    	xor	cx,cx
 30754 00002BC3 31D2                    	xor	dx,dx			; Start with 0 (makes sense)
 30755                                  
 30756 00002BC5 2EC706[852B]0A00        	mov	word [cs:gnradix],10	; And default to a radix of 10 (dec)
 30757                                  
 30758 00002BCC 268A0C                  	mov	cl,[es:si]		; Now AX=0, BX=0, CH=0/CL=char, DX=0
 30759                                  	;call	toDigit
 30760 00002BCF E8D9FF                  	call	toDigit_dec
 30761                                  	;jc	short gxnE		; If it's not a digit, leave now.
 30762                                  	; 01/01/2023
 30763 00002BD2 7233                    	jc	short gxnX
 30764                                  
 30765 00002BD4 08C9                    	or	cl,cl
 30766 00002BD6 7517                    	jnz	short gxn20		; Doesn't have '0x'
 30767 00002BD8 268A4C01                	mov	cl,[es:si+1]
 30768 00002BDC 80F978                  	cmp	cl,'x'			; Either 'x'...
 30769 00002BDF 7405                    	je	short gxn10
 30770 00002BE1 80F958                  	cmp	cl,'X'			; ...or 'X' means it's hexadecimal
 30771 00002BE4 7509                    	jne	short gxn20
 30772                                  
 30773                                  gxn10:	
 30774 00002BE6 2EC706[852B]1000        	mov	word [cs:gnradix], 16
 30775 00002BED 46                      	inc	si			; Since we read "0x", march over it.
 30776 00002BEE 46                      	inc	si
 30777                                  
 30778                                  ; ------------------------------------------------------
 30779                                  ; GXN20--ES:SI = a digit in a number; if not, we're done
 30780                                  ;        DX:AX = current total
 30781                                  ;        BX    = 0
 30782                                  ;        CH    = 0
 30783                                  ; ------------------------------------------------------
 30784                                  
 30785                                  gxn20:	
 30786 00002BEF 268A0C                  	mov	cl,[es:si]	; Now DX:AX=current total, CH=0/CL=char
 30787 00002BF2 46                      	inc	si
 30788                                  
 30789 00002BF3 E891FF                  	call	toDigit		; Accepts only valid digits, A-F -> 10-16
 30790 00002BF6 720D                    	jc	short gxnQ	; <- Ah... wasn't a digit. Stop.
 30791                                  
 30792 00002BF8 E80E00                  	call	mul32		; Multiply DX:AX by gnradix
 30793 00002BFB 720A                    	jc	short gxnX	; (if it's too big, error out)
 30794                                  
 30795 00002BFD 01C8                    	add	ax,cx		; Add the digit
 30796 00002BFF 11DA                    	adc	dx,bx		; (BX is 0!)--Adds 1 if last add wrapped
 30797                                  	;jc	short gxnX	; If _that_ wrapped, it's too big.
 30798                                  	;jmp	short gxn20
 30799 00002C01 73EC                    	jnc	short gxn20
 30800                                  gxnE:	
 30801                                  	;stc			; In this case, we need to set the carry
 30802 00002C03 EB02                    	jmp	short gxnX	; and leave--there were no digits given.
 30803                                  gxnQ:	
 30804 00002C05 4E                      	dec	si		; Don't read in the offensive character.
 30805 00002C06 F8                      	clc			; And clear carry, so they know it's okay.
 30806                                  gxnX:	
 30807                                  	; 01/01/2023
 30808                                  	;pop	ds
 30809 00002C07 59                      	pop	cx ; *
 30810                                  	;pop	bx
 30811 00002C08 C3                      	retn
 30812                                  
 30813                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30814                                  ;*** mul32 - multiplies the number in DX:AX by gnradix
 30815                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30816                                  ; ENTRY:   DX:AX = the number to be multiplied, BX = 0, gnradix = multiplier
 30817                                  ; EXIT:    DX:AX has been multiplied by gnradix if carry clear; BX still 0
 30818                                  ; ERROR:   Carry set if number was too large
 30819                                  ; USES:    Flags, AX, DX
 30820                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30821                                  
 30822                                  mul32:
 30823 00002C09 50                      	push	ax		; DX=old:hi, AX=old:lo, TOS=old:lo, BX=0
 30824 00002C0A 89D0                    	mov	ax,dx		; DX=old:hi, AX=old:hi, TOS=old:lo, BX=0
 30825 00002C0C 2EF726[852B]            	mul	word [cs:gnradix] ; DX=?, AX=new:hi, TOS=old:lo, BX=0
 30826 00002C11 7211                    	jc	short m32E	; Too big?
 30827                                  
 30828 00002C13 89C2                    	mov	dx,ax		; DX=new:hi, AX=new:hi, TOS=old:lo, BX=0
 30829 00002C15 58                      	pop	ax		; DX=new:hi, AX=old:lo, TOS=orig, BX=0
 30830                                  
 30831 00002C16 87D3                    	xchg	dx,bx		; DX=0, AX=old:lo, TOS=orig, BX=new:hi
 30832 00002C18 2EF726[852B]            	mul	word [cs:gnradix] ; DX=carry, AX=new:lo, TOS=orig, BX=new:hi
 30833 00002C1D 87D3                    	xchg	dx,bx		; DX=new:hi, AX=new:lo, TOS=orig, BX=carry
 30834 00002C1F 01DA                    	add	dx,bx		; DX=new:hi, AX=new:lo, TOS=orig, BX=carry
 30835 00002C21 31DB                    	xor	bx,bx		; DX=new:hi, AX=new:lo, TOS=orig, BX=0
 30836 00002C23 C3                      	retn
 30837                                  m32E:	
 30838 00002C24 58                      	pop	ax
 30839 00002C25 C3                      	retn
 30840                                  
 30841                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30842                                  ;*** toPara - divides DX:AX by 16; result in AX only (discards extra DX data)
 30843                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30844                                  ; ENTRY:   DX:AX = the number to be divided
 30845                                  ; EXIT:    Interpereting DX:AX as bytes, AX=paragraph equivalent, 0xFFFF max
 30846                                  ; ERROR:   None
 30847                                  ; USES:    Flags, AX, DX
 30848                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30849                                  ; Note: The 386 has a 32-bit SHR, which would work perfectly for this... but we
 30850                                  ;       can't ensure a 386 host machine. Sorry.
 30851                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30852                                  
 30853                                  	; 01/01/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2
 30854                                  toPara:
 30855 00002C26 51                      	push	cx		; DX:AX=HHHH hhhh hhhh hhhh:LLLL llll llll llll
 30856                                  
 30857 00002C27 B104                    	mov	cl,4		;
 30858 00002C29 D3E8                    	shr	ax,cl		; DX:AX=HHHH hhhh hhhh hhhh:0000 LLLL llll llll
 30859 00002C2B 92                      	xchg	ax,dx		; DX:AX=0000 LLLL llll llll:HHHH hhhh hhhh hhhh
 30860 00002C2C B10C                    	mov	cl,12
 30861 00002C2E D3E0                    	shl	ax,cl		; DX:AX=0000 LLLL llll llll:hhhh 0000 0000 0000
 30862 00002C30 09D0                    	or	ax,dx		;    AX=hhhh LLLL llll llll
 30863                                  
 30864 00002C32 59                      	pop	cx
 30865 00002C33 C3                      	retn
